quacumque: <entryFree id="n39826" type="main" key="qua_cumque_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quā-cumquē</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-cunque</orth>) (in tmesi: <sense id="n39826.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">quā porro cumque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:508" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 508</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quā se cunque tulit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:762" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 762</bibl></cit>), <pos>adv.</pos> </sense><sense id="n39826.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">By whatever way</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wherever</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wheresoever</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">quācumque iter fecit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:16:section=44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 16, § 44</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:68:193" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 68, 193</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quācunque ingredimur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:2:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quācumque custodiant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quācumque equo invectus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:9:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 9, 12</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n39826.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n39826.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Whencesoever</hi>, <hi rend="ital">from what side soever</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hujus erat Minerva spectantem aspectans, quācumque aspiceretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 10, 37, § 120</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39826.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Whithersoever</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quācumque nos commovimus, ad Caesaris acta revocamur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:17:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 14, 17, 6</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n39826.5" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">By whatsoever means</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in whatever way</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nisi me quācumque novas incidere lites monuisset cornix,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:9:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 9, 14</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
quadantenus: <entryFree id="n39827" type="main" key="qua_dante^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quādantĕnus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">quādamtĕnus</orth> (in tmesi, Hor.; <sense id="n39827.0" n="I" level="1"><xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">infra</ref></xr>), <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>quidam-tenus</etym>. </sense><sense id="n39827.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To a certain point</hi> or <hi rend="ital">limit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">so far</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">est quadam prodire tenus, si non datur ultra,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 32</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39827.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to a certain extent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in some measure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">somewhat</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">citreis odor acerrimus, quadantenus et cotoneis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 28, 33, § 110</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rubens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:124" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 24, 14, 76, § 124</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae fuerit origo gemmarum diximus quadantenus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 37</bibl></cit>, prooem. 1, § <cit><quote lang="la">2: ut noctes nostrae quadamtenus his historiae floscuculis aspergerentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:21:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 21, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
quadi: <entryFree id="n39828" type="main" key="Qua_di"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Quādi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n39828.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a German people in the modern Moravia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 42</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">43</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Eutr.</author> 8, 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">9, 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Capitol.</author> Anton. Phil. 14, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
quadra: <entryFree id="n39829" type="main" key="qua_^dra1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quā^dra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n39829.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a square.</hi> </sense><sense id="n39829.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: qui locus gradibus in quadram formatus est, Fest. s. v. Romanam, p. 262 Müll.—</sense><sense id="n39829.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n39829.3" n="A" level="2"> In arch. </sense><sense id="n39829.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The lowest and largest member of the base of a pedestal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the foundation-stone</hi>, <hi rend="ital">socle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">plinth</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 3, 3</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n39829.5" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Any small member for the separation of larger ones</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a platband</hi>, <hi rend="ital">list</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fillet</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 3, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:2" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n39829.6" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A table to eat from</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a dining-table</hi> (as these were usually square; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=118" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 118</bibl> Müll.): <cit><quote lang="la">patulis nec parcere quadris, of the pieces of bread used as plates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 115</bibl></cit>.— Hence, alienā vivere quadrā, <hi rend="ital">to live from another</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s table</hi> (as a parasite), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:5:2" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 5, 2</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n39829.7" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A</hi> (square) <hi rend="ital">bit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">piece</hi>, <hi rend="ital">morsel</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">et mihi dividuo findetur munere quadra,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 17, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">casei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:32:18" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 12, 32, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">placentae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:6:75:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 75, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:92:18" default="NO">9, 92, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">panis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 4:29:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 4, 29, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n39830" type="main" key="Qua_^dra2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Quā^dra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n39830.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman surname</hi>, e. g. Hostius Quadratus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 1:16:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 1, 16, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
quadragenarius: <entryFree id="n39831" type="main" key="qua_^dra_ge_na_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quā^drāgēnārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>quadrageni</etym>, <sense id="n39831.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the number forty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">consisting of forty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of forty</hi>: dolium, perh. <hi rend="ital">holding forty</hi> congii, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 105, 1</bibl>: fistula, <hi rend="ital">a forty-inch pipe</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">made of a plate forty inches in width</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:8:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 8, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">numerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,005:25:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Deut. 25, 3</bibl></cit>: pupillus, <hi rend="ital">of forty</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">forty years old</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 25:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 25, 1</bibl>.—As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">quā^drāgēnārĭus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a man forty years of age</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quadragenarium istum ad te voca,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 2, 60</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
quadrageni: <entryFree id="n39832" type="main" key="qua_^dra_ge_ni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quā^drāgēni</orth>, <itype>ae, a</itype> (<sense id="n39832.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> quadragenūm, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 38</bibl>), <hi rend="ital">num. distrib. adj.</hi> [quadraginta]. </sense><sense id="n39832.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Forty each</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">columnae singulae sestertiis quadragenis milibus locatae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:56:section=147" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 56, § 147</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:18:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 4, 18, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">octoginta confecit centurias, quadragenas seniorum et juniorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pyramides complures quadragenarum ulnarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 13, 19, § 87</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 38</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">septuagies centeni quadrageni fiunt novem milia et octingenti,</quote> <trans><tr>forty each time</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:2:8" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 2, 8</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur. fem.</hi> quadragenae (supply plagae), <hi rend="ital">forty stripes</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,008:11:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Cor. 11, 24</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n39832.2" n="II" level="1"> In gen., for quadraginta, <hi rend="ital">forty</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">centies vicies duceni quadrageni fiunt viginti octo millia et octingenti, i. e. 240X120 =28,800,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
quadragesimus: <entryFree id="n39833" type="main" key="qua_^dra_ge_si^mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quā^drāgēsĭmus</orth> (old form † <orth extent="full" lang="la">quā^-drāgensŭmus</orth>, Num. ap. Eckh. D. N. 6, p. 296), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>quadraginta</etym>. <sense id="n39833.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The fortieth</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pars quadragesima,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 23, 2</bibl></cit>: nono et quadragesimo die, Varr. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:3:10:7" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 3, 10, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">anno fere centesimo et quadragesimo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:15:29" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 15, 29</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:chapter=10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 10</bibl>, <pb n="1499" /> <cb n="QUAD" /> 33, 5: <cit><quote lang="la">pars quadragesima octava,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:1:9" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 1, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 8, 6, § 37</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n39833.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">quā^-drāgēsĭma</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (sc. pars), <hi rend="ital">the fortieth part</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a fortieth</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quadragesima summae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:40" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 40</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39833.2" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n39833.3" n="1" level="3"> As a tax, <hi rend="ital">the fortieth part</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a fortieth</hi> (as with us, a tenth, a tithe): <cit><quote lang="la">abolitio quadragesimae quinquagesimaeque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quadragesimae portorium sive vectigal,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Ep. 5:65" default="NO"><author>Symm.</author> Ep. 5, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">publicum quadragesimae in Asiā egit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:1" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 1</bibl></cit>: C. ATIO ALCIMO FELICIANO ... PROG. QVADRAG. GALLIARVM, Inscr. Maff. Mus. Veron.; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">abbrev., TABVLARIVS XXXX. GALLIAR.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3344</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n39833.4" n="2" level="3"> In eccl. Lat., <hi rend="ital">the Christian fast of forty days</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Lent</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 41, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
quadragies: <entryFree id="n39834" type="main" key="qua_^dra_gi^es"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quā^drāgĭes</orth> (old orthogr. QVA DRAGIENS, Monum. Ancyr. ap. Grut. 230), <pos>adv. num.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n39834.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">forty times</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quadragies quater accusatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Vir. Illustr. 47" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Vir. Illustr. 47</bibl></cit>: sestertium ter et quadragies, <hi rend="ital">the</hi> 4,300,000 <hi rend="ital">sesterces</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 13, 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:55:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 55, 9</bibl> and 12.</sense></entryFree>
quadraginta: <entryFree id="n39835" type="main" key="qua_^dra_ginta_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quā^drāgintā</orth>, <pos>num. adj.</pos> <etym>quattuor</etym>, <sense id="n39835.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">forty</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quattuor quadraginta minae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:1:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 3, 1, 102</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">annos natus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:14:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 14, 39</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:30:52" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 30, 52</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">jugera arvi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:115:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 115, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:2:10" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 2, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:1:13" default="NO">5, 1, 13</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
quadrangulatus: <entryFree id="n39836" type="main" key="qua_^drangu^la_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quā^drangŭlātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>quadrangulus</etym>, <sense id="n39836.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">quadrangular</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">quadrangulata turris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Anim. 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ligna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,013:7:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 3 Reg. 7, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
quadrangulum: <entryFree id="n39837" type="gloss" key="qua_^drangu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quā^drangŭlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>quattuor-angulus</etym>, <sense id="n39837.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a quadrangle</hi>: quadrangulum, <foreign lang="greek">tetra/gwnon,</foreign> Gloss. Lat. Gr.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 7, § 754</bibl> (dub.; al. quadriangulo).</sense></entryFree>
quadrangulus: <entryFree id="n39838" type="main" key="qua_^drangu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quā^drangŭlus</orth>, v. quadriangulus.</entryFree>
quadrans: <entryFree id="n39839" type="main" key="qua_^drans"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quā^drans</orth>, <itype>antis</itype> (<sense id="n39839.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen. plur.</hi> quadrantūm, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Aquaed. 24" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Aquaed. 24</bibl>), <gen>m.</gen> <etym>quattuor</etym>. </sense><sense id="n39839.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A fourth part</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a fourth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a quarter</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">operae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:4:8" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 4, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">diei noctisque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:207" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 25, 57, § 207</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n39839.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n39839.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A fourth part</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a fourth</hi> of a whole: <cit><quote lang="la">creditoribus quadrantem solvi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:23:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 23, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">heres ex quadrante,</quote> <trans><tr>of the fourth part of the inheritance</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:83" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 83</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:5:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 5, 7, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:44:4:17:section=2" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 44, 4, 17, § 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ulp.</author> Frag. 24, 32</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n39839.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The fourth part of an</hi> as (as a coin), <hi rend="ital">three</hi> unciae: <cit><quote lang="la">nota in triente et quadrante rates (fuit). Quadrans antea teruncius vocatus a tribus unciis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 3, 13, § 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quadrans mihi nullus est in arcā,</quote> <trans><tr>not a farthing</tr>, <tr>not a copper</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:2:44:9" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 2, 44, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:18:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 18, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:1:121" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 1, 121</bibl>.—As the customary price of a bath (cf. quadrantarius): <cit><quote lang="la">dum tu quadrante lavatum Rex ibis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 3, 137</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 86:8" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 86, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:446" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 446</bibl>.—As the smallest coin, <hi rend="ital">a mite</hi>, <hi rend="ital">farthing</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 93</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:8" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 7, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:5:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Matt. 5, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,002:12:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Marc. 12, 42</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n39839.5" n="C" level="2"> Of the rate of interest, <hi rend="ital">four for a hundred</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">usurae quadrantes,</quote> <trans><tr>four per cent</tr>.,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:33:1:21" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 33, 1, 21</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39839.6" n="D" level="2"> As a measure of land, <hi rend="ital">a quarter of an acre</hi> (jugerum), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:1:10" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 1, 10</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n39839.7" n="E" level="2"> As a weight, <hi rend="ital">a quarter of a pound</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:105:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 11, 105, 1</bibl>.—With <hi rend="ital">pondo</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">amomi pondo quadrans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:20:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 20, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 84, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quadrans pondo bacarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:156" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23, 8, 80, § 156</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n39839.8" n="F" level="1"> As a measure for liquids, <hi rend="ital">the fourth part of a</hi> sextarius, <hi rend="ital">three</hi> cyathi: <cit><quote lang="la">ita ut earum calices quadrantes octoginta capere possint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:14:4" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 14, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quadrantem duplicare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:94:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9, 94, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:3:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 3, 15</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39839.9" n="G" level="1"> As a measure of length, <hi rend="ital">a quarter of a foot</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pedes duodecim et quadrantem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:3:10:11" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 3, 10, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:9:4:10" default="NO">9, 4, 10</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 18, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">18, 6</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">A quarter-digit</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Aquaed. 25" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Aquaed. 25</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n39839.10" n="H" level="1"> As a measure of time, <hi rend="ital">a fourth of a day</hi>, <hi rend="ital">six hours</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 1, 39</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 41</bibl> sq.</sense></entryFree>
quadrantal: <entryFree id="n39840" type="main" key="qua_^drantal"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quā^drantal</orth>, <itype>ālis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>quadrantalis</etym>. <sense id="n39840.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A liquid measure containing eight</hi> congii, <hi rend="ital">a quadrantal</hi>, Cato ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=258:20" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 258, 20</bibl> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:R. R. 57:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> R. R. 57, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:2:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 1, 2, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 14, 16, § 95</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n39840.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A die</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cube</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:20:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 20, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
quadrantalis: <entryFree id="n39841" type="main" key="qua_^dranta_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quā^drantālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>quadrans</etym>, <sense id="n39841.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">containing the fourth part</hi> of a measure (postAug.): <cit><quote lang="la">mensa crassitudine quadrantali,</quote> <trans><tr>of a quarter of a foot</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 15, 29, § 93</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
quadrantarius: <entryFree id="n39842" type="main" key="qua_^dranta_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quā^drantārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n39842.0" n="I" level="1"> Prop., <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a quarter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">relating to a fourth part</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in tabulis quadrantariis, quas ait ab Hirtuleio institutas,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>new accounts reducing all debts to one fourth</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,007:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Font. 1, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39842.1" n="II" level="1"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">relating to a quarter of an</hi> as (as a coin), <hi rend="ital">that costs a quarter of an</hi> as, etc.: res quadrantaria, i. e. <hi rend="ital">a bath</hi> (because a quarter of an as was the price of a bath; <cit><quote lang="la">v. quadrans, II. B),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 86:8" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 86, 8</bibl></cit>: mulier, of Clodia, wife of Metellus, who sold herself for a bath, Cic. <cb n="QUAD" /> Cael. 26, 62; she is also called Clytaemnestra quadrantaria, because, like Clytaemnestra, she destroyed her husband, Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:6:53" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 6, 53</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
quadratarius: <entryFree id="n39843" type="main" key="qua_^dra_ta_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quā^drātārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>quadratus</etym>, <sense id="n39843.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to work with the square</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to the work of the stone-cutter</hi>: OPVS, perh. <hi rend="ital">a stone monument</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Murat.</author> 2012, 2</bibl>.— As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">quā^drātārĭus</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a stonecutter</hi> (post-class.), interchanged with lapidicida, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 3, 12</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 10, 64, 1</bibl>; Auct. Limit. p. 294 Goes.</sense></entryFree>
quadrate: <entryFree id="n39844" type="main" key="qua_^dra_te_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quā^drātē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. quadro, <sense id="n39844.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">P. a. fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
quadratilla: <entryFree id="n39845" type="main" key="Qua_^dra_tilla"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Quā^drātilla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n39845.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman female name</hi>, e. g. Ummilia, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:7:24:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 7, 24, 7</bibl>; cf. Inscr Murat. 3, 27, 5.</sense></entryFree>
quadratim: <entryFree id="n39846" type="gloss" key="qua_^dra_tim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quā^drātim</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>quadratus</etym>, <sense id="n39846.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fourfold</hi>, acc. to <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 168</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
quadratio: <entryFree id="n39847" type="main" key="qua_^dra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quā^drātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n39847.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a square</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quadrate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">agatur linea rotundationis, quae quadrationis angulos tangat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:4:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 4, 3, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
quadrator: <entryFree id="n39848" type="main" key="qua_^dra_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quā^drātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>quadro</etym>, <sense id="n39848.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a stonecutter</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">marmorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Ep. 2, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
quadratum: <entryFree id="n39849" type="main" key="qua_^dra_tum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quā^drātum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, v. quadro <sense id="n39849.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
quadratura: <entryFree id="n39850" type="main" key="qua_^dra_tu_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quā^drātūra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>quadro</etym>. <sense id="n39850.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A making square</hi>, <hi rend="ital">squaring</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quadrature</hi> (postclass.): circuli quadratura, <hi rend="ital">the squaring</hi> or <hi rend="ital">quadrature of the circle</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Dogm. Plat. 3, p. 37, 11</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n39850.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a square</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitreae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vop.</author> Firm. 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
quadratus: <entryFree id="n39851" type="main" key="qua_^dra_tus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quā^drātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, v. quadro.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n39852" type="main" key="qua_^dra_tus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quā^drātus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, v. quadro <sense id="n39852.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n39853" type="main" key="Quadra_tus3" n="3"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Quadrātus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n39853.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman surname</hi>, e. g. Ummilius Quadratus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:6:11:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 6, 11, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:24:6" default="NO" valid="yes">7, 24, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
quadriangulus: <entryFree id="n39854" type="main" key="qua_^dri^angu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quā^drĭangŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>quattuor-angulus</etym>, <sense id="n39854.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">four-cornered</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quadrangular</hi> (post-Aug.); <cit><quote lang="la">figura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 22, 38, § 118</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">herba quadriangulo caule,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 25, 6, 27, § 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">membrum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Epigr. 128</bibl></cit>. — As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">quădrĭangŭlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a quadrilateral figure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quadrangle</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> Fig. Num. p. 417</bibl>; cf. quadrangulum.</sense></entryFree>
quadribaccium: <entryFree id="n39855" type="gloss" key="qua_^dri^bacci^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quā^drĭbaccĭum</orth> and ‡ <orth extent="full" lang="la">quā^drĭ-bacĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>quattuor-bacca</etym>, <sense id="n39855.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fourbeads</hi>, <hi rend="ital">four-pearls</hi>, an ornament composed of four pearls, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Murat.</author> 139, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
quadriburgium: <entryFree id="n39856" type="main" key="Qua_^dri^burgi^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Quā^drĭburgĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n39856.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a fortified town in Gallia Belgica</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 18, 2, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2090</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
quadribus: <entryFree id="n39857" type="main" key="quadri^bus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quadrĭbus</orth>, v. quadrivius.</entryFree>
quadridens: <entryFree id="n39858" type="main" key="qua_^dri^dens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quā^drĭdens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>quattuordens</etym>, <sense id="n39858.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">four - toothed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">having four teeth</hi> (ante - class.): <cit><quote lang="la">rastri quadridentes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 10, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">11, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
quadriduanus: <entryFree id="n39859" type="main" key="qua_^dri^du^a_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quā^drĭdŭānus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">quā^trĭd-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>quadriduum</etym>, <sense id="n39859.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of four days</hi>, <hi rend="ital">for the space of four days</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Lazarus mortuus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 108</bibl></cit>, n. 24; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,004:11:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Joan. 11, 39</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
quadriduum: <entryFree id="n39860" type="main" key="qua_^dri^du^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quā^drĭdŭum</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">quā^trĭd-</orth>), <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>quattuor-dies</etym>, <sense id="n39860.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a space of four days</hi>, <hi rend="ital">four days</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">in hoc triduo aut quadriduo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:1:1:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 1, 1, 37</bibl></cit>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 65, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">113, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:3:section=6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 3, § 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:4:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 4, 11</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 38, 82</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:7:15" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 7, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quadriduo quo haec gesta sunt,</quote> <trans><tr>four days after</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:7:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 7, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quadriduum per vastas solitudines absumptum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 22, 24, § 86</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
quadriennis: <entryFree id="n39861" type="main" key="qua_^dri^ennis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quā^drĭennis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>quattuor-annus</etym>, <sense id="n39861.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of four years</hi>, <hi rend="ital">four years old</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">homo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Epit. 45" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Epit. 45</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
quadriennium: <entryFree id="n39862" type="main" key="qua_^dri^enni^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quā^drĭennĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>quadriennis</etym>, <sense id="n39862.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a space</hi> or <hi rend="ital">period of four years</hi> (class.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:7:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 7, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,041:7:22" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Opt. Gen. 7, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:4:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 4, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:18:section=47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 18, § 47</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:2:6" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 2, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
quadrieris: <entryFree id="n39863" type="main" key="qua_^dri^e_ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quā^drĭēris</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">quā^t-</orth>), <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>vox hibr. from quattuor and <foreign lang="greek">a)/rw,</foreign> analog. to <foreign lang="greek">trih/rhs</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n39863.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a vessel having four banks of oars</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a quadrireme</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">EX CLASS. PR. MIS. QVADRIERE FIDE,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Murat.</author> 876, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quatrieris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Not. Tir.</author> p. 177</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
quadrifariam: <entryFree id="n39864" type="main" key="qua_^dri^fa_ri^am"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quā^drĭfārĭam</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>quattuor</etym>. <sense id="n39864.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Fourfold</hi>, <hi rend="ital">into four parts</hi> (class.; not in Cic. or Cæs.): quadrifariam aliquid dispertire, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 92, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">conjurati quadrifariam se diviserunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quadrifariam diviso exercitu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:22:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 22, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:13" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vit. 13</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n39864.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">In a fourfold manner</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:38:10:10:section=16" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 38, 10, 10, § 16</bibl>; cf. quadrifariter.</sense></entryFree>
quadrifariter: <entryFree id="n39865" type="main" key="qua_^dri^fa_ri^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quā^drĭfārĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <sense id="n39865.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">in a fourfold manner</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in four ways</hi> (post-class.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:38:10:10:section=14" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 38, 10, 10, § 14</bibl>; cf. quadrifariam.</sense></entryFree>
quadrifarius: <entryFree id="n39866" type="main" key="qua_^dri^fa_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quā^drĭfārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>quattuor</etym>, <cb n="QUAD" /> <sense id="n39866.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fourfold</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">divisio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 3, 51</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 45</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> in Psa. 108</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
quadrifidus: <entryFree id="n39867" type="main" key="qua_^dri^fi^dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quā^drĭfĭdus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>quattuorfindo</etym>, <sense id="n39867.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">four-cleft</hi>, <hi rend="ital">split into four parts</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quadrifid</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>). </sense><sense id="n39867.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">quadrifidas sudes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quadrifidam quercum Scindebat,</quote> <trans><tr>was cleaving in four</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:509" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 7, 509</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quadrifidā trabe fingere tela Jovis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:663" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 663</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ridicae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:33:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 33, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39867.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen., <hi rend="ital">divided into four parts</hi>: labor, Claud. Cons. Prob. et Olybr. 268.</sense></entryFree>
quadrifinalis: <entryFree id="n39868" type="main" key="qua_^dri^fi_na_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quā^drĭfīnālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>quadrifinium</etym>, <sense id="n39868.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">bordering on four places</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">marking four boundaries</hi> (post-class.): arca, Innocent. de Casis Litterar. p. 222 Goes.</sense></entryFree>
quadrifinium: <entryFree id="n39869" type="main" key="qua_^dri^fi_ni^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quā^drĭfīnĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>quattuor-finis</etym>, <sense id="n39869.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a place where four boundaries meet</hi> (postclass.), Innocent. p. 221 and 227 Goes.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> 15, 14, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
quadrifluus: <entryFree id="n39870" type="main" key="qua_^dri^flu^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quā^drĭflŭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>quattuorfluo</etym>, <sense id="n39870.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">having four streams</hi>, <hi rend="ital">flowing into four parts</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">amnis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Cath. 3, 103</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
quadrifluvium: <entryFree id="n39871" type="main" key="qua_^dri^flu^vi^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quā^drĭflŭvĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>quattuor-fluvius</etym>, <sense id="n39871.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a flowing into four parts</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in four directions</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ima abietis pars, cum excisa quadrifluviis disparatur,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>into four parts</tr>, <tr>according to the course of the veins</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:2:9:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 2, 9, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
quadriforis: <entryFree id="n39872" type="main" key="qua_^dri^fo^ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quā^drĭfŏris</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>quattuor-fores</etym>, <sense id="n39872.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">four-doored</hi>, i.e. <hi rend="ital">having four doors</hi> or <hi rend="ital">four doorways</hi> (<hi rend="ital">openings</hi>) (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">nidi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 21, 24, § 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">januae,</quote> <trans><tr>having four leaves</tr>, <tr>divided crosswise</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:4:6:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 4, 6, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
quadriformis: <entryFree id="n39873" type="gloss" key="qua_^dri^formis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quā^drĭformis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>quattuor-forma</etym>, <sense id="n39873.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">four-formed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quadriform</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 9, 13</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Not. Tir.</author> p. 110</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
quadrifrons: <entryFree id="n39874" type="main" key="qua_^dri^frons"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quā^drĭfrons</orth>, <itype>tis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>quattuor-frons</etym>, <sense id="n39874.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">four-fronted</hi>, <hi rend="ital">having four foreheads</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">four faces</hi>: Janus, Aug. Civ. Dei, 7, 4; <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 7, 607</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
quadriga: <entryFree id="n39875" type="main" key="qua_^dri_ga"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quā^drīga</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, v. quadrigae, I. <sense id="n39875.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
quadrigae: <entryFree id="n39876" type="main" key="qua_^dri_gae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quā^drīgae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype> (collat. form in the <number>sing.</number> <sense id="n39876.0" n="I" level="1"><xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">infra</ref></xr>), <gen>f.</gen> <etym>contr. from quadrijugae</etym>, <hi rend="ital">a set</hi> or <hi rend="ital">team of four</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a four-abreast</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fourin-hand</hi>, <hi rend="ital">four together</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n39876.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n39876.2" n="1" level="3"> Of horses, applied to the animals with or without the car or vehicle, rarely to the car or chariot alone: quadrigarum currus duplici temone olim erant, perpetuoque, et qui omnibus equis iniceretur jugo. Primus Clisthenes Sicyonius tantum medios jugavit, eosque singulos ex utrāque parte simplici vinculo applicuit, quos Graeci <foreign lang="greek">seirafo/rous,</foreign> Latini funarios vocant, <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 17, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">exinde duabus admotis quadrigis, in currus earum distentum illigat Mettum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 28 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:9" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Glauci Potniades malis membra absumpsere quadrigae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:267" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 267</bibl></cit> et saep.; Fest. s. v. October, p. 178 Müll.—</sense><sense id="n39876.3" n="2" level="3"> Of other animals: <cit><quote lang="la">quadrigae (asinorum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:1" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">camelorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:11" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 11</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n39876.4" n="3" level="3"> Esp. freq. of the <hi rend="ital">four-horse team</hi> used in races: <cit><quote lang="la">curru quadrigarum vehi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:70:144" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 70, 144</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:47:173" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 47, 173</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:47:157" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 47, 157</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:27:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 27, 57</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum carceribus sese effudere quadrigae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:512" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 512</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quadrigas agitare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:39" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 39</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39876.5" n="4" level="3"> Of <hi rend="ital">the horses drawing a war chariot</hi> or <hi rend="ital">car</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in extremis jugis binae eminebant falces ... sic armatae quadrigae,</quote> <trans><tr>with scythes attached to the yokes</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:41:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 41, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">falcatae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:40:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 37, 40, 12</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39876.6" n="5" level="3"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, of the <hi rend="ital">four-horse team</hi> of the Sun, Aurora, Luna, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">cum quadrigis Sol exoriens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:226" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 226</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">roseis Aurora quadrigis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:535" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 535</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nox aetherium nigris emensa quadrigis Mundum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:3:4:17" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 3, 4, 17</bibl></cit>.— In <number>sing.</number> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">quod unum ergo rarissimum videbatur, invenimus quadrigam numero singulari dictam in libro satirarum M. Varronis qui inscriptus est Exdemetricus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:19:8:17" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 19, 8, 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:34" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 34</bibl> (3, 32), 39; 3, 9 (4, 8), 17; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:6:46" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 6, 46</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Grat.</author> Cyn. 228</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 21, 21, § 85</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:36" default="NO" valid="yes">36, 5, 4, § 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:17" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vit. 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:1:8:9" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 1, 8, 9</bibl> <hi rend="ital">ext.;</hi> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:31:1:67" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 31, 1, 67</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,048:43:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Isa. 43, 17</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Zech. 6, 2</bibl> and 3 et saep.—</sense><sense id="n39876.7" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n39876.8" n="1" level="3"> Of abstract things: <cit><quote lang="la">initiorum quadrigae: locus et corpus, tempus et actio,</quote> <trans><tr>the four parts</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=12" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 12</bibl></cit> Müll.—</sense><sense id="n39876.9" n="2" level="3"> Of a chariot drawn by <hi rend="ital">four horses</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a chariot</hi>, <hi rend="ital">car</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">eburneis quadrigis ludere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:22" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 22</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:41:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 41, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:40:12" default="NO" valid="yes">37, 40, 12</bibl>, <hi rend="ital">supra</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">apta quadrigis equa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:16:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 16, 35</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n39876.10" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n39876.11" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The rapid course</hi> of any thing: irarumque effunde quadrigas, i. e. <hi rend="ital">give free course to your wrath</hi>, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 12, 499</bibl> (Ann. v. 464 Vahl.; for which Verg., in this <pb n="1500" /> <cb n="QUAD" /> passage, irarumque omnes effundit habenas): <cit><quote lang="la">numquam edepol quadrigis albis indipiscet postea (as an image of great speed),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 2, 2, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quadrigae poëticae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 13</bibl></cit> (15 a), 2; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quadrigas inscendere Jovis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:294" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 294</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:4:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 4, 1, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:2:155" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 1, 2, 155</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam quadrigae meae decucurrerunt,</quote> <trans>i.e. <tr>my joy</tr>, <tr>cheerfulness</tr>, <tr>is gone</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">navibus atque Quādrigis petimus bene vivere,</quote> <trans>i.e. <tr>by sea and land</tr>, <tr>in every way</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 11, 29</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n39876.12" n="B" level="2"> Of the union of four persons or things in a common work: <cit><quote lang="la">quadrigae tyrannorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vop.</author> Prob. 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">initiorum quadrigae, locus et corpus, tempus et actio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=12" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 12</bibl></cit> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
quadrigalis: <entryFree id="n39877" type="main" key="qua_^dri_ga_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quā^drīgālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>quadrigae</etym>, <sense id="n39877.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a team of four</hi>: equi, Paul. ex Fest. s. v. curules, p. 49 Müll.</sense></entryFree>
quadrigamus: <entryFree id="n39878" type="main" key="qua_^dri^ga^mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quā^drĭgămus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>vox hibr. from quattuor-<foreign lang="greek">ga/mos</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n39878.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who has married four times</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a husband for the fourth time</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> adv. Jovin. 1</bibl>, n. 15.</sense></entryFree>
quadrigarius: <entryFree id="n39879" type="main" key="qua_^dri_ga_ri^us1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quā^drīgārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>quadrigae</etym>, <sense id="n39879.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a four-horse</hi> (<hi rend="ital">racing</hi>) <hi rend="ital">chariot</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">quadrigario habitu,</quote> <trans><tr>in the dress of the driver of a quadriga</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:17" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 17</bibl></cit>: pulvis, for <hi rend="ital">the race-horses</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Vet. 1, 56</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 28, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">FAMILIA,</quote> <trans><tr>slaves who took care of the race-horses</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 339, 5</bibl></cit>.— Hence, as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">quā^drīgārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">one who drives a four-horse chariot in the circus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a chariot-racer</hi> (class.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:7" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 7</bibl>: in victoriā, Cic. Fragm. Or. in Toga Cand. ap. Ascon.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:16" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 16</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 2, 70</bibl>; Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=36:12" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 36, 12</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n39880" type="main" key="Qua_^dri_ga_ri^us2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Quā^drīgārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n39880.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman surname.</hi> Thus, Q. Claudius Quadrigarius, <hi rend="ital">an old Roman historian</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:9:6" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 9, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:7:9" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 7, 9</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">called simply Claudius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:19:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 19, 13</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
quadrigatus: <entryFree id="n39881" type="main" key="qua_^dri_ga_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quā^drīgātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>quadrigae</etym>, <sense id="n39881.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">marked</hi> or <hi rend="ital">stamped with the figure of a quadriga</hi> (a coin), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:58:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 58, 4</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">nota argenti fuere bigae, atque quadrigae, et inde bigati et quadrigati dicti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 3, 13, § 46</bibl></cit>; Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=98:3" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 98, 3</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
quadrigeminus: <entryFree id="n39882" type="main" key="qua_^dri^ge^mi^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quā^drĭgĕmĭnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>quattuor-geminus</etym>, <sense id="n39882.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fourfold</hi>, <hi rend="ital">four</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">cornicula,</quote> <trans><tr>four</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 23, 35, § 85</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 27, 28</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
quadrigeni: <entryFree id="n39883" type="main" key="qua_^dri^ge_ni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quā^drĭgēni</orth>, v. quadringeni.</entryFree>
quadrigonus: <entryFree id="n39884" type="main" key="qua_^dri^go_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quā^drĭgōnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>quadrus, <foreign lang="greek">gw=nos</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n39884.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">having four angles</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">figura,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud. Mam.</author> Ep. 1 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
quadrigulae: <entryFree id="n39885" type="main" key="qua_^dri_gu^lae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quā^drīgŭlae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <sense id="n39885.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">f dim.</hi> [quadrigae], <hi rend="ital">a little four-horse team</hi> (class.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,054:3:5" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fat. 3, 5</bibl>.—In <number>sing.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 8, 19, § 83</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
quadrigularius: <entryFree id="n39886" type="gloss" key="qua_^dri_gu^la_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quā^drīgŭlārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>quadrigulae</etym>, <sense id="n39886.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a little fourhorse team</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">PICTOR,</quote> <trans><tr>who painted little four-horse teams</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Don.</author> 317, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4262</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
quadrijugis: <entryFree id="n39887" type="main" key="qua_^dri^ju^gis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quā^drĭjŭgis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>quattuor-jugum</etym>, <sense id="n39887.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a team of four</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">equi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:571" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 571</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">currus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Flor. 3, p. 356, 14</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
quadrijugus: <entryFree id="n39888" type="main" key="qua_^dri^ju^gus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quā^drĭjŭgus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n39888.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a team of four</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): curru, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:44:105" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 44, 105</bibl> (Trag. v. 129 Vahl.); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:162" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 162</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 3, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:22:1" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 22, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">equi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:2:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 3, 2, 66</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:4:2:54" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 4, 2, 54</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">certamen,</quote> <trans><tr>with four-horse chariots</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:6:370" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 6, 370</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">quā^drĭjŭgi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a four-horse team</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ruunt tritumque relinquunt Quadrijugi spatium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:167" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 167</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:4:441" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 4, 441</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:12:533" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 12, 533</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
quadrilaterus: <entryFree id="n39889" type="main" key="qua_^dri^la^te^rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quā^drĭlătĕrus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>quattuorlatus</etym>, <sense id="n39889.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">four-sided</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quadrilateral</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:page=35" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> p. 35</bibl> Goes.; <cit><quote lang="la">Boëth. Art. Geom. p. 375, 16 (Friedl.): figura,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 3, 3, 12</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
quadrilibris: <entryFree id="n39890" type="main" key="qua_^dri^li_bris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quā^drĭlībris</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>quattuor-libra</etym>, <sense id="n39890.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that weighs four pounds</hi> (ante-class.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 5, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
quadrimanus: <entryFree id="n39891" type="main" key="qua_^dri^ma^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quā^drĭmănus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">quā^drĭ-mănis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>quattuor-manus</etym>, <sense id="n39891.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fourhanded</hi>, <hi rend="ital">having four hands</hi> (post-class.): puella biceps, quadripes, quadrimana, Jul. <bibl default="NO"><author>Obseq.</author> Prodig. 111</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pueri quadrupedes et quadrimanes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 73</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
quadrimatus: <entryFree id="n39892" type="main" key="qua_^dri_ma_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quā^drīmātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>quadrimus</etym>, <sense id="n39892.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the age of four years</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">extra quadrimatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:181" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 11, 58, § 181</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ante quadrimatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:176" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 45, 70, § 176</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dum quadrimatum agant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:9:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 9, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:1:7" default="NO">9, 1, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
quadrimembris: <entryFree id="n39893" type="main" key="qua_^dri^membris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quā^drĭmembris</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>quattuormembrum</etym>, <sense id="n39893.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">four-limbed</hi> or <hi rend="ital">four-footed, going<cb n="QUAD" />  on all fours</hi> (post-class.), Mart. Cap. poët. 8, § 805 dub. (al. hiantimembrem).</sense></entryFree>
quadrimenstruus: <entryFree id="n39894" type="main" key="qua_^dri^menstru^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quā^drĭmenstrŭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>quattuor-mensis</etym>, <sense id="n39894.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of four months</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 1, 32, 1</bibl>; Cod. Th. 12, 6, 27, § 1.</sense></entryFree>
quadrimestris: <entryFree id="n39895" type="main" key="qua_^dri^mestris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quā^drĭmestris</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n39895.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of four months</hi> (ante-class. and post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">agni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:2:17" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 2, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consulatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:14" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 14</bibl></cit>: indutiae, Cod. 7, 54, 3, pr. § 1.</sense></entryFree>
quadrimulus: <entryFree id="n39896" type="main" key="qua_^dri_mu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quā^drīmŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n39896.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. dim.</hi> [quadrimus], <hi rend="ital">of four years</hi>, <hi rend="ital">four years old</hi> (Plautin.): <cit><quote lang="la">parvulus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:5:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 5, 3, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">altera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:prol. 85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. prol. 85</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
quadrimus: <entryFree id="n39897" type="main" key="qua_^dri_mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quā^drīmus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>quattuor and root ghim-, him-, of Sanscr. himas, snow; cf. Gr. <foreign lang="greek">xiw/n, xei=ma;</foreign> Lat. hiems, hibernus; hence, of four winters</etym>, <sense id="n39897.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of four years</hi>, <hi rend="ital">four years old</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">de quadrimo Catone,</quote> <trans><tr>of Cato of Utica</tr>, <tr>when four years old</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:16:22:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 16, 22, 1</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">infantem natum esse quadrimo parem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">boves,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:20:5" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 20, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">merum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:9:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 9, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:16:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 16, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dies,</quote> <trans><tr>a term of four years</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:23:4:19" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 23, 4, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:171" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 44, 69, § 171</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
quadringenarius: <entryFree id="n39898" type="main" key="qua_^dringe_na_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quā^dringēnārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>quadringeni</etym>, <sense id="n39898.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of four hundred each</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">cohortes,</quote> <trans><tr>each consisting of four hundred men</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:1:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 6, 1, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quadringenariae cohortes (al. quadringentariae),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:7:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 7, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">IVDEX,</quote> <trans><tr>who possessed an equestrian fortune of four hundred thousand sesterces</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Murat.</author> 1048, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 431, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
quadringeni: <entryFree id="n39899" type="main" key="qua_^dringe_ni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quā^dringēni</orth>, <itype>ae, a</itype> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">quā^drigēni</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:8:3" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 8, 3</bibl>), <sense id="n39899.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">num. distrib. adj.</hi> [quadringenti], <hi rend="ital">four hundred each</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 11 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:16:3" default="NO" valid="yes">45, 16, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">milia nummūm,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:13" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vit. 13</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
quadringenteni: <entryFree id="n39900" type="spur" key="qua_^dringente_ni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quā^dringentēni</orth>, a false read. for quadringenti, q. v.</entryFree>
quadringentesimus: <entryFree id="n39901" type="main" key="qua_^dringente_si^mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quā^dringentēsĭmus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>quadringenti</etym>, <sense id="n39901.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the four hundredth</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">annus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:45:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 45, 4</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 6, 6, § 16</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
quadringenti: <entryFree id="n39902" type="main" key="qua_^dringenti"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quā^dringenti</orth>, <itype>ae, a</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <orth extent="full" lang="la">[</orth>quattuorcentum], <sense id="n39902.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">four hundred</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">anni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:37:58" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 37, 58</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:5:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 5, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">talis quadringentis jactis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:21:48" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 21, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(sestertia),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:1:105" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 1, 105</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:9:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 9, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pantheres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 17, 24, § 64</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
quadringenties: <entryFree id="n39903" type="main" key="qua_^dringenti^es"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quā^dringentĭes</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <orth extent="full" lang="la">[</orth>quadringenti], <sense id="n39903.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">four hundred times</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">HS quadringenties,</quote> <trans><tr>forty millions of sesterces</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:10:section=26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 10, § 26</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:37:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 37, 93</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,030:8:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rab. Post. 8, 21</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
quadrini: <entryFree id="n39904" type="main" key="qua_^dri_ni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quā^drīni</orth>, <itype>ae, a</itype>, <sense id="n39904.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">num. distrib. adj.</hi> [quattuor], <hi rend="ital">four each</hi>, <hi rend="ital">four</hi> (ante-class. and postAug.): <cit><quote lang="la">ab uno uni, a tribus trini, a quattuor quadrini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 8:section=55" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 8, § 55</bibl></cit> Müll.: si haberem quadrinas molas, Pompon. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 483, 24</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 36, 43, § 120</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">febris quadrini circuitūs,</quote> <trans><tr>a quartan fever</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:170" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 7, 50, 51, § 170</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cardines,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 6, 192</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">temporum vices,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Dogm. Plat. 1, p. 7, 16</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
quadrinoctium: <entryFree id="n39905" type="gloss" key="qua_^dri^nocti^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quā^drĭnoctĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>quattuornox</etym>, <sense id="n39905.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a space</hi> or <hi rend="ital">period of four nights</hi>, acc. to <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 1357</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
quadripartio: <entryFree id="n39906" type="main" key="qua_^dri^parti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quā^drĭ-partĭo</orth>, no <sense id="n39906.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <itype>ītum, 4</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">quā^drĭ-pertĭor</orth>, <itype>īri, 4</itype>, <pos>v. dep.</pos> <etym>quattuor-partio</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to divide into four parts</hi> (in the <hi rend="ital">verb. finit.</hi> post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">quadripartitur exercitus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Dict. Cret.</author> 1, 19</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Dep.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quadripartiretur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Not. Tir.</author> p. 109</bibl></cit>.— Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">quā^-drĭpartītus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">quā^drĭpert-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">divided into four parts</hi>, <hi rend="ital">consisting of four parts</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fourfold</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quadripartite</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">distributio accusationis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:12:section=33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 12, § 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">commutationes temporum,</quote> <trans><tr>fourfold</tr>, <tr>four</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:28:68" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 28, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">divisio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:3:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 3, 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 9:section=31" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 9, § 31</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">distinctio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 22, 24, § 88</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:38" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 5, 38</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:6:87" default="NO">3, 6, 87</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">exercitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praesidia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:5:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 5, 20</bibl></cit>. — <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">quā^drĭ-partītō</orth>, <hi rend="ital">in four divisions</hi> or <hi rend="ital">parts</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quadripartitely</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">bracchia locare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:26:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 26, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
quadri: <entryFree id="n39907" type="main" key="qua_^dri^"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quā^drĭ-partītĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>quadripartio</etym>, <sense id="n39907.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a division into four parts</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quadripartition</hi> (only in Varro), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=1" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 1</bibl>, and 7, § 5 Müll.</sense></entryFree>
quadripartito: <entryFree id="n39908" type="main" key="qua_^dri^parti_to_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quā^drĭpartītō</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. quadripartio, <sense id="n39908.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">P. a. fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
quadripartitus: <entryFree id="n39909" type="main" key="qua_^dri^parti_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quā^drĭpartītus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, from quadripartio.</entryFree>
quadripedus: <entryFree id="n39910" type="main" key="qua_^dri^pe^dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quā^drĭpĕdus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. quadrupedus.</entryFree>
quadripertitus: <entryFree id="n39911" type="main" key="qua_^dri^perti_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quā^drĭpertītus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. <itype>quadripartio</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos></entryFree>
quadripes: <entryFree id="n39912" type="main" key="qua_^dri^pe_s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quā^drĭpēs</orth>, <itype>ĕdis</itype>, v. quadrupes.</entryFree>
quadriplatores: <entryFree id="n39913" type="gloss" key="qua_^dri^pla_to_res"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quā^drĭplātōres</orth> <itype>dicebantur</itype>, qui eo <cb n="QUAD" /> quaestu se tuebantur, ut eas res persequerentur, quarum ex legibus quadrupli erat actio, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=259:3" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 259, 3</bibl> Müll.; v. quadruplator.</entryFree>
quadriremis: <entryFree id="n39914" type="main" key="qua_^dri^re_mi^s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quā^drĭ-rēmĭs</orth>, <itype>e</itype> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">quā^trĭrēmis</orth>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Not. Tir.</author> p. 177</bibl>), <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>quattuor-remus</etym>, <sense id="n39914.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">having four banks of oars</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">machina,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Nol.</author> Carm. 21, 73</bibl></cit>.— Hence, <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">quā^drĭ-rēmis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a vessel having four banks of oars</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a quadrireme</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">egreditur Centuripinā quadriremi e portu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:33:section=86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 33, § 86</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 5, 34, § 88</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quinque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B.
