C. 3, 24</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:207" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 56, 57, § 207</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2671</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3629</bibl>.— As <pos>adj.</pos>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Nol.</author> Carm. 21, 73</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
quadrisemus: <entryFree id="n39915" type="main" key="qua_^dri^se_mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quā^drĭ-sēmus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>vox hibr. from quattuor-<foreign lang="greek">sh=ma,</foreign> sign</etym>, <sense id="n39915.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">quadrisyllabic</hi>, <hi rend="ital">containing four</hi> morae or <hi rend="ital">prosodial times</hi> (gram. term): <cit><quote lang="la">numerus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 9, § 981</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
quadrisomus: <entryFree id="n39916" type="main" key="qua_^dri^so_mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quā^drĭ-sōmus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>vox hibr. from quadrus, <foreign lang="greek">sw=ma</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n39916.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">containing four bodies</hi>: SEPVLCRVM, Inscr. Rein. col. 2, 40; 43 al.</sense></entryFree>
quadrivium: <entryFree id="n39917" type="main" key="qua_^dri^vi^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quā^drĭvĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>quattuor-via</etym>. <sense id="n39917.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a place where four ways meet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a crossway</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cross-road</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in quadriviis et angiportis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:58:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 58, 4</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:1:63" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 1, 63</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">DII,</quote> <trans><tr>the tutelar gods of cross-roads</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 84, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1015, 1</bibl>; Inscr. Rein. col. 1, n. 14.—</sense><sense id="n39917.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the assemblage of the four mathematical sciences</hi> (arithmetic, music, geometry, and astronomy), Boëth. Arithmet. 1, 1.</sense></entryFree>
quadrivius: <entryFree id="n39918" type="gloss" key="qua_^dri^vi^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quā^drĭvĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>quadrusvia</etym>, <sense id="n39918.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of the cross-roads</hi>, only in the phrase DIS or LARIBVS QVADRIVIIS (sometimes QVADRIBIS), <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 389</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1664</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2103</bibl> sqq.</sense></entryFree>
quadro: <entryFree id="n39919" type="main" key="qua_^dro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quā^dro</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen> <etym>quadrus</etym>. <sense id="n39919.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to make four-cornered</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to square</hi>, <hi rend="ital">make square</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">abies atque populus ad unguem quadrantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:13" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 2, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lapides,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,013:5:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 3 Reg. 5, 17</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n39919.1" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to put in proper order</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to join properly together</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to complete</hi>, <hi rend="ital">perfect</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quadrandae orationis industria,</quote> <trans><tr>in properly arranging</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:58:197" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 58, 197</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae pars quadrat acervum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 6, 35</bibl></cit> Orell. ad loc. — </sense><sense id="n39919.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi> (<hi rend="ital">to be square</hi>, said of squared stones for building, which fit well together; hence), transf., <hi rend="ital">to square</hi> or <hi rend="ital">agree with</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to fit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">suit</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">secto via limite quadret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:278" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 278</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eam conjunctionem quadrare volumus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:44:175" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 44, 175</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia in istam quadrant,</quote> <trans><tr>fit her</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:29:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 29, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad multa,</quote> <trans><tr>to suit in many respects</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 4, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quoniam tibi ita quadrat,</quote> <trans><tr>it seems to you so proper</tr>, <tr>pleases you so</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:11:43" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 11, 43</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39919.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n39919.4" n="1" level="3"> Of accounts, <hi rend="ital">to square</hi>, <hi rend="ital">agree</hi>, <hi rend="ital">accord</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quomodo sexcenta eodem modo quadrarint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:36:section=92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 36, § 92</bibl></cit>: visum est hoc mihi ad multa quadrare. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:19:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 4, 19, 2</bibl> (4, 18, 3).—</sense><sense id="n39919.5" n="2" level="3"> Of words, <hi rend="ital">to be fitting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">appropriate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">scire, quod quoque loco verborum maxime quadret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:60" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 60</bibl></cit>.— Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">quā^drātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> </sense><sense id="n39919.6" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">squared</hi>, <hi rend="ital">square</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quadrate</hi> (class.): quadrata basis, Varr. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 13, 19, § 91</bibl>: pes, <hi rend="ital">a square foot</hi>, Plin, 33, 4, 21, § 75; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:1:6" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 1, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:2:5" default="NO">5, 2, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">saxum,</quote> <trans><tr>squared</tr>, <tr>hewn stone</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 23</bibl></cit>; so, lapis, Varr. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 13, 19, § 91</bibl>: littera, <hi rend="ital">capital letters</hi>, which are composed of square strokes, <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 29</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">statura,</quote> <trans><tr>square</tr>, <tr>robust</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:20" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">boves,</quote> <trans><tr>stout</tr>, <tr>vigorous</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:1:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">canis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:12:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 12, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">signa,</quote> <trans>i.e. <tr>statues</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 8, 19, § 56</bibl></cit>: agmen, <hi rend="ital">a marching in regular order of battle;</hi> also, <hi rend="ital">an army advancing in regular order of battle</hi>, so that the whole body forms a parallelogram, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 12, 121</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quadratum acies consistat in agmen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:4" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 1, 100: <cit><quote lang="la">ut inde agmine quadrato ad urbem accederet,</quote> <trans><tr>in order of battle</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:13:8:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 13, 8, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 42, 108</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:8" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:5:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 5, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:1:19" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 1, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 59:6" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 59, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quadrato agmine incedere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 100:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 100, 1</bibl></cit>; v. agmen; cf.: quadrato Exercitu, Cat. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 204, 33</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pallium,</quote> <trans><tr>square</tr>, <tr>four-cornered</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 135</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">numerus,</quote> <trans><tr>a square number</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:20:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 20, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">versus,</quote> <trans><tr>a verse of eight feet</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:29:20" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 29, 20</bibl></cit>: Roma, <hi rend="ital">the most ancient Rome</hi>, <hi rend="ital">built in the form of a square</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on the</hi> Mons Palatinus; and, in a narrower sense, <hi rend="ital">the enclosed square place on the summit of the Palatine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the</hi> mundus <hi rend="ital">of all cities built in the Etruscan fashion</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=258" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 258</bibl> Müll.; cf. on the Roma quadrata, Becker, Alterth. 1, p. 105 sq. — </sense><sense id="n39919.7" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Substt.</hi> </sense><sense id="n39919.8" n="a" level="4"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">quā^drātum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> </sense><sense id="n39919.9" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">A</hi> <pb n="1501" /> <cb n="QUAD" /> <hi rend="ital">square</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a quadrate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dimensio quadrati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:24:57" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 24, 57</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:10:24" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 10, 24</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mutat quadrata rotundis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 100</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in quadratum,</quote> <trans><tr>into a square</tr>, <tr>tetragon</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:189" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 22, 51, § 189</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:10:40" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 10, 40</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n39919.10" n="(b)" level="5"> Astronom. t. t., <hi rend="ital">quadrature</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quartile</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:42:89" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 42, 89</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">luna in quadrato solis dividua est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 18, 16, § 80</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39919.11" n="b" level="4"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">quā^drātus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a square</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quadrate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">marmorum quadrati,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 2, 7</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n39919.12" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">fitting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">suitable</hi> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">lenis et quadrata verborum compositio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:5:9" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 5, 9</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:69" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 4, 69</bibl>. — <itype>Hence</itype>, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">quā^drātē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">fourfold</hi>, <hi rend="ital">four times</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Manil.</author> 2, 295</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
quadrula: <entryFree id="n39920" type="main" key="qua_^dru^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quā^drŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>quadra</etym>, <sense id="n39920.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little square</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 37</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
quadrum: <entryFree id="n39921" type="main" key="qua_^drum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quā^drum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>quattuor</etym>, <sense id="n39921.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">something square</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a square</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quadrate</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n39921.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">perticae dolantur in quadrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:3:7" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per quadrum singulos habens cubitos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,002:37:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Exod. 37, 25</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n39921.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a being squared</hi> or <hi rend="ital">fitted together</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fitness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">proper order</hi>, <hi rend="ital">arrangement</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in quadrum redigere sententias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:61:208" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 61, 208</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">70, 233</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
quadrupedans: <entryFree id="n39922" type="main" key="qua_^dru^pe^dans"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quā^drŭ-pĕdans</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from the obsol. quadrupedo [quadrupes]. <sense id="n39922.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Going on four feet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">galloping</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and postAug.): <cit><quote lang="la">canterius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:4:2:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 4, 2, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equo juxta quadrupedante,</quote> <trans><tr>galloping close by on horseback</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:182" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 45, 70, § 182</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sonitus,</quote> <trans><tr>of a horse galloping</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:596" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 596</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n39922.1" n="II" level="1"> <pos>Subst.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">a galloping horse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a steed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">courser</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">quadrupedantum Pectora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:614" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 614</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
quadrupedatim: <entryFree id="n39923" type="gloss" key="qua_^dru^pe^da_tim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quā^drŭpĕdātim</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>quattuorpes</etym>, <sense id="n39923.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">in the manner of a quadruped</hi>, acc. to <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 163</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
quadrupedius: <entryFree id="n39924" type="hapax" key="qua_^dru^pe^di^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quā^drŭpĕdĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>,<sense id="n39924.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fourfooted</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quadruped</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1672,001:Rer. Gest. Alex. M. 3:36" default="NO"><author>Jul. Val.</author> Rer. Gest. Alex. M. 3, 36</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
quadrupedus: <entryFree id="n39925" type="main" key="qua_^dru^pe^dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quā^drŭpĕdus</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">quā^drĭpĕdus</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:ad M. Anton. Or. 1" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> ad M. Anton. Or. 1</bibl>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>quadrupes</etym>, <sense id="n39925.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">going on four feet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">galloping</hi> (postAug.): <cit><quote lang="la">quadrupedo gradu repentes,</quote> <trans><tr>on all fours</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 14, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quadripedo cursu,</quote> <trans><tr>on a gallop</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:1:1" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> 1, 1</bibl></cit>.— <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">quadrupedo currere,</quote> <trans><tr>to gallop</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Ep. ad M. Caes. 2:1" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Ep. ad M. Caes. 2, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
quadrupes: <entryFree id="n39926" type="main" key="qua_^dru^pe_s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quā^drŭpēs</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">quā^drĭpes</orth>), <itype>pĕdis</itype> (<sense id="n39926.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen. plur.</hi> quadrupedium, <bibl default="NO"><author>Capitol.</author> Ver. 5, 2</bibl>), <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>quattuor-pes</etym>, <hi rend="ital">having four feet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">going on four feet;</hi> esp., </sense><sense id="n39926.1" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Galloping</hi> (post-Aug.): ecus, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:18:5:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 18, 5, 4</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 6, 9, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">equestri celeritate, quadrupedi cursu solum replaudens,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 6, p. 185, 7</bibl></cit>.— <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">dum certum flectit in orbem Quadrupedis cursus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:226" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 226</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n39926.2" n="B" level="2"> Of persons, <hi rend="ital">on all fours</hi>, <hi rend="ital">creeping</hi>, <hi rend="ital">going on hands and feet</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">atque audin? quadrupedem constringito,</quote> <trans><tr>so that he can only move on all fours</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:5:2:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 5, 2, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mox quadrupes (infans) rituque tulit sua membra ferarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:222" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 222</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homines ... bestiarum more quadrupedes coërcuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:27" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 27</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ner.48</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n39926.3" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">quā^drŭpēs</orth>, <itype>ĕdis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <gen>f.</gen>, and <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a quadruped</hi>, <hi rend="ital">four-footed creature.</hi> </sense><sense id="n39926.4" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Masc.</hi>, mostly of beasts of draught or burden; v. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:6:20" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 6, 20</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">calcari quadrupedem agitabo advorsum clivum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:3:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 3, 3, 11</bibl></cit>: reprime parumper vim citatūm quadrupedum, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 495, 20</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quadrupedum vectiones, quorum, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:60:151" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 60, 151</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de omnibus quadrupedibus ... qui idonei sunt, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:20:1" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 20, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:714" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 714</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">saucius quadrupes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 500</bibl></cit>.— <cit><quote lang="la">Contemptuously (opp. bipes),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:18:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Dom. 18, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil inter te atque inter quadrupedem interesse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:1:3:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Par. 1, 3, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quadrupes nequissime,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 7, p. 200, 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39926.5" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Fem.</hi> (sc. bestia): ducite eo mutas quadrupedes, Naev. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 924</bibl> (Trag. Rel. v. 28 Rib.): <cit><quote lang="la">si quamvis quadrupedem serpens momorderit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 102</bibl></cit>; Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 407, 22</bibl> (Trag. Rel. v. 219 Vahl.): quadrupes tardigrada, Pac. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:64:133" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 64, 133</bibl> (Trag. Rel. v. 2 Rib.): <cit><quote lang="la">quadrupes qua vasta tenetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:44:114" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 44, 114</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=39" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 39</bibl> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:5:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 5, 26</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sollicitari quadripedes cunctas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 17, 23, § 62</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n39926.6" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi> (sc. animal): <cit><quote lang="la">cetera quadrupedia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:33" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 2, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">majora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 2, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crocodilum, quadripes malum et infestum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 25, 37, § 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plurima autem obruerit quadrupedia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1672,001:Rer. Gest. Alex. 3:36" default="NO"><author>Jul. Val.</author> Rer. Gest. Alex. 3, 36</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
quadruplaris: <entryFree id="n39927" type="main" key="qua_^dru^pla_ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quā^drŭplāris</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>quadruplus</etym>, <sense id="n39927.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fourfold</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quadruple</hi> (post-class.): numerus <cb n="QUAE" /> duplaris, triplaris, quadruplaris (al. quadruplus), <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> Somn. Scip. 1, 19, 21</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
quadruplator: <entryFree id="n39928" type="main" key="qua_^dru^pla_tor1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quā^drŭplātor</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">quadrĭplātor</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=259" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 259</bibl> Müll. v. h. v.: <orth extent="full" lang="la">quădrŭpŭlā-tor</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:1:2:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 1, 2, 18</bibl>), <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>quadruplo</etym>. <sense id="n39928.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">One who multiplies by four</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a quadrupler</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 330, 20</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n39928.1" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a multiplier</hi>, <hi rend="ital">magnifier</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exaggerator</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">beneficiorum suorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 7:25:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 7, 25, 1</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n39928.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">One who farmed the tolls</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of which he received a fourth part</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 5, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n39929" type="main" key="qua_^dru_^pla_tor2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quā^drū^plātor</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">quā^drī^-</orth>), <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>quadruplor</etym>, <sense id="n39929.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a public informer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who received a fourth part of the thing informed against</hi> (acc. to others, <hi rend="ital">against one who committed an offence punishable with a fourfold penalty;</hi> cf. sector); also, <cit><quote lang="la">in gen.,</quote> <trans><tr>a trickster</tr>, <tr>chicaner</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:1:2:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 1, 2, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deterrimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:7:section=21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 7, § 21</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 2, 8, § 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 72</bibl>; cf. Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=259:3" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 259, 3</bibl> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:7:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Div. in Caecil. 7, 24</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">21, 68</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
quadruplex: <entryFree id="n39930" type="main" key="qua_^dru^plex"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quā^drŭplex</orth>, <itype>ĭcis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>quattuor-plico</etym>. <sense id="n39930.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Fourfold</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quadruple</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecunia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:5:2:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 5, 2, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ordo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quadruplici radice,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 8, 38, § 60</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n39930.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, in gen., <hi rend="ital">four</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">stellae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,060:chapter=92" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Arat. 92</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n39930.2" n="III" level="1"> As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">quā^drŭplex</orth>, <itype>ĭcis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a fourfold amount</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">gubernatoribus duplex, magistris quadruplex dedit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:42:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 42, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
quadruplicatio: <entryFree id="n39931" type="main" key="qua_^dru^pli^ca_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quā^drŭ-plĭcātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>quadruplico</etym>, <sense id="n39931.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a making fourfold</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quadruplication</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">numeri,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 7, § 750</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:44:1:2" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 44, 1, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
quadruplicato: <entryFree id="n39932" type="main" key="qua_^dru^pli^ca_to_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quā^drŭplĭcātō</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. quadruplico <sense id="n39932.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
quadruplico: <entryFree id="n39933" type="main" key="qua_^dru^pli^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quā^drŭplĭco</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>quadruplex</etym>, <sense id="n39933.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to multiply by four</hi>, <hi rend="ital">make fourfold</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quadruplicate</hi>: rem suam, <hi rend="ital">one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s property</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:3:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 3, 1, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">numerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:38:10:10" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 38, 10, 10</bibl></cit>.— <itype>Hence</itype>, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">quădrŭplĭcā-tō</orth>, <hi rend="ital">four times as much</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quadruply</hi> (postAug.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 17, 14, § 76</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">emptis vineis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 14, 4, 5, § 51</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
quadruplo: <entryFree id="n39934" type="main" key="qua_^dru^plo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quā^drŭplo</orth>, no <sense id="n39934.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <itype>ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>quadruplus</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to multiply by four</hi>, <hi rend="ital">make fourfold</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quadruple</hi> (post-class.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:4:2:14" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 4, 2, 14</bibl>, §§ <cit><quote lang="la">1, 7: numerus quadruplatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:38:10:10:section=17" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 38, 10, 10, § 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:47:2:50" default="NO">47, 2, 50</bibl> pr.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> Apol. Dav. 5, 22</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
quadruplor: <entryFree id="n39935" type="main" key="qua_^dru^plor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quā^drŭplor</orth>, <itype>āri</itype>, <pos>v. dep.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n39935.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to be an informer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cheater</hi>, <hi rend="ital">trickster</hi>, <hi rend="ital">chicaner</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque quadruplari me volo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:1:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 1, 2, 10</bibl></cit> (al. quadrupulari).</sense></entryFree>
quadruplus: <entryFree id="n39936" type="main" key="qua_^dru^plus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quā^drŭplus</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">quā^drŭpŭlus</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:4:2:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 4, 2, 49</bibl> Fleck.), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>quattuor</etym>, <sense id="n39936.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fourfold</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quadruple</hi> (rare as <pos>adj.</pos>): <cit><quote lang="la">strena,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:34" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">numerus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> Somn. Scip. 1, 19, 21</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 1, 19</bibl>.— <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">quā^drŭplum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a fourfold amount</hi>, <hi rend="ital">four times as much</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quadruple</hi> (class.): furem dupli condemnari, feneratorem quadrupli, <hi rend="ital">to a fourfold penalty</hi>, Cato, R. R. prooem.: <cit><quote lang="la">judicium in aratorem in quadruplum dare,</quote> <trans><tr>to sentence the cultivator</tr>, <tr>who did not deliver the quantity of grain fixed by law</tr>, <tr>to pay four times as much</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:13:section=34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 13, § 34</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:40" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 40</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">elephanto pulmo quadruplo major bubulo,</quote> <trans><tr>four times as large</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:203" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 79, § 203</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">actio quadrupli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:4:2:14" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 4, 2, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:8:5" default="NO">2, 8, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 3:192" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 3, 192</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:4:4" default="NO">4, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in quadruplum damnari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:48:13:13" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 48, 13, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quid aliquem defraudavi reddo quadruplum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,003:19:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Luc. 19, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
quadrurbem: <entryFree id="n39937" type="gloss" key="quadrurbem"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quadrurbem</orth> <itype>Athenas Attius appellavit, quod scilicet ex quattuor urbibus in unam domicilia contulerunt, Braurone, Eleusine, Piraeeo, Sunio</itype>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=258" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 258</bibl> Müll. (transl. of <foreign lang="greek">tetra/polis</foreign>).</entryFree>
quadrus: <entryFree id="n39938" type="main" key="qua_^drus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quā^drus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>for quatrus, from quattuor</etym>, <sense id="n39938.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">square</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">quadrus terminus, Auct. Limit. p. 281 Goes.: cella,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lapides,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,048:9:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Isa. 9, 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
quadruus: <entryFree id="n39939" type="main" key="qua_^dru^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quā^drŭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>quattuor</etym>, <sense id="n39939.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fourcornered</hi> or <hi rend="ital">fourfold</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">errabam riguis per quadrua compita in hortis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>laid out in squares</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Idyll. 14, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vis,</quote> <trans><tr>fourfold</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Psych. 842</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
quaerito: <entryFree id="n39940" type="main" key="quaeri^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quaerĭto</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. freq. a.</pos> <etym>quaero</etym>, <sense id="n39940.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to seek</hi>, <hi rend="ital">search</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">look for earnestly</hi> (ante-class.). </sense><sense id="n39940.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">hominem inter vivos quaeritamus mortuum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:2:1:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 2, 1, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">defessus sum quaeritando,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:4:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 4, 1, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:4:2:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cist. 4, 2, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem mari terrāque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:prol. 105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. prol. 105</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">te ipsum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:2:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 2, 4, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hospitium ab aliquo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:3:3:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 3, 3, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lanā ac telā victum,</quote> <trans><tr>to earn</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:1:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 1, 48</bibl></cit>: multis languoribus peresus essem <cb n="QUAE" /> te quaeritando, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:58:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 58, 15</bibl>.—Prov.: hujus sermo haud cinerem quaeritat, <hi rend="ital">needs no ashes</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">no polishing</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 2, 10</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n39940.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to ask</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inquire</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">demand earnestly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to wish to know exactly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid tu id quaeritas?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:1:2:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 1, 2, 22</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:4:2:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cist. 4, 2, 57</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:3:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 3, 3, 17</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
quaero: <entryFree id="n39941" type="main" key="quaero"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quaero</orth> (old orthogr. QVAIRO, Epitaphs of the Scipios, 6; for the original form and etym. <orth extent="full" lang="la">quaeso</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, v. quaeso), sīvi or <itype>sĭi, sītum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n39941.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to seek.</hi> </sense><sense id="n39941.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n39941.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: aliquem, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:20:40" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 20, 40</bibl> (Ann. v. 43 Vahl.); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 3, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">te ipsum quaerebam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:4:8:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 4, 8, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">escam in sterquilinio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:3:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 3, 12 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit>— </sense><sense id="n39941.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n39941.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To seek to get</hi> or <hi rend="ital">procure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to seek</hi> or <hi rend="ital">search for</hi> a thing, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:3:1:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 3, 1, 38</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">rem mercaturis faciendis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:6:2:46" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Par. 6, 2, 46</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">contrivi in quaerendo vitam atque aetatem meam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:4:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 5, 4, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5, 3, 27</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 7, 57</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:170" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. P. 170</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n39941.5" n="b" level="4"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to get</hi>, <hi rend="ital">procure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">obtain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">acquire</hi> a thing: <cit><quote lang="la">uxores liberorum quaerendorum causā ducere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:52" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">liberorum quaerundorum causā ei uxor data est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:4:2:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 4, 2, 109</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quaerunt litterae hae sibi liberos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:1:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 1, 1, 21</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39941.6" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To seek for</hi> something missing, <hi rend="ital">to miss</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Siciliam in uberrimā Siciliae parte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:18:section=47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 18, § 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">optatos Tyndaridas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:17:18" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 17, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Phoebi comam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:3:20" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 3, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amnes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:4:703" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 4, 703</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39941.7" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To ask</hi>, <hi rend="ital">desire</hi>, with <hi rend="ital">ut</hi> and <hi rend="ital">subj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaeris ut suscipiam cogitationem quidnam istis agendum putem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:20:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 14, 20, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39941.8" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n39941.9" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to seek</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to think over</hi>, <hi rend="ital">meditate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">aim at</hi>, <hi rend="ital">plan</hi> a thing: <cit><quote lang="la">dum id quaero, tibi qui filium restituerem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:3:1:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 3, 1, 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quonam modo maxime ulti sanguinem nostrum pereamus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 33:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 33,5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fugam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:17:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 7, 17, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:37:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 37, 80</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sibi remedium ad rem aliquam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:9:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 9, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de gratiā quid significares, mecum ipse quaerebam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 9, 11</bibl></cit>, A, 1.—With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tristitiae causam si quis cognoscere quaerit,</quote> <trans><tr>seeks</tr>, <tr>strives</tr>, <tr>endeavors</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:4:7" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 5, 4, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:8:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 1, 8, 51</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:4:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 4, 39</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 2 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n39941.10" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n39941.11" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To look for</hi>, <hi rend="ital">seek to gain</hi> any thing; <hi rend="ital">to get</hi>, <hi rend="ital">acquire</hi>, <hi rend="ital">obtain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">procure</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">laudem sibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:2:3:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 2, 3, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">salutem alicui malo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ad. 3, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">negabant ullā aliā in re nisi in naturā quaerendum esse illud summum bonum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 1, 5, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pudentem exitum suae impudentiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:1:section=2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 1, § 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">invidiam in aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,030:17:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rab. Post. 17, 46</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n39941.12" n="2" level="3"> Of inanim. and abstr. subjects, <hi rend="ital">to demand</hi>, <hi rend="ital">need</hi>, <hi rend="ital">require</hi>, = requirere: <cit><quote lang="la">quod cujusquam oratoris eloquentiam quaereret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:10:section=29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 10, § 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lites ex limitibus judicem quaerant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:15:1" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 15, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum dictatoriam majestatem quaesivisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaerit Boeotia Dircen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:239" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 239</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n39941.13" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To seek to learn</hi> from any one; <hi rend="ital">to ask</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inquire</hi>, <hi rend="ital">interrogate</hi> (cf.: interrogo, percontor). </sense><sense id="n39941.14" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ab</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum ab iis saepius quaereret,</quote> <trans><tr>made inquiries</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaero abs te nunc, Hortensi, cum, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:83:section=191" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 83, § 191</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaesivit a medicis, quemadmodum se haberet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Dion, 2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Dion, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a quo cum quaesisset, quo se deduci vellet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Epam. 4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Epam. 4, 5</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:22:60" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 22, 60</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n39941.15" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">de</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaerebat paulo ante de me, quid, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:9:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 9, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de te ipso quaero, Vatini, utrum, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,023:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Vatin. 4, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaero de te, arbitrerisne, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cura tibi de quo quaerere nulla fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:3:18" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 4, 3, 18</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n39941.16" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ex</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaesivi ex Phaniā, quam in partem provinciae putaret, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 3, 6, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaerit ex solo ea, quae, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 18</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39941.17" n="(d)" level="5"> With a <hi rend="ital">rel.-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ille baro te putabat quaesiturum, unum caelum esset an innumerabilia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:26:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 26, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">natura fieret laudabile carmen, an arte, Quaesitum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:409" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 409</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaeritur inter medicos, cujus generis aquae sint utilissimae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 31, 3, 21, § 31</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39941.18" n="4" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To desire</hi>, </sense><sense id="n39941.19" n="a" level="4"> With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">e monte aliquo in alium transilire quaerens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:214" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 53, 79, § 214</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui mutare sedes quaerebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39941.20" n="b" level="4"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of animals, plants, etc., <hi rend="ital">to desire</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prefer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">seek</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">salictum et harundinetum ... umidum locum quaerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:23:5" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 23, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">glires aridum locum quaerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:ib. 3:15:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 15, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1</bibl>, praef. § <cit><quote lang="la">26: lupinum quaerit maxime sabulosa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:134" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 14, 36, § 134</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so of the soil: ager aquosus plus stercoris quaerit,</quote> <trans><tr>demands</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 6, 15</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39941.21" n="5" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To examine</hi> or <hi rend="ital">inquire into judicially</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to investigate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">institute an investigation;</hi> with <pb n="1502" /> <cb n="QUAE" /> <case>acc.</case> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">hunc abduce, vinci, rem quaere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 3</bibl></cit> (4), 36: <cit><quote lang="la">non dubitabat Minucius, quin iste (Verres) illo die rem illam quaesiturus non esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:29:section=72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 29, § 72</bibl></cit>. —With <hi rend="ital">de</hi> and <case>abl.</case> (class.; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">Krebs, Autibarb. p. 962 sq.): de pecuniis repetundis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:9:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 1, 9, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de morte alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:41:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 41, 119</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de servo in dominum,</quote> <trans><tr>to question by torture</tr>, <tr>put to the rack</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:22:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 22, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid per tormenta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:58" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legibus,</quote> <trans><tr>to investigate according to the laws</tr>, <tr>impartially</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:5:21:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 5, 21, 3</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n39941.22" n="b" level="4"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: si quaeris, si quaerimus (prop., <hi rend="ital">if we</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">you</hi>, <hi rend="ital">look well into the matter; if we</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">you</hi>, <hi rend="ital">would know the truth</hi>), <hi rend="ital">to say the truth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in fact</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to speak honestly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnino, si quaeris, ludi apparatissimi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">at sunt morosi, et anxii, et difficiles senes: si quaerimus, etiam avari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:18:65" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 18, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quaeritis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:62:254" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 62, 254</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">too, si verum quaeris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 12, 8, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si verum quaeritis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:34:146" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 34, 146</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si verum quaerimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:23:55" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 2, 23, 55</bibl></cit>: noli quaerere or quid quaeris? <hi rend="ital">in short</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in one word</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">noli quaerere: ita mihi pulcher hic dies visus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 4, 4, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid quaeris? biduo factus est mihi familiaris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 1, 2</bibl></cit>.— Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">quaesītus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">sought out.</hi> </sense><sense id="n39941.23" n="A" level="2"> In a good sense, <hi rend="ital">select</hi>, <hi rend="ital">special</hi>, <hi rend="ital">extraordinary</hi> (mostly post-Aug.): epulae quaesitissumae, Sall. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 2, 9, 9</bibl> (<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. 2:23:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. 2, 23, 4</bibl> Dietsch); <hi rend="ital">comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">leges quaesitiores (opp. simplices),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaesitior adulatio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 57</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaesitissimi honores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 53</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39941.24" n="B" level="2"> In a bad sense (opp. to what is natural), <hi rend="ital">far-fetched</hi>, <hi rend="ital">studied</hi>, <hi rend="ital">affected</hi>, <hi rend="ital">assumed</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">vitabit etiam quaesita nec ex tempore ficta, sed domo allata, quae plerumque sunt frigida,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:26:89" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 26, 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut numerus non quaesitus, sed ipse secutus esse videatur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 65, 219</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">comitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">asperitas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 3</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n39941.25" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">quaesītum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> </sense><sense id="n39941.26" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A question</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">accipe quaesiti causam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:793" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 793</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:278" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 1, 278</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:6:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 6, 82</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n39941.27" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A question</hi> as a rhetorical figure, = <foreign lang="greek">pu/sma,</foreign> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 5, § 524</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
quaesitio: <entryFree id="n39942" type="main" key="quaesi_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quaesītĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>quaero</etym>, <sense id="n39942.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a seeking</hi> or <hi rend="ital">searching after</hi> (post-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n39942.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">Psyche quaesitioni Cupidinis intenta, populos circuibat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 5, p. 171, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39942.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">a questioning by torture</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the question</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inquisition</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum postero ad quaesitionem retraheretur, proripuit se custodibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 45</bibl></cit>; Inscr. Bertol. Antiq. Aquilei. p. 300, n. 419.</sense></entryFree>
quaesitor: <entryFree id="n39943" type="main" key="quaesi_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quaesītor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n39943.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a seeker</hi>, <hi rend="ital">searcher</hi> (post-class.). </sense><sense id="n39943.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen., as for gold, connected with scrutator, <bibl default="NO"><author>Pacat.</author> Pan. Th. 28</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n39943.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">an investigator.</hi> </sense><sense id="n39943.3" n="A" level="2"> In judicial (esp. in criminal) matters, <hi rend="ital">an examiner</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inquisitor</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid mihi opus est sapiente judice? quid aequo quaesitore?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,007:6:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Font. 6, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:28:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sull. 28, 78</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:10:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 1, 10, 29</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaesitorem edere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:17:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 17, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaesitor Minos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:432" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 432</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 40:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 40, 4</bibl></cit>.— <cit><quote lang="la">Of Cicero, as the investigator of the Catilinarian conspiracy,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:4:5:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 4, 5, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">judex desiit esse, quaesitor est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Brev. Vit. 17:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Brev. Vit. 17, 3</bibl></cit>.— <cit><quote lang="la">Esp. of the prætor who presided in criminal trials,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:chapter=10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 1, 10</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n39943.4" n="B" level="2"> In a scientific point of view, <hi rend="ital">an inquirer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">examiner</hi>, <hi rend="ital">considerer</hi>, as a transl. of the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">skeptiko/s,</foreign> <hi rend="ital">a sceptic</hi> (post-class.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:11:5:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 11, 5, 2</bibl>: quaesitor ille solus animaeque corporisque, Prud. Hymn. ante Somn. 89.</sense></entryFree>
quaesitum: <entryFree id="n39944" type="main" key="quaesi_tum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quaesītum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. <itype>quaero</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> C.</entryFree>
quaesitura: <entryFree id="n39945" type="spur" key="quaesi_tu_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quaesītūra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, a false read. for quaestura, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 29</bibl>.</entryFree>
quaesitus: <entryFree id="n39946" type="main" key="quaesi_tus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quaesītus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from quaero.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n39947" type="main" key="quaesi_tus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quaesītus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype> (only in <sense id="n39947.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">abl. sing.</hi>), <gen>m.</gen> <etym>quaero</etym>. </sense><sense id="n39947.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A seeking</hi>, <hi rend="ital">searching</hi> (postAug.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 9, 10, § 51</bibl> (al. quae situs).— </sense><sense id="n39947.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Investigation</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(rem) semper quaesitu dignam putavi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 7, 8, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
quaeso: <entryFree id="n39948" type="main" key="quaeso"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quaeso</orth>, <itype>īvi or ĭi, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>old form of quaero; root kis-; Sanscr. cish-, to hunt out</etym>. <sense id="n39948.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To seek</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to seek to obtain</hi> any thing (ante-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">quaeso, ut significat idem, quod rogo, ita quaesere ponitur ab antiquis pro quaerere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=258" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 258</bibl></cit> Müll.: nautisque mari quaesentibus vitam, Enn. ap. Fest. l. l: quaese adveniente morbo nunc medicum tibi, Plaut. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 44, 30</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n39948.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To beg</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pray</hi>, <hi rend="ital">beseech</hi>, <hi rend="ital">entreat</hi> (class.; mostly in <hi rend="ital">first pers. sing.;</hi> syn.: rogo, oro, obsecro, <cb n="QUAE" /> peto, precor). </sense><sense id="n39948.2" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ut</hi>: Mars pater, te precor quaesoque, uti sies volens propitius mihi, etc., an ancient formula of prayer in <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 141, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem ut redeat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:2:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 2, 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">te, Juppiter, quaeso, Amphitruoni ut semper iratus sies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:3:2:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 3, 2, 52</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:7:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 4, 7, 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:1:2:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 1, 2, 52</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">deos, ut,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:2:4:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 2, 4, 11</bibl></cit>; Naev. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Donat.</author> ad Ter. Ad. 4, 1, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">peto quaesoque, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 4, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaeso, ut eum diem memoriae mandetis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 6, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a te quaeso et peto, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 3, 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaeso a vobis, ut, in hac causā, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Arch. 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaeso, hercle, ut liceat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 3, 2, 13</bibl></cit>; Caecil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 154, 13</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">515, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaeso obtestorque, ne,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,019:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Red. in Sen. 1, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">id uti permittatis, quaesumus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">precor quaesoque, ne, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:9:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 23, 9, 2</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n39948.3" n="(b)" level="5"> With simple <hi rend="ital">subj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">P. Decium quaeso mecum consulem faciatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 13</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39948.4" n="(g)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg> (thrown parenthetically into the sentence): quaeso, quaesumus, <hi rend="ital">I</hi> (or <hi rend="ital">we</hi>) <hi rend="ital">pray</hi>, <hi rend="ital">beg</hi>, <hi rend="ital">beseech;</hi> freq. as a mere intensive expression, <hi rend="ital">prithee</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaeso, quotiens dicendumst tibi?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:4:2:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 4, 2, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubinam est, quaeso?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:3:1:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 3, 1, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bona verba, quaeso,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:2:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> And. 1, 2, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tu, quaeso, crebro ad me scribe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:10:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 7, 10, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc eadem illa, quaeso, audite,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:46:section=102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 46, § 102</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipsum decretum, quaeso, cognoscite,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:9:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 9, 25</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 7, 1, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">12, 29, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">12, 30, 2</bibl>; 12, 35, 2; <cit><quote lang="la">12, 44, 3: hoc, quaeso, judices, diligenter attendite,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 9, 2, 56</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:9:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 9, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:15:8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 15, 8, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid, quaeso, interest inter unum et plures, si, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:39:61" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 39, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quamobrem aggredere, quaesumus, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:2:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 1, 2, 6</bibl></cit>: quaeso, etiamne tu has ineptias, <hi rend="ital">I beseech you</hi>, <hi rend="ital">for Heaven</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s sake</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:7:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 3, 7, 5</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n39948.5" n="(d)" level="5"> With <case>acc.</case> of object sought: <cit><quote lang="la">non divom pacem votis adit ac prece quaesit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1229" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1229</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
quaesticulus: <entryFree id="n39949" type="main" key="quaesti^cu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quaestĭcŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>quaestus</etym>, <sense id="n39949.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small profit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">slight gain</hi> (class.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:15:34" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 15, 34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:16:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 9, 16, 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 11, p. 272, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
quaestio: <entryFree id="n39950" type="main" key="quaesti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quaestĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>quaero</etym>, <sense id="n39950.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a seeking.</hi> </sense><sense id="n39950.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. (Plautin.): <cit><quote lang="la">cave, fuas mi in quaestione,</quote> <trans><tr>lest you suffer yourself to be to seek</tr>, <tr>lest I have to look after you</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:1:1:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 1, 1, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tibi ne in quaestione essemus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 2, 2, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:2:2:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 2, 2, 68</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n39950.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">an inquiry</hi>, <hi rend="ital">investigation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a questioning</hi>, <hi rend="ital">question</hi>, <hi rend="ital">subject of inquiry</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaestio est appetitio cognitionis, quaestionisque finis inventio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 8, 26</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 36, 115</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae veri simillima (sententia sit), magna quaestio est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:11:23" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 11, 23</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:11:34" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 11, 34</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">rem in disceptationem quaestionemque vocare,</quote> <trans><tr>to investigate</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:32:129" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 32, 129</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res in quaestione versatur,</quote> <trans><tr>is under investigation</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:58:159" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 58, 159</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de moribus ultima fiet quaestio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:141" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 141</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res in quaestionem venit,</quote> <trans><tr>comes under investigation</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:14:16" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 14, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">modo aliquam quaestionem poëticam ei proponeret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:20:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 20, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 7, 19 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 5:8:6" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 5, 8, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 48:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 48, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:56" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 56</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaestionem instituere,</quote> <trans><tr>to institute an investigation</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:1:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 1, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaestionem solvere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 48:11" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 48, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:26" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 10, 26</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n39950.3" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A public judicial investigation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">examination by torture</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a criminal inquiry</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inquisition;</hi> the crime is usu. constr. with <hi rend="ital">de</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum praetor quaestionem inter sicarios exercuisset,</quote> <trans><tr>instituted a trial for assassination</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:16:54" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 16, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verberibus ac tormentis quaestionem habuit pecuniae publicae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:11:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 11, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaestionem mortis paternae de servis paternis habere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:28:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 28, 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaestionem fugitare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 28, 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">servos in quaestionem polliceri,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 28, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaestionem ferre in aliquem,</quote> <trans><tr>to appoint</tr>, <tr>institute</tr>, <tr>make a motion for</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:53:227" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 53, 227</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">habere ex aliquo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 33, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facere alicui,</quote> <trans><tr>against any one</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:34:3:20" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 34, 3, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaestionem de furto constituere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:64:181" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 64, 181</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaestionem instituere de morte alicujus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 64, 181</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaestionem de morte viri habere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 65, 182</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">63, 176: quaestionem habere de servis in caput filii,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 63, 176</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad quaestionem abripi,</quote> <trans><tr>to examination by torture</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 33, 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui servum in quaestionem ferre,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 64, 181</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">postulare servum in quaestionem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 64, 181</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaestiones severius exercere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaestioni praeesse,</quote> <trans><tr>to conduct a trial as judge</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:4:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 4, 11</bibl></cit>: quaestiones perpetuae, <hi rend="ital">the inquisitions concerning certain crimes</hi> (repetundarum, majestatis, de <cb n="QUAE" /> falso, de sicariis, de injuriis, etc.), <hi rend="ital">conducted annually</hi>, <hi rend="ital">after</hi> 605 A. U. C., <hi rend="ital">by a standing commission</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and presided over by the prætor</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:27:106" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 27, 106</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">judex quaestionis,</quote> <trans><tr>the director of the criminal court under the presidency of the prætor</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:54:148" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 54, 148</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">33, 89</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:76:264" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 76, 264</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaestiones extraordinariae,</quote> <trans><tr>trials out of the common course</tr>, <tr>held under a special commission</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 14</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">quaestio nova,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 5, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">A QVAESTIONIBVS,</quote> <trans><tr>an attendant in examinations</tr>, <tr>a torturer</tr>, <tr>inquisitor</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 545, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">560, 1</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n39950.4" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n39950.5" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The court</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the judges</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dimittere eo tempore quaestionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:30:section=74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 30, § 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">totam quaestionem a severitate ad clementiam transtulit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:8:1:6" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 8, 1, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39950.6" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The subject of investigation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the matter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">case</hi>, <hi rend="ital">question</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">perdifficilis et perobscura quaestio est de naturā deorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:1:1" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dividere totam de dis immortalibus quaestionem in partis quattuor,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaestio proposita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:39" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 2, 39</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n39950.7" n="b" level="4"> In partic., in rhet. </sense><sense id="n39950.8" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">The rhetorical subject of debate</hi>: quaestionum duo sunt genera: alterum infinitum, alterum definitum.
