Definitum est, quod <foreign lang="greek">u(po/qesin</foreign> Graeci, nos causam: infinitum, quod <foreign lang="greek">qe/sin</foreign> illi appellant, nos propositum possumus nominare, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:21:79" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Top. 21, 79</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n39950.9" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">The main point in a disputed matter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the issue in a cause</hi>: quaestio est quae ex conflictione causarum gignitur controversia, hoc modo: Non jure fecisti: jure feci. Causarum autem haec est conflictio, in quā constitutio constat; <cit><quote lang="la">ex eā igitur nascitur controversia, quam quaestionem dicimus, hoc modo: jurene fecerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:13:18" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 13, 18</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 6, 8</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n39950.10" n="(g)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">A question</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a disputed point</hi>, quaestio est, <hi rend="ital">it is doubtful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">may be disputed</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sapientia efficit sapientis sola per se: beatos efficiat necne sola per se quaestio est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:15:60" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Top. 15, 60</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:13:29" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 4, 13, 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:20:60" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 2, 20, 60</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaestio est, an, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:3:22" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 3, 22</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">nulla quaestio est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Retract. 1:19:6" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Retract. 1, 19, 6</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">also: in quaestione est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 17, 18, § 57</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:52" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 22, 27, § 52</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaestionis est immensae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 7, 28, 29, § 101</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:10" default="NO" valid="yes">28, 2, 3, § 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
quaestionaliter: <entryFree id="n39951" type="main" key="quaesti^o_na_li^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quaestĭōnālĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>quaestio</etym>, <sense id="n39951.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">by way of question</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in the form of a question</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">propositio quaestionaliter posita,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Fulg.</author> Prisc. Serm. 16</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
quaestionarius: <entryFree id="n39952" type="main" key="quaesti^o_na_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quaestĭōnārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n39952.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a torturer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">executioner</hi> (post-class.), Cod. Th. 16, 12, 3; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> in Joel. 2, 21</bibl>; Schol. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:480" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 480</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 545, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
quaestiono: <entryFree id="n39953" type="main" key="quaesti^o_no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quaestĭōno</orth>, <itype>āvi, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n39953.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">put to the question</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">put to the torture</hi>, <hi rend="ital">put to the rack</hi> (eccl. Lat. and rare): omnes quaestionari, Fragm. Jur. Civ. Ante-<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:page=109" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> p. 109</bibl> Mai: <cit><quote lang="la">tot confessores quaestionati et torti,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cypr.</author> Ep. 69</bibl></cit>, n. 6.</sense></entryFree>
quaestiuncula: <entryFree id="n39954" type="main" key="quaesti^uncu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quaestĭuncŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n39954.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little</hi> or <hi rend="ital">trifling question</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">quaestiunculam alicui ponere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:22:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 22, 102</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 117:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 117, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">multae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:20:51" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 20, 51</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:3:11" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 3, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,004:24" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Gram. 24 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
quaestor: <entryFree id="n39955" type="main" key="quaestor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quaestor</orth> (old orthogr., QVAISTOR, Epit. of the Scipios, et saep.), <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>contr. from quaesitor, from quaero</etym>, <sense id="n39955.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a quætor</hi>, the title of a class of Roman magistrates, some of whom had charge of the pecuniary affairs of the State, while others conducted certain criminal trials (but only, it would seem, as delegates or commissioners of the people): <cit><quote lang="la">quaestores a quaerendo, qui conquirerent publicas pecunias et maleficia, quae triumviri capitales nunc conquirunt: ab his postea, qui quaestionum judicia exercent, quaestores dicti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=81" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 81</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">et quia de capite civis Romani injussu populi non erat lege permissum consulibus jus dicere, propterea quaestores constituebantur a populo, qui capitalibus rebus praeessent: hique appellabantur quaestores parricidii, quorum etiam meminit lex duodecim tabularum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:2:2:section=23" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 1, 2, 2, § 23</bibl></cit>; cf.: parricidii quaestores appellabantur, qui solebant creari causā rerum capitalium quaerendarum, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=221" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 221</bibl> Müll. (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=258:31" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 258, 31</bibl>). But they were commonly called simply quaestores, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:41:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 41, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:24:3" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 24, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:35:60" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 35, 60</bibl>.— As a standing magistracy, the quæstors were <hi rend="ital">treasurers of State</hi>, <hi rend="ital">treasurers.</hi> They distributed their duties among themselves by lot, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:13:section=34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 13, § 34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:8:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 8, 18</bibl>. Of these the quaestor urbanus or aerarii, who remained at Rome, took charge of the treasury, of the <pb n="1503" /> <cb n="QUAE" /> public revenues and expenditures, of the standards deposited in the aerarium, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:1:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 1, 2, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,021:20:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Har. Resp. 20, 43</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 1, 4, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:47" default="NO" valid="yes">26, 47</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:5:1:1" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 5, 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 28</bibl>. The quæstors appointed as assistants to the consuls or prætors for the provinces, called quaestores provinciales or militares, provided for the payment and provisioning of the troops, collected the imposts, and, in the absence of the governor, acted in his stead, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:19:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Div. in Caecil. 19, 61</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:11:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 11, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:10:32" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 10, 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 47</bibl>. Service in the higher offices of State began with the quæstorship, the lowest of them which conferred a seat in the Senate, to which no one was legally eligible before the age of twenty-five, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:11:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 11, 22</bibl>. Augustus instituted a new sort of quæstors, quaestores candidati or principis (Caesaris), who conveyed the imperial messages to the Senate, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:7:16:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 7, 16, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Alex. Sev. 43, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">oratio principis per quaestorem ejus audita est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:16:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 16, 27</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:13:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 1, 13, 1</bibl>; cf. candidatus, 2. The emperor Constantine appointed quaestores palatii or chancellors, Cod. Th. 1, 8; 6, 9; 7, 62, 32; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 6, 5</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">called QVAESTOR INTRA PALATIVM,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 1188</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n39955.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaestor non imperii, sed doloris mei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,019:14:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Red. in Sen. 14, 35</bibl></cit> (bracketed as dub. by B. and K.).</sense></entryFree>
quaestoricius: <entryFree id="n39956" type="gloss" key="quaesto_ri_ci^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quaestōrīcĭus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-tĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>quaestor</etym>, <sense id="n39956.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a quæstor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quæstorian</hi>: QVAESTORICII, <hi rend="ital">who had been quæstors</hi>, Tab. Canusin. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3721</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
quaestorius: <entryFree id="n39957" type="main" key="quaesto_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quaestōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n39957.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a quæstor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quæstorian</hi> (quite class.): <cit><quote lang="la">officium quaestorium,</quote> <trans><tr>the duty of a quæstor</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:17:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 2, 17, 6</bibl></cit>: scelus, <hi rend="ital">perpetrated in the quæstorship</hi> or <hi rend="ital">by a quæstor</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 1, 1, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aetas,</quote> <trans><tr>the age requisite for the quæstorship</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:6:1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 6, 1</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">adulescentes jam aetate quaestorios,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:12:18" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 12, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scribae,</quote> <trans><tr>of the quæstor</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:10" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 10</bibl></cit>: scriptum quaestorium comparavit, <hi rend="ital">acted as secretary to a quæstor</hi>, id. Vit. Hor.: munera, i. e. <hi rend="ital">gladiatorial combats</hi>, which the quæstors were obliged to furnish at their own expense, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:chapter=4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Dom. 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">comitia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:30:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 7, 30, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 54 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: porta, <hi rend="ital">a gate in the camp near the quæstor</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s tent</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 47</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">forum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 41, 2</bibl></cit>: agri, <hi rend="ital">taken from the enemy and sold by the quæstor</hi>, Auct. Rei Agr. Sicul. Fl. p. 2: <cit><quote lang="la">dignitas, Cod. Th. 1, 1, 6, § 2: legatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:21:section=56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 21, § 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ornamenta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:28" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 28</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n39957.1" n="II" level="1"> <pos>Subst.</pos> </sense><sense id="n39957.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">quaestōrĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">one who had been quæstor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an ex-quæstor</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:76:263" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 76, 263</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:13:14:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 13, 14, 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=otho:3" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Oth. 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:2:2:section=45" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 1, 2, 2, § 45</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3990</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n39957.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">quaestō-rĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> </sense><sense id="n39957.4" n="1" level="3"> (Sc. tentorium.) <hi rend="ital">The quæstor</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s tent</hi> in the camp, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:32:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 32, 8</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n39957.5" n="2" level="3"> (Sc. aedificium.) <hi rend="ital">The residence of the quæstor</hi> in a province: <cit><quote lang="la">Thessalonicam me in quaestoriumque perduxit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:41:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 41, 99</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
quaestuarius: <entryFree id="n39958" type="main" key="quaestu^a_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quaestŭārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>quaestus</etym>, <sense id="n39958.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to gain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">money-making</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mercenary</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">quaestuaria mancipia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:3:2:4:section=2" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 3, 2, 4, § 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mulier,</quote> <trans><tr>a prostitute for hire</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:23:2:43:section=7" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 23, 2, 43, § 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">majestas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Apol. 13</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n39958.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <itype>quaestuaria, ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a prostitute</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex adulterā in quaestuariam versa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 6:32:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 6, 32, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
quaestuose: <entryFree id="n39959" type="main" key="quaestu^o_se_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quaestŭōsē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. quaestuosus <sense id="n39959.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
quaestuosus: <entryFree id="n39960" type="main" key="quaestu^o_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quaestŭōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>quaestus</etym>. <sense id="n39960.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Gainful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">profitable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">advantageous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lucrative</hi>, <hi rend="ital">productive</hi> (class.; <cit><quote lang="la">syn. lucrosus): ager,</quote> <trans><tr>productive</tr>, <tr>fruitful</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 1, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mercatura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:31:86" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 31, 86</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:30:91" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 30, 91</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaestuosissima officina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:14:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 14, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res Verri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:19:section=46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 19, § 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">uberrimus et quaestuosissimus annus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 14, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc multo est quaestuosius, quam, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:25:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 25, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">benignitas quaestuosior,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 4, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">edictum quaestuosissimum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:14:section=36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 14, § 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">insula quaestuosa margaritis,</quote> <trans><tr>rich in</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 25, 28, § 110</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">emporium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 15</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39960.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">That looks to one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s own gain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">advantage</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">profit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">eager for gain</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaestuosus homo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:6:3:49" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Par. 6, 3, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:7:19" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 7, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec satis in arte eā quaestuosus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 3, 7, § 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dummodo eam (mulierem) des, quae sit quaestuosa,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>a prostitute</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:190" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 190</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39960.2" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">That has great gain</hi> or <hi rend="ital">profit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wealthy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rich</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">gens Syrtica navigiorum spoliis quaestuosa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:7:19" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 7, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Graeci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 4, 13, § 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">milites,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 35</bibl></cit>: quaestuosi et opulenti, id. <cb n="QUAL" /> <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 12, 63</bibl>.— <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">quaestŭōsē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">gainfully</hi>, <hi rend="ital">advantageously</hi>, <hi rend="ital">profitably</hi> (post-Aug.). —<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaestuosius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 4, 19, § 56</bibl></cit>. — <hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaestuosissime,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 4:3:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 4, 3, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
quaestura: <entryFree id="n39961" type="main" key="quaestu_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quaestūra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>quaestor</etym>, <sense id="n39961.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the office of quæstor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the quæstorship</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">quaestura primus gradus honoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 1, 4, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaesturam petere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:8:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 8, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 29</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex quaesturā consulatum petere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 32, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gerere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:1" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 1</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n39961.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the quæstor</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s chest</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">translator quaesturae,</quote> <trans><tr>an embezzler of the public chest</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:58:section=152" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 58, § 152</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
quaestus: <entryFree id="n39962" type="main" key="quaestus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quaestus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype> (archaic <sense id="n39962.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> quaesti, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:1:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 1, 2, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:prol. 95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. prol. 95</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:5:3:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 5, 3, 38</bibl>; Titin., Nov., Turp., and Caecil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 483, 19 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:ib. 492:20" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> ib. 492, 20</bibl>.— <hi rend="ital">Gen.</hi> quaestuis, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 483, 32</bibl>), <gen>m.</gen> <etym>quaero</etym>, <hi rend="ital">a gaining</hi>, <hi rend="ital">acquiring; gain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">acquisition</hi>, <hi rend="ital">profit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">advantage</hi> (quite class.; syn.: lucrum, emolimentum). </sense><sense id="n39962.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaestus pecuniae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:17:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 17, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">emendi aut vendendi quaestu et lucro duci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:3:9" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 3, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pauperes homines, quibus nec quaestus est, nec, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 2, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad suom quemque hominem quaestum esse aequomst callidum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:3:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 1, 3, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaestus ac lucrum unius agri, et unius anni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:44:section=106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 44, § 106</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum quaestu compendioque dimittere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 2, 3</bibl></cit>, § <cit><quote lang="la">6: quibus fides, decus, pietas, postremo honesta atque inhonesta omnia quaestui sunt,</quote> <trans><tr>are venal</tr>, <tr>are turned to gain</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 31:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 31, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaestui deditum esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 13:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 13, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaestui servire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 3, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad suom quaestum callere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:5:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 5, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in quaestu esse,</quote> <trans><tr>to bring gain</tr>, <tr>be turned to profit</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1</bibl></cit>, prooem. § 13: quaestui habere rem publicam, <hi rend="ital">to derive advantage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">enrich one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s self</hi>, <hi rend="ital">by the administration of public affairs</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:22:77" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 22, 77</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecuniam in quaestu relinquere,</quote> <trans><tr>to let out money at interest</tr>, <tr>on usury</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:35:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 35, 86</bibl></cit>.— <cit><quote lang="la">Prov.: non potest quaestus consistere, si eum sumptus superat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:2:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 1, 2, 74</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">is (sumptibus suis) vel Herculi conterere quaestum possiet,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>he could spend all the tithes offered to Hercules</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:4:2:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 4, 2, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes homines ad suom quaestum callent et fastidiunt,</quote> <trans><tr>every one looks to his own interest</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:5:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 2, 5, 40</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 4, 62</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n39962.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a way of making money</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a business</hi>, <hi rend="ital">occupation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">employment</hi>, <hi rend="ital">trade</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">meretricius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:18:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 18, 44</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">meretricii quaestus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 1:2:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 1, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de quaestibus, qui liberales habendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:42:150" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 42, 150</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:3:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 4, 3, 50</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">malus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:2:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 3, 2, 92</bibl></cit>.— <cit><quote lang="la">Of a prostitute (freq. and class.): corpore indignum quaestum facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:3:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 5, 3, 21</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:33:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 33, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 85</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:6:1:6" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 6, 1, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaestum corpore factitare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:6:1:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 1, 10</bibl></cit>; so without <hi rend="ital">corpore</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">uti quaestum faceret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:4:1:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 4, 1, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaestum occipit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:1:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> And. 1, 1, 52</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:2:1:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ad. 2, 1, 52</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:1:1:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 1, 1, 30</bibl>.—Of a parasite: <cit><quote lang="la">antiquom quaestum meum alimoniae servo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:1:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 1, 2, 1</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n39962.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">gain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">profit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">advantage</hi>: qui sui quaestus causā fictas suscitant sententias, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:40:88" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 40, 88</bibl> (Trag. v. 447 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">ut quaestui habeant male loqui melioribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:3:3:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 3, 3, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nullum in eo facio quaestum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:15:14:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 15, 14, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">est autem quaestus magnus pietas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,015:6:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Tim. 6, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
qualibescit: <entryFree id="n39963" type="gloss" key="qua_li^bescit"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quā-lĭbescit</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, for qualibet, <sense id="n39963.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">everywhere</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in every way</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Not. Tir.</author> p. 35</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
qualibet: <entryFree id="n39964" type="main" key="qua_li^bet"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quālĭbet</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">-lŭbet</orth>, <case>abl.</case> from quilibet), <sense id="n39964.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">where it pleases</hi>, i. e. </sense><sense id="n39964.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Where you will</hi>, <hi rend="ital">everywhere</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qualibet perambula aedes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:2:122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 3, 2, 122</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:4:4:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 4, 4, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quisquis amore tenetur, eat tutusque sacerque qualibet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:2:27" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 2, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">transitum praebent (flumina),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:13:13" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 13, 13</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n39964.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">As you please</hi>, <hi rend="ital">anyhow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in any way</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qualubet esse notus optas?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:40:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 40, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:76:13" default="NO" valid="yes">76, 13</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
qualis: <entryFree id="n39965" type="main" key="qua_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>pron. adj.</pos> <etym>quis; kindr. with Gr. <foreign lang="greek">ph-li/kos;</foreign> Goth. huc-leik; Germ. welcher</etym>, <sense id="n39965.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">how constituted</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of what sort</hi>, <hi rend="ital">kind</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">nature</hi>, <hi rend="ital">what kind of a</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n39965.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Interrog.</hi>: qualine amico mea commendavi bona? <hi rend="ital">Call.</hi> Probo, et fideli, et fido, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 4, 4, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">qualis oratoris et quanti hominis in dicendo putas esse historiam scribere?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:12:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 12, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quali fide, quali pietate existimatis eos esse, qui, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,007:10:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Font. 10, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qualis est istorum oratio?</quote> <trans><tr>what kind of a speech is that?</tr></trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 14, 44</bibl></cit> — <cit><quote lang="la">In exclamations: hei mihi, qualis erat!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:274" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 274</bibl></cit>; Enn. ap. Serv. ad loc. (Ann. v. 7 <cb n="QUAL" /> Vahl.): O Romule, Romule, dic, qualem te patriae custodem di genuerunt! Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:41:64" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 41, 64</bibl> (Ann. v. 116 Vahl.).— <cit><quote lang="la">In indirect questions: nam cogitato, qualem haberes gratiam (si, etc.),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:5:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 5, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego te qualis sis scio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:2:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 2, 2, 40</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:6:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 4, 6, 20</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipsius rei natura qualis et quanta sit quaerimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:23:56" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 23, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qualis esset natura montis, cognoscere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">doce me quales sint corpore,</quote> <trans><tr>what sort of a body they have</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:23:65" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 23, 65</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n39965.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Rel.</hi>, with or without the correlative <hi rend="ital">talis</hi>, <hi rend="ital">so constituted</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of such a sort</hi>, <hi rend="ital">kind</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">nature</hi>, <hi rend="ital">such as</hi>, <hi rend="ital">as</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut qualem te jam antea populo Romano, praebuisti, talem te et nobis impertias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:4:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 4, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut res non tales, quales ante habitae sint, habendae videantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:58:176" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 2, 58, 176</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:13:44" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 13, 44</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in hoc bello, quale bellum nulla barbaria gessit,</quote> <trans><tr>the like of which</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:3:10:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 3, 10, 25</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:7:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 7, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">equitum acies, qualis quae esse instructissima potest, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tale tuum carmen nobis, quale, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:5:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 5, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bis sex ... qualia nunc hominum producit corpora tellus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:899" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 12, 899</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n39965.3" n="B" level="2"> Esp., in quotations and citations, <hi rend="ital">as</hi>, <hi rend="ital">as for instance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">as for example</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aperta et clara (somnia), quale est de illo, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:66:135" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 66, 135</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum proposito dissimili vel contrario ratio subjungitur: quale est Demosthenis: non enim, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:14:4" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 14, 4</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:65" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 5, 65</bibl> Zumpt <hi rend="ital">N. cr.;</hi> 3, 6, 41; 3, 11, 6 et saep. al.—</sense><sense id="n39965.4" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg> for the <pos>adv.</pos> qualiter, <hi rend="ital">as</hi>, <hi rend="ital">just as</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qualis populea moerens philomela sub umbra Amissos queritur fetus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:511" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 511</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:679" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 3, 679</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 143</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quale caelum Subrubet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:5:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 2, 5, 35</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:682" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 3, 682</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n39965.5" n="3" level="3"> Repeated: qualis qualis (post-class. for qualiscumque), <hi rend="ital">of what quality soever</hi>, <hi rend="ital">whatsoever</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quali quali obligatione interpositā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:20:5:12" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 20, 5, 12</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39965.6" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Indef.</hi>: quale, <hi rend="ital">having some quality or other</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">et ita effici quae appellant qualia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 1, 7, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prius aliquid esse debet, deinde quale esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 117:28" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 117, 28</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">quā-lĭter</orth>. </sense><sense id="n39965.7" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">In what way</hi> or <hi rend="ital">manner</hi>, <hi rend="ital">how</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">refert, villa qualiter aedificetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:4:6" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 4, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:5:7:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 5, 7, 1</bibl>.— Qualiter qualiter, <hi rend="ital">in what manner soever</hi>, for qualitercumque (postclass.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:4:4:7" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 4, 4, 7</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n39965.8" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Just as</hi>, <hi rend="ital">as</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lacri mae fluxere per ora, Qualiter abjectā de nive manat aquā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:7:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 7, 57</bibl></cit>; Cels. praef. p. 6; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:5:305" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 5, 305</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:193" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 48, 73, § 193</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n39965.9" n="C" level="2"> Repeated: <cit><quote lang="la">qualiter qualiter,</quote> <trans><tr>in whatever manner</tr>, <tr>however</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:4:4:7" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 4, 4, 7</bibl></cit> pr.; 9, 2, 7, § 1; 26, 7, 5, § 10.</sense></entryFree>
qualiscumque: <entryFree id="n39966" type="main" key="qua_liscumque"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quālis-cumque</orth>, quale-cumque, or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-cunque</orth> (separated: <sense id="n39966.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">quale id cumque est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:30:76" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 30, 76</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:13:6" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 4, 13, 6</bibl>), <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>qualis</etym>. </sense><sense id="n39966.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Rel.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of what quality soever</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of whatever kind</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n39966.2" n="A" level="2"> With <hi rend="ital">verb</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">licet videre, qualescumque summi civitatis viri fuerunt, talem civitatem fuisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:14:31" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 3, 14, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed homines benevolos, qualescumque sunt, grave est insequi contumeliā,</quote> <trans><tr>be they as they may</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:14:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 14, 14, 5</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n39966.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg> by ellipsis of <hi rend="ital">verb</hi>, in emphatic expressions (v. Zumpt, § <cit><quote lang="la">706): qualicumque urbis statu sisti potuisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:44:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 44, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pluris qualemcunque vitam honestā morte aestimare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:8:6" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 8, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si libertatem sequimur, qui locus hoc dominatu vacat? Sin qualemcunque locum, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 4, 8, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:6:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 9, 6, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">imperatores voto expetere, qualescumque tolerare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:11:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 11, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">carmina lector Commendet dulci qualiacumque sono,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:283" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 2, 283</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:9:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 9, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:10:1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 10, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:14" default="NO">11, 1, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:9:12" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 9, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:8" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:141" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 16, 40, § 141</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n39966.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">indef.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">any without exception</hi>, <hi rend="ital">any whatever</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sin qualemcumque locum sequimur, quae est domestica sede jucundior?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 4, 8, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Manil.</author> 2, 856</bibl>. — <itype>Hence</itype>, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">quālĭtercumquē</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-cunquē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">in what way soever</hi>, <hi rend="ital">howsoever</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be it as it may</hi> (post-Aug.), i. q. utcunque, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:10:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 10, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">proeliare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:11:11" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 2, 11, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:19:1" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 19, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:3:34" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 3, 34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:27:1:21" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 27, 1, 21</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
qualislibet: <entryFree id="n39967" type="main" key="qua_lisli^bet"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quālis-lĭbet</orth>, quale-libet, <sense id="n39967.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pron. indef.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of what quality it pleases</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of what sort you will</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">pisces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2003,001:4:2:section=143" default="NO"><author>Apic.</author> 4, 2, § 143</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Ep. 48" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Ep. 48</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud. Mam.</author> Stat. Anim. 1, 21</bibl> (in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:37:93" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 37, 93</bibl>, written separately).</sense></entryFree>
qualisnam: <entryFree id="n39968" type="main" key="qua_lisnam"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quālis-nam</orth>, <sense id="n39968.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pron. rel.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of what quality</hi>, <hi rend="ital">what sort of a</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">qualisnam accusatio futura esset,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 274, 21</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
qualisqualis: <entryFree id="n39969" type="main" key="qua_lisqua_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quālis-quālis</orth>, <itype>quālequāle</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, i. q. qualiscumque, <sense id="n39969.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of what quality soever</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> <pb n="1504" /> <cb n="QUAM" /> <hi rend="ital">whatever kind</hi> (post-class.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:4:9:7:section=4" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 4, 9, 7, § 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:25:4:1:section=13" default="NO">25, 4, 1, § 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:43:8:2:section=11" default="NO">43, 8, 2, § 11</bibl>; 50, 14, 3 al.</sense></entryFree>
qualitas: <entryFree id="n39970" type="main" key="qua_li^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quālĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>qualis, III.</etym>, <sense id="n39970.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a quality</hi>, <hi rend="ital">property</hi>, <hi rend="ital">nature</hi>, <hi rend="ital">state</hi>, <hi rend="ital">condition</hi> (class.; a word formed by Cicero as the translation of Gr. <foreign lang="greek">poio/ths;</foreign> freq. only in postclass. prose), <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 1, 6, 24</bibl>; cf.: qualitates igitur appellavi, quas <foreign lang="greek">poio/thtas</foreign> Graeci vocant: <cit><quote lang="la">quod ipsum apud Graecos non est vulgi verbum, sed philosophorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 7, 25</bibl></cit> sq.; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:37:94" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 37, 94</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">litoris nostri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:17:8" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 17, 8</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">caeli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:9:15" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 9, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:4:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 4, 16</bibl></cit> et saep.— In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">qualitatium differentia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:159" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 22, 44, § 159</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ager aliis qualitatibus aestimandus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:2:17" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 2, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in verbis genera et qualitates et personas et numeros,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>moods</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:4:27" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 4, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pro qualitate mensurae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,015:28:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Par. 28, 17</bibl></cit>: sicut in organo qualitatis sonus immutatur, <hi rend="ital">the sound of the mode</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">rhythm</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,033:19:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sap. 19, 17</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
qualiter: <entryFree id="n39971" type="main" key="qua_li^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quālĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. qualis <sense id="n39971.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
qualitercumque: <entryFree id="n39972" type="main" key="qua_li^tercumque_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quālĭtercumquē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. qualiscumque <sense id="n39972.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
qualum: <entryFree id="n39973" type="main" key="qua_lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quālum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">quālus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n39973.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a wicker basket</hi> or <hi rend="ital">hamper</hi>, for various purposes; <hi rend="ital">a fruit-hamper</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wool-basket</hi>, <hi rend="ital">winestrainer</hi>, etc. (cf. colum). </sense><sense id="n39973.1" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quala satoria,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 11, 5</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">quala,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 23, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mundissima,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:3:9" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 3, 9</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n39973.2" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Masc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in qualos pertusos propagari,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 52, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spisso vimine qualos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:241" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 241</bibl></cit> Serv.; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:12:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 12, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">saligneus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:15:12" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 9, 15, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:3:4" default="NO">8, 3, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vindemiatorii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:33:7:8" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 33, 7, 8</bibl></cit> pr.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 4, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
quam: <entryFree id="n39974" type="main" key="quam"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quam</orth> (archaic form <orth extent="full" lang="la">quamde</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">quande</orth>: <sense id="n39974.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">quamde pro quam usos esse antiquos, cum multi veteres testimonio sunt, tum Ennius ... et Lucretius (1, 640),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=261" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 261</bibl></cit> Müll.; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0043,001:v. 29" default="NO"><author>Enn.</author> Ann. v. 29</bibl>, and v. 139 Vahl. So, too, Naev. ap. Fest. s. v. topper, p. 352 Müll.), <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>qui</etym>, <hi rend="ital">in what manner</hi>, <hi rend="ital">how</hi>, <hi rend="ital">how much</hi>, <hi rend="ital">as much as</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam nihil praetermittis in consilio dando! quam nihil tamen, quod tibi placeat, explicas!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 2</bibl></cit>, A, 1: <cit><quote lang="la">ut se accusari nolunt! quam cupiunt laudari!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:22:61" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 22, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam multa, quam paucis!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:24:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 11, 24, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam sint morosi, intellegi potest,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 15, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam vellet, cunctaretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:26:56" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 26, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">memoriā tenetis, quam valde universi admurmurarint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:16:section=41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 16, § 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam quisque potest,</quote> <trans><tr>as much as each one can</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:4:75" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 3, 4, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam potuit,</quote> <trans><tr>as far as he was able</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:4:1:5" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 4, 1, 5</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">possum</hi> and a <hi rend="ital">sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">concede huc ab isto, quam potest longissime,</quote> <trans><tr>as far as possible</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:2:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 5, 2, 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam possunt mollissime,</quote> <trans><tr>as gently as possible</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:52:129" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 52, 129</bibl></cit>.—Also without <hi rend="ital">possum</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam maximas, quam primum, quam saepissime gratias agere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:6:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 13, 6, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut quam angustissime Pompeium contineret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 45</bibl></cit>.— With <hi rend="ital">posit.</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">tum Manlius ... quam poterat clarā voce denuntiavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:6:4:1" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 6, 4, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:3:2:1" default="NO">3, 2, 1</bibl> <hi rend="ital">ext.;</hi> 4, 5, 1: <cit><quote lang="la">dixi de philosophiā quam breviter potui,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 3, 17, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tusa cribrataque vino, quam possit excellenti,</quote> <trans><tr>as excellent as possible</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:264" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 24, 100, § 264</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:274" default="NO" valid="yes">18, 28, 68, § 274</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n39974.1" n="B" level="2"> In dependent clauses, indirect questions, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">est fidei nostrae, declarare, quam memores simus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:14:11:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 14, 11, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scio, quam timida sit ambitio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:16:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 16, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam id ratum sit, tu judicabis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 6, 1, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">id quam injustum esset, non videbat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:21:82" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 21, 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dici non potest quam sim disputatione tuā delectatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:4:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 2, 4, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:20:52" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 20, 52</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 17, 52</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:11:37" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 11, 37</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 20, 65</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 12, 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:18:section=47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 18, § 47</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 1, 21, § 52</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 4, 44, § 98</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">videte quam iniqui sint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 85:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 85, 25</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:62:9" default="NO" valid="yes">62, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut sentias quam vile sit corpus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:12:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 12, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes">24, 5, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,013:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Timoth. 4, 2</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n39974.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n39974.3" n="A" level="2"> In comparisons, <hi rend="ital">as</hi>, <hi rend="ital">than.</hi> </sense><sense id="n39974.4" n="1" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">tam</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tam ego ante fui liber, quam gnatus tuos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:2:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 2, 2, 60</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 4, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si era me sciat tam socordem esse quam sum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:4:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cist. 4, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tua est imago: tam consimilis est, quam potest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:9:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 5, 9, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tam esse clemens tyrannus quam rex importunus potest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:33:50" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 33, 50</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:6:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 6, 10</bibl> et saep.; v. tam.—</sense><sense id="n39974.5" n="2" level="3"> With ellipsis of corresp. <hi rend="ital">tam</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo non, quam isti sunt, gloriosus,</quote> <trans><tr>not so celebrated as those</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 35, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">claris majoribus, quam vetustis,</quote> <trans><tr>rather than</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 61</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39974.6" n="3" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">sup.</hi> and a corresp. <hi rend="ital">tam</hi>, <hi rend="ital">by how much the more</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the more</hi>: quam acerbissima olea oleum facies, tam oleum <cb n="QUAM" /> optimum erit, <hi rend="ital">the bitterer the olives</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the better will be the oil</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 65, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam paucissimos reliqueris, tam optimi fiunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:9" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam quisque pessume fecit, tam maxume tutus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 31:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 31, 14</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n39974.7" n="4" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">magis</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam magis ... tam magis,</quote> <trans><tr>the more ... the more</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:5:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 5, 1, 5</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">tam</hi> omitted: <cit><quote lang="la">quam magis exhausto spumaverit ubere mulctra, Laeta magis pressis manabunt flumina mammis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:309" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 309</bibl></cit>.— With the second <hi rend="ital">magis</hi> omitted: <cit><quote lang="la">quam magis te in altum capessis, tam aestus te in portum refert,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 1, 3, 6</bibl></cit>.— <cit><quote lang="la">In the reverse order: tam magis ... quam magis,</quote> <trans><tr>the more ... the more</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:787" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 787</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n39974.8" n="5" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">tanto</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam magis ... tanto magis,</quote> <trans><tr>the more ... the more</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:1:1:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 1, 1, 19</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:460" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 460</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n39974.9" n="6" level="3"> With a double <hi rend="ital">comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne libentius haec in illum evomere videar, quam verius,</quote> <trans><tr>with more freedom than truth</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:29:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 29, 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non acrior quam pertinacior impetus Romanorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">discrimen me occupavit, meliore hostium quam meo tempore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:7:9" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 7, 7, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39974.10" n="7" level="3"> Tam ... quam, with the <hi rend="ital">comp.</hi> for the <hi rend="ital">posit.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">so ... as</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">per dexteram te istam oro non tam in bellis et proeliis, quam in promissis et fide firmiorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,034:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Deiot. 3, 8</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n39974.11" n="8" level="3"> After comparatives or words of comparison, <hi rend="ital">than</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nobis nihil est tlmendum magis quam ille consul,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:9:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 7, 9, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">his igitur, quam physicis potius credendum existimas?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:16:37" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 16, 37</bibl></cit>; Cassius ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:15:19:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 15, 19, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:26:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 26, 62</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">majorem pecuniam praetori polliceri, quam quantam hic dedisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:29:section=70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 29, § 70</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:36:167" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 36, 167</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui plures milites eorum occidisset, quam quot superessent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 35, 12</bibl></cit>.—So after verbs which imply comparison, verbs of preference, excellence, etc.; after <hi rend="ital">praestat</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:17:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 17, 4</bibl>; after <hi rend="ital">malo</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">esse quam videri bonus malebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 54:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 54, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">an est quod ego malim quam?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:chapter=1" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Par. 1</bibl></cit>; after <hi rend="ital">statuo</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,014:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Dat. 8, 1</bibl>; after <hi rend="ital">probo</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 58</bibl>; after <hi rend="ital">volo</hi> ( = <foreign lang="greek">bou/lomai h)/</foreign>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:68:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 68, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:29:6" default="NO" valid="yes">25, 29, 6</bibl>.— Rarely <hi rend="ital">quantus</hi> is used to strengthen <hi rend="ital">quam</hi>, after <hi rend="ital">comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">de re majore quam quanta ea esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:23:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 23, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">implere homines certioris spei, quam quantam fides promissi humani subicere solet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:19:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 26, 19, 2</bibl></cit> Weissenb. ad loc.; <cit><quote lang="la">22, 2, 19.— But quam is often omitted after plus, minus, amplius, etc., without changing the case: minus duo milia hominum effugerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:16:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 16, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plus partem dimidiam hominum caesam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:40:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 36, 40, 5</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:25:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 29, 25, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum decem haud plus milibus militum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 1, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut hoc nostrum desiderium ne plus sit annuum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 5, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferre plus dimidiati mensis cibaria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:16:37" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 2, 16, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plus quingentos colaphos infregit mihi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:2:1:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 2, 1, 45</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:19:18" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 19, 18</bibl> (3, 17, 32); v. Zumpt, Gram. § 485.— </sense><sense id="n39974.12" n="9" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">sic</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">quam multā grandine nimbi Culminibus crepitant, sic densis ictibus heros pulsat, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:458" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 458</bibl></cit>.— With <hi rend="ital">sic</hi> omitted, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:309" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 309</bibl> sqq.— </sense><sense id="n39974.13" n="10" level="3"> After <hi rend="ital">aeque</hi>, <hi rend="ital">so much ... as</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil aeque eos terruit, quam robur ac color imperatoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 26</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n39974.14" n="11" level="3"> After <hi rend="ital">contra</hi>, <hi rend="ital">otherwise ... than</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not so ... as</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">contra faciunt, quam professi sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:5:11" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 5, 11</bibl></cit>.— So after <hi rend="ital">secus</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne me secus honore honestes quam ego te,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:1:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 2, 1, 50</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n39974.15" n="12" level="3"> After <hi rend="ital">alius</hi>, with a preceding negative, <hi rend="ital">not otherwise than</hi>, <hi rend="ital">no other than</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nil aliud agens quam ut, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>nothing else than</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:27:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 27, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque aliud totā urbe agi quam bellum apparari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:26:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 26, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Hann. 10:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Hann. 10, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ob nullam aliam causam, quam ne,</quote> <trans><tr>from no other cause than</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 25</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:2:12" default="NO" valid="yes">34, 2, 12</bibl>. — Rarely with <hi rend="ital">alius</hi> affirmatively (for ac): <cit><quote lang="la">ipse me paulum in aliā quam prius habuerim opinione nunc esse confiteor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:6:63" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 6, 63</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n39974.16" n="13" level="3"> After <hi rend="ital">aliter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">otherwise than</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne aliter, quam ego velim, meum laudet ingenium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:9:section=24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 9, § 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne aliter quam si, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:2:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 2, 2</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n39974.17" n="14" level="3"> After <hi rend="ital">supra</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">saepe supra feret, quam fieri possit,</quote> <trans><tr>more than</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:40:139" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 40, 139</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n39974.18" n="15" level="3"> After <hi rend="ital">ultra</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ultra, quam satis est, producitur,</quote> <trans><tr>farther than</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:18:26" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 18, 26</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n39974.19" n="16" level="3"> After <hi rend="ital">diversum</hi>, <hi rend="ital">otherwise than</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pransus quoque atque potus diversum valent quam indicant,</quote> <trans><tr>something altogether different from what</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:4:29" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 4, 29</bibl></cit>; cf., after advorsum, only <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:1:2:139" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 1, 2, 139</bibl> Brix ad loc.— </sense><sense id="n39974.20" n="17" level="3"> After words denoting number or quantity, which serve for comparison: dimidium tributi<cb n="QUAM" />  quam quod regibus ferre soliti erant, populo Romano pendere, <hi rend="ital">the half of what</hi>, <hi rend="ital">half as much as</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">multiplex, quam pro numero, damnum est,</quote> <trans><tr>too great for</tr>, <tr>greater than</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 7, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferramenta duplicia, quam numerus servorum exigit,</quote> <trans><tr>twice as many as</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:8:8" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 8, 8</bibl></cit>.—So, too, after designations of time: <cit><quote lang="la">die vigesimā, quam creatus erat, dictaturā se abdicavit,</quote> <trans><tr>on the twentieth day after</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 29</bibl></cit>: tabellarii venerunt post diem sextum, quam a vobis discesserant, Cic. Fil. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:16:21:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 16, 21, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">postridie venissemus, quam ... fuissemus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 3, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">postero die quam illa erant acta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:3:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 3, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saeculis multis ante ... inventa sunt, quam, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 5, 21</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n39974.21" n="18" level="3"> After the <hi rend="ital">sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum gerere cum tyranno, quam qui unquam, saevissimo et violentissimo in suos,</quote> <trans><tr>the most cruel that ever was</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 32</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n39974.22" n="19" level="3"> So with <hi rend="ital">rel.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">sup.</hi> after <hi rend="ital">tam</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tam gratum mihi id erit, quam quod gratissimum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 13, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tam sum amicus rei publicae quam qui maxime,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego sum tam mitis, quam qui lenissimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:31:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sull. 31, 87</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39974.23" n="20" level="3"> Sometimes with <hi rend="ital">magis</hi> or <hi rend="ital">potius</hi> to be supplied, <hi rend="ital">more ... than</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tacita mulier semper, quam loquens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:4:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 4, 4, 70</bibl></cit> dub.: <cit><quote lang="la">pacem quam bellum probabam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 58</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n39974.24" n="B" level="2"> In mere intensive expressions, <hi rend="ital">exceedingly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">very</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quite</hi>, <hi rend="ital">indeed</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">admodum quam saevos est,</quote> <trans><tr>very cruel indeed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:3:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 3, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nimis quam formido, ne, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:2:2:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 2, 2, 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nimis quam cupio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:1:2:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 1, 2, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam familiariter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:1:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 1, 109</bibl></cit>: nam suos valde quam paucos habet, <hi rend="ital">very few indeed</hi>, Brut. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:13:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 11, 13, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mire quam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:11:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 11, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sane quam refrixit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:6:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 6, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
quamde: <entryFree id="n39975" type="main" key="quamde^"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quamdĕ</orth>, v. quam <sense id="n39975.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
quamdiu: <entryFree id="n39976" type="main" key="quamdi^u"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quam-dĭu</orth>, less freq. <orth extent="full" lang="la">quandĭu</orth> (mostly as two words, sometimes separated: <sense id="n39976.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">quam voluit diu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 1, 7</bibl></cit>), <pos>adv.</pos> </sense><sense id="n39976.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Interrog.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">how long ago? how long?</hi> quamdiu id factum est? <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:5:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 5, 3, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quandiu apud vos ero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,002:9:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Marc. 9, 18</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39976.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Rel.</hi> </sense><sense id="n39976.3" n="1" level="3"> Of time, <hi rend="ital">as long as</hi>, <hi rend="ital">until</hi>, <hi rend="ital">during</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">quamdiu potuit, tacuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">disces, quamdiu voles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:1:2" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 1, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:52:13" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 52, 13</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n39976.4" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Until</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">jubebat, ut semper id comesset, quamdiu tamen melius invenisset,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Elag. 29, 7</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quamdiutius,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Not. Tir.</author> p. 35</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">‡ quamdiutissime,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Not. Tir.</author> p. 35</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39976.5" n="2" level="3"> Of inference, <hi rend="ital">inasmuch as</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in that</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">quandiu fecistis uni ex his fratribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:25:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Matt. 25, 40</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
quamdiutinus: <entryFree id="n39977" type="gloss" key="quamdi^u_ti^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quamdĭūtĭnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>quamdiu</etym>, <sense id="n39977.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">lasting how long</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of how long duration</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Not. Tir.</author> p. 35</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
