quamdudum: <entryFree id="n39978" type="main" key="quamdu_dum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quamdūdum</orth>, <itype>more correctly as two words</itype>, <orth extent="full" lang="la">quam dūdum</orth>.</entryFree>
quamlibet: <entryFree id="n39979" type="main" key="quamli^bet"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quam-lĭbet</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-lŭbet</orth>), <pos>adv.</pos> <sense id="n39979.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">As it pleases</hi>, <hi rend="ital">as you</hi> (<hi rend="ital">they</hi>, etc.) <hi rend="ital">will</hi>, <hi rend="ital">at pleasure</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quamlubet esto unica res,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:541" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 541</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lambe otio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:1:24:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 1, 24, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39979.1" n="II" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">how much soever</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ever so much</hi>, <hi rend="ital">howsoever</hi>: quodvis quamlibet tenue munusculum, Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:10:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 10, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">occupat egressas quamlibet ante rates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:10:5" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 1, 10, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">infirmae manus,</quote> <trans><tr>howsoever weak</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:7:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 1, 7, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quamlibet parum sit,</quote> <trans><tr>however inconsiderable it may be</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:1:18" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 1, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:12:5" default="NO">1, 12, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:13:56" default="NO">5, 13, 56</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">12, 1, 29: specularis lapis finditur in quamlibet tenues crustas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:160" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 22, 45, § 160</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:54" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 5, 9, § 54</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:13" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 4, 4, § 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc pretio quamlibet numerosa subsellia inplentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:14:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 14, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:96" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 96</bibl> (97), 2; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:61:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Pan. 61, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quamlibet pulchra elocutio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:4:32" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 4, 32</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:8:7" default="NO">12, 8, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:6:4" default="NO">8, 6, 4</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n39979.2" n="B" level="2"> For quamvis, <hi rend="ital">although</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
quamobrem: <entryFree id="n39980" type="main" key="qua^mobrem"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quămobrem</orth> (or <orth extent="full" lang="la">quăm ob rem</orth>), <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>quam-ob-rem</etym> (class.). <sense id="n39980.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Interrog.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">for what reason? on what account? wherefore? why? Am.</hi> Scelestissumum te arbitror. <hi rend="ital">So.</hi> Nam quamobrem? <hi rend="ital">Am.</hi> Quia, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 2, 1, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem ad finem? ... quamobrem? quam ob causam?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:29:section=75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 29, § 75</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:5:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 5, 15</bibl>.— In indirect questions: cum quaereret quam ob rem Ariovistus non decertaret. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 50</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n39980.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Rel.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">from which cause</hi> or <hi rend="ital">reason</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wherefore</hi>, <hi rend="ital">why</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc est homini, quamobrem vitam amet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:5:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 5, 1, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:2:1:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 2, 1, 66</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:4:10:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 4, 10, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">multae sunt causae, quamobrem cupio abducere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:1:2:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 1, 2, 65</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:10:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 3, 10, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">verum illud est, quamobrem haec commemorarim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:60:section=135" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 60, § 135</bibl></cit>: si res reperietur, quam <pb n="1505" /> <cb n="QUAM" /> obrem videantur, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 3, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:33:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 33, 96</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n39980.2" n="2" level="3"> At the beginning of a sentence, as a particle of transition, <hi rend="ital">on which account</hi>, <hi rend="ital">for which cause</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wherefore</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quamobrem quaeso a vobis, Asiatici testes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 27, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quamobrem quoniam, etc. ... utar eā clausulā, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 2, 4, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">10, 10, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
quamplures: <entryFree id="n39981" type="main" key="quamplu_res"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quamplūres</orth>, <itype>a</itype> (or <orth extent="full" lang="la">quam plūres</orth>), <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>quam-plus</etym>, <sense id="n39981.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very many</hi> (ante-class. and post-Aug. for complures): <cit><quote lang="la">curiosi sunt hic quamplures mali,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:1:3:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 1, 3, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">palaestritae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 21</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">quamplūrĭ-mus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">quam plūrĭmus</orth>), <itype>a</itype>, um; commonly in <number>plur.</number>, <hi rend="ital">very many</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">colles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 45</bibl></cit>: radices, Cato ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 18, 29, § 126</bibl>.—Hence, <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">quamplūrĭmum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">very much</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam plurimo vendere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:12:50" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 12, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam plurimum brassicae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 157, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
quampridem: <entryFree id="n39982" type="main" key="quampri_dem"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quamprīdem</orth>, v. pridem.</entryFree>
quamprimum: <entryFree id="n39983" type="main" key="quampri_mum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quam-prīmum</orth> (or <orth extent="full" lang="la">quam prī-mum</orth>), <sense id="n39983.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">forthwith</hi>, <hi rend="ital">as soon as possible</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">hominem istum quam primum absolvitote,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:2:4:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 2, 4, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">huic mandat, ut ad se quamprimum revertatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 21</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 2, 6, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">invisam quaerens quam primum abrumpere lucem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:631" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 631</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">posse</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut quamprimum possis, redeas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:3:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 2, 3, 88</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed recipe te, quam primum potes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:1:1:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 1, 1, 52</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
quamquam: <entryFree id="n39984" type="main" key="quamquam"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quam-quam</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">quan-</orth>), <sense id="n39984.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">conj.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">though</hi>, <hi rend="ital">although</hi>, <hi rend="ital">albeit;</hi> ante-class. always, and in class. prose regularly joined with <hi rend="ital">indic.;</hi> by Cic. rarely with the <hi rend="ital">subj.</hi>, and usu. when the general idea would demand the <hi rend="ital">subj.</hi> (as potential, conditional, consecutive, etc.; cf. Zumpt, Gram. § 574; Madv. § 361, A, 3; and v. esp. Fischer, Gram. 2, p. 696 sq.). </sense><sense id="n39984.1" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">indic.</hi>: quamquam blandā voce vocabam, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:20:41" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 20, 41</bibl> (Ann. v. 50 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">quamquam libenter escis alienis studes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:3:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 3, 1, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:8:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 4, 8, 44</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quamquam est scelestus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:2:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 2, 1, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quamquam id est minime probandum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:26:42" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 26, 42</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 4, 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 6, 16</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 9, 34</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quamquam non venit ad finem tam audax inceptum, tamen, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Romani, quamquam fessi erant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quamquam festinas, non est mora longa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:28:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 28, 35</bibl></cit> et saep.— </sense><sense id="n39984.2" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">subj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quamquam illa ipsa exclamatio Non potest melius sit velim crebra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:26:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 26, 101</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quamquam sint in quibusdam malis, tamen, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:30:85" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 30, 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quamquam ne id quidem suspicionem coitionis habuerit,</quote> <trans><tr>although even that gave rise to no suspicion</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:22:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 22, 53</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 1, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Romanis, quamquam procul a patriā pugnarent, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:29:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 29, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quamquam nonnullis leve visum iri putem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 13</bibl></cit>. 6: <cit><quote lang="la">quamquam moveretur his vocibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:34:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 36, 34, 6</bibl></cit> Weissenb. ad loc.; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:9:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 9, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:17:7" default="NO" valid="yes">45, 17, 7</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n39984.3" n="(g)" level="5"> Ellipt., with an <pos>adj.</pos> or <hi rend="ital">part.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum atque arma, quamquam vobis invisa, tamen quia Lepido placent, sumenda sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. Fragm. 1:48:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. Fragm. 1, 48, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">acri viro, et quamquam advorso populi partium, famá tamen aequabili,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 43:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> J. 43, 1</bibl></cit> Dietsch: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia illa, quamquam expetenda, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:23:68" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 23, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">curam adhibere, quamquam difficili in re,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 2, 7, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5, 3, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:53:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 53, 1</bibl> Weissenb. ad loc.—</sense><sense id="n39984.4" n="(d)" level="5"> With a <hi rend="ital">subj.-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quamquam ne impudicitiam quidem nunc abesse Pallante adultero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:65:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 65, 3</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n39984.5" n="II" level="1"> In partic., as a rhetor. particle of transition, inobjections made by the speaker himself, <hi rend="ital">although</hi>, <hi rend="ital">however</hi>, <hi rend="ital">yet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">nevertheless</hi>, <hi rend="ital">notwithstanding</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quamquam, quem potissimum Herculem colamus, scire sane velim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:16:42" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 16, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quamquam quid loquor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:9:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 1, 9, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quamquam te quidem quid hoc doceam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:47:197" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 47, 197</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:16:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 16, 42</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quamquam o! sed superent, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:195" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 195</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
quamvis: <entryFree id="n39985" type="main" key="quamvi_s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quam-vīs</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> and <sense id="n39985.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">conj.</hi> </sense><sense id="n39985.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">as you will</hi>, <hi rend="ital">as much as you will</hi> or <hi rend="ital">like</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ever so much</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ever so;</hi> hence, to designate a very high degree, <hi rend="ital">as much as possible</hi>, <hi rend="ital">very much</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exceedingly</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">quamvis multos nominatim proferre,</quote> <trans><tr>as many as you will</tr>, <tr>very many</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:16:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 16, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">esse quamvis facetum atque salsum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:56:228" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 56, 228</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quamvis callide, quamvis audacter, quamvis impudenter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:54:section=134" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 54, § 134</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quamvis subito,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:5:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 5, 17</bibl></cit>: et praeter eos quamvis enumeres multos licet, <hi rend="ital">ever so</hi> <cb n="QUAN" /> <hi rend="ital">many</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:10:24" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 3, 10, 24</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">per populum quamvis justum et moderatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:27:43" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 27, 43</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 30, 101</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quamvis pauci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quamvis pernix,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:7:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 4, 7, 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ridiculus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:2:2:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 2, 2, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">humanus et jocosus homo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:5" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 5</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quamvis vitiosissimus orator,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:26:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 26, 103</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:8:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 8, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:2:25" default="NO">2, 2, 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:24:19" default="NO">4, 24, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 30</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6</bibl>, prooem. 4; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:9:17:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 9, 17, 1</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n39985.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Conj.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">as much as ever you will</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">how much soever</hi>, <hi rend="ital">however much</hi>, <hi rend="ital">although</hi>, <hi rend="ital">albeit;</hi> regularly joined with <hi rend="ital">subj.</hi> (not so in Livy); only rarely, and mostly post-Aug., with <hi rend="ital">indic.</hi> (v. infra). </sense><sense id="n39985.3" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">subj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">homines, quamvis in turbidis rebus sint, tamen, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:16:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 16, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non igitur potestas est cum velis opitulandi rei publicae, quamvis ea prematur periculis, nisi, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:6:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 6, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quamvis sit magna (exspectatio), tamen eam vinces,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 23, 37</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quamvis prudens ad cogitandum sis sicut es, tamen nisi, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:37:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 12, 37, 2</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and with this cf.: huc accedit, quod quamvis ille felix sit sicut est, tamen, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:8:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 8, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipsas quamvis angusti terminus aevi Excipiat ... At genus immortale manet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:206" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 206</bibl></cit>.— <cit><quote lang="la">In a negative clause: senectus enim quamvis non sit gravis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:3:11" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 3, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">26, 97</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:2:23" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 2, 23</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quamvis non fueris suasor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 16, 7, 2</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n39985.4" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">indic.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">erat inter eos dignitate regiā, quamvis carebat nomine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Milt. 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quamvis infesto animo et minaci perveneras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:40:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 40, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:1 praef" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 1 praef.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quamvis est enim omnis hyperbole ultra finem, non tamen esse debet ultra modum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:6:73" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 6, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">carne tamen quamvis distat nil,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:2:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 2, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quamvis tacet Hermogenes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 3, 129</bibl></cit>; cf. Dillenb. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:28:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 28, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:542" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 542</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:782" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 782</bibl>. In Cic. only in joining to his discourse a Lucilian verse beginning with quamvis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:23:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 23, 86</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n39985.5" n="(g)" level="5"> Without a <hi rend="ital">verb</hi>, Carm. Marci ap. Fest. s. v. negumate, p. 165 Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">res bello gesserat, quamvis rei publicae calamitosas, attamen magnas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:45:116" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 45, 116</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quamvis iniqua passi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 7, 3, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:97:section=224" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 97, § 224</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:14:14" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 9, 14, 14</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
quanam: <entryFree id="n39986" type="main" key="qua_nam"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quā-nam</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <sense id="n39986.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Where indeed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">where</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">quanam in alium orbem transirent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 34</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39986.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">How then</hi>, <hi rend="ital">how</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">delphini quanam audiant, mirum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 50, § 137</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
quande: <entryFree id="n39987" type="main" key="quande"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quande</orth>, v. quam <sense id="n39987.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
quandiu: <entryFree id="n39988" type="main" key="quandi^u"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quandĭu</orth>, v. quamdiu.</entryFree>
quando: <entryFree id="n39989" type="main" key="quando"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quando</orth> (old form <orth extent="full" lang="la">quandod</orth>, acc. to <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=258" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 258</bibl> b Müll.), <pos>adv.</pos> and <sense id="n39989.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">conj.</hi> </sense><sense id="n39989.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi> </sense><sense id="n39989.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Interrog.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">at what time? when? Do.</hi> Venit Chaerea. <hi rend="ital">Ph.</hi> Quando? <hi rend="ital">Do.</hi> Hodie. <hi rend="ital">Ph.</hi> Quamdudum? <hi rend="ital">Do.</hi> Modo, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:4:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 4, 4, 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:2:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Heaut. 2, 2, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:22:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 22, 102</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:21:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 21, 49</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">o rus, quando ego te aspiciam? quandoque licebit? etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:6:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 6, 60</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:9:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Epod. 9, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:24:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 1, 24, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dic mihi cras istud, Postume, quando venit?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:5:58:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 5, 58, 2</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n39989.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Rel.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">at what time</hi>, <hi rend="ital">when</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non intellegitur, quando obrepat senectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:11:38" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 11, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaeres, quando iterum paveas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:7:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 7, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quando ipsos loqui, quando advocati voce uti deceat, quartus liber continet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:59" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 1, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">expectans quando incipiendum sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:159" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 3, 159</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n39989.4" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Indef.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">at what time soever</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">at any time</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ever</hi>, <hi rend="ital">some time</hi>, <hi rend="ital">some day</hi>, = aliquando, esp. after <hi rend="ital">num</hi>, <hi rend="ital">si</hi>, and <hi rend="ital">ne</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">exsistit hoc loco quaestio, num quando amici novi veteribus sint anteponendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:19:67" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 19, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut, si quando auditum sit, prodigii simile numeretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:13:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 13, 37</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:38:59" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 38, 59</bibl> Moser <hi rend="ital">N. cr.;</hi> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 2</bibl>. 15: <cit><quote lang="la">ne quando liberis proscriptorum bona patria reddantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:50:145" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 50, 145</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut ne quando amare inciperemus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:16:60" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 16, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fuisse autem illic pluviam, ne quando quidem auditum est,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sulp.</author> Sev. Dial. 1, 3, 4</bibl></cit>.— Strengthened by <hi rend="ital">umquam</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 14</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n39989.5" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Conj.</hi> </sense><sense id="n39989.6" n="A" level="2"> Temp., <hi rend="ital">when</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quando esurio, tum (intestina) crepant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:5:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 5, 5, 27</bibl></cit>; Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=258" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 258</bibl> Müll. (Ann. v. 416 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">tum, quando legatos Tyrum misimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:16:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 16, 41</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:21:75" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 21, 75</bibl> (al. si quando): quando dies adveniet, quem praefata Morta est, Liv. Andron. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:3:16:11" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 3, 16, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:2:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 2, 42</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:16:27" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Epod. 16, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 50</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n39989.7" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, causal, <hi rend="ital">since then</hi>, <hi rend="ital">because then</hi> (class.; v. Krebs, Antibarb. p. 971; Madv. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:8:21" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 8, 21</bibl>; in some passages, esp. of Cic., quando has been changed <cb n="QUAN" /> to quoniam by the editors; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">Reisig. Vorles. p. 465): quando igitur virtus est adfectio animi constans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:15:34" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 15, 34</bibl></cit> B. and K.: <cit><quote lang="la">quando igitur potest tibi Publius Geminus videri, quid habes, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 26, 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quando igitur inest in omni virtute cura quaedam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:23:67" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 23, 67</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n39989.8" n="2" level="3"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">since</hi>, <hi rend="ital">because</hi>, <hi rend="ital">seeing that</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inasmuch as</hi> (= quoniam, v. Drak. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:2:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 33, 2, 98</bibl>; freq. in Liv.; otherwise mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and post-Aug.); with <hi rend="ital">indic.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quando ita tibi lubet, vale atque salve,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:1:1:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 1, 1, 118</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quando habeo multos cognatos, quid opus sit mihi liberis?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 110</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quando hoc bene successit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:2:4:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 2, 4, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">duc me ad eam, quando huc veni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:4:5:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> And. 4, 5, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maneamus ergo in illā eādem sententiā, quando hoc miserius esse nihil potest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:13:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 13, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc, quando per illam licet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 102:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 102, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">volo ego illi beluae ostendere, quando adeo ferox praesultat hostium signis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:10:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 10, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 4, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quando injussu populi facta est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:8:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 8, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quando in apertum semel discrimen evasura esset res,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:14:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 10, 14, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quando id certum atque obstinatum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:15:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 15, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:7:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 7, 6</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:8:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 8, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:12:12" default="NO">2, 12, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cur non sit orator, quando, quod difficilius est, oratorem facit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:8:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 8, 5</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:6:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 6, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:10" default="NO">11, 1, 10</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">validiore apud eos Arminio, quando bellum suadebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 57</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 44</bibl>; 4, 6; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 1, 87</bibl> et saep.—With <hi rend="ital">subj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quando senescant sata quaedam aquā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 4, 3, § 28</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
quandocumque: <entryFree id="n39990" type="main" key="quando_cumque_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quandō-cumquē</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-cunquē</orth> (quandŏ - cumque, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1518,001:page=2404" default="NO"><author>Ter. Maur.</author> p. 2404</bibl> P.; <sense id="n39990.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">separated: quando consumet cumque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:9:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 9, 33</bibl></cit>), <pos>adv.</pos> </sense><sense id="n39990.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Rel.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">at what time soever</hi>, <hi rend="ital">at whatever time</hi>, <hi rend="ital">whenever</hi>, <hi rend="ital">as often as</hi>, <hi rend="ital">as soon as</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>). </sense><sense id="n39990.2" n="A" level="2"> With <hi rend="ital">indic.</hi>: quandocumque ista gens suas litteras dabit, Cato ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 1, 7, § 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quandocumque igitur vitam mea fata reposcant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:1:71" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 1, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quandocumque trahunt invisa negotia Romam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 14, 17</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 16, 58</bibl>: quandocunque fors obtulerat, Auct. B. Alex. 22.—</sense><sense id="n39990.3" n="B" level="2"> With <hi rend="ital">subj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si Olympias mater immortalitati consecretur, quandocumque excesserit vita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:6:26" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 9, 6, 26</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:10:8:10" default="NO">10, 8, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:1:71" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 1, 71</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n39990.4" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Indef.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">at some time or other</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in due time</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quandocumque mihi poenas dabis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:544" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 544</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:1:57" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 3, 1, 57</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:9:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 9, 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:4:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 4, 19</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
quandolibet: <entryFree id="n39991" type="main" key="quando_li^bet"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quandō-lĭbet</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <sense id="n39991.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">at some time or other</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in due time</hi> (eccl. Lat.): necesse est, ut mortem recipiat quandolibet, Lact. Opif. Dei, 4, 7.</sense></entryFree>
quandone: <entryFree id="n39992" type="gloss" key="quando_ne_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quandōnē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, for quandocumque, <sense id="n39992.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">as soon as</hi>, <hi rend="ital">when</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">QVANDONE EGO ESSE DESIERO,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 607, 1</bibl></cit> dub.</sense></entryFree>
quandoque: <entryFree id="n39993" type="main" key="quando_que_1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quandō-quē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <sense id="n39993.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Rel.</hi> </sense><sense id="n39993.1" n="A" level="2"> Temp., <hi rend="ital">at what time soever</hi>, <hi rend="ital">whenever</hi>, <hi rend="ital">whensoever</hi>, <hi rend="ital">as often as</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">QVANDOQVE SARPTA DONEC DEMPTA ERVNT, Lex XII. Tabularum: quandoque ab eādem parte sol eodemque tempore iterum defecerit, tum, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:22:24" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 6, 22, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut, quan doque idem prodigium nuntiaretur, feriae per novem dies agerentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:31:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 31, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">reddituros, quandoque recepisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:10:9" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 7, 10, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:10:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 10, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">indignor, quandoque bonus dormitat Homerus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:359" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 359</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quandoque trahet feroces Per sacrum clivum ... Sicambros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:2:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 4, 2, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quandoque ossa Capyis detecta essent, fore ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:81" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 81</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n39993.2" n="B" level="2"> Causal, <hi rend="ital">since</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inasmuch as</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quandoque tu extra ordinem pugnasti, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:7:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 7, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:10:9" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 10, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quandoque tu nullā umquam mihi in cupiditate defuisti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:80:section=187" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 80, § 187</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39993.3" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Indef.</hi> </sense><sense id="n39993.4" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">At some time</hi>, <hi rend="ital">at one time or other</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego me Asturae diutius arbitror commoraturum, quoad ille quandoque veniat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:19:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 6, 19, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne quandoque parvus hic ignis incendium ingens exsuscitet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et tu, Galba, quandoque degustabis imperium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">emptio non videtur et ideo quandoque lui potest,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Sent. 2, 13, 4</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n39993.5" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Now and then</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sometimes</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">nonnumquam per duos menses durat: quandoque brevius finitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:6:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 6, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quandoque fiunt trabes, quandoque clipei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 1:1:15" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 1, 1, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:3:13" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 3, 13</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
<entryFree id="n39994" type="main" key="quando_que2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quandōque</orth> = et quando, v. quando.</entryFree>
quandoquidem: <entryFree id="n39995" type="main" key="quando_qui^dem"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quandō-quĭdem</orth> (o scanned short, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:3:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 3, 55</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:980" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 980</bibl>), <pos>adv.</pos>, <sense id="n39995.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">since indeed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">since</hi>, <hi rend="ital">seeing that</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">quandoquidem tam iners, tam nulli consili sum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:3:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 3, 5, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 2, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:8:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ad. 5, 8, 33</bibl>; id. Eun. <pb n="1506" /> <cb n="QUAN" /> 2, 3, 82: <cit><quote lang="la">quandoquidem tu istos oratores tantopere laudas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:44:163" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 44, 163</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quandoquidem id tale esse debet, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:13:37" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 13, 37</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5, 23, 66</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 33</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec detur cura censoribus, quandoquidem eos in re publicā semper volumus esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:20:47" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 3, 20, 47</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:31:112" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 31, 112</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 3, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:14:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 14, 54</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicite, quandŏquidem in molli consedimus herbā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:3:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 3, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quandŏquidem totis mortalibus adsimulata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:980" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 980</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:1:111" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 1, 111</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:146" default="NO">10, 146</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:13:129" default="NO">13, 129</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
quanquam: <entryFree id="n39996" type="main" key="quanquam"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quanquam</orth>, v. quamquam.</entryFree>
quantillus: <entryFree id="n39997" type="main" key="quantillus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quantillus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n39997.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. dim.</hi> [quantulus], <hi rend="ital">how small a deal</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">how little</hi>, <hi rend="ital">how small</hi>, <hi rend="ital">how diminutive</hi> (Plautin.). </sense><sense id="n39997.1" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Interrog.</hi>: huic debet Philolaches paulum. <hi rend="ital">Then.</hi> Quantillum? <hi rend="ital">Tra.</hi> Quasi quadraginta minas, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:1:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 3, 1, 95</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:7:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 4, 7, 95</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:2:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 1, 2, 14</bibl>.— <cit><quote lang="la">In exclamations: haecine sunt meae filiae? Quantae e quantillis jam sunt factae!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:3:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 5, 3, 47</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:8:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 2, 8, 7</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n39997.2" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Rel.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">subducam ratiunculam, quantillum argenti mihi apud trapezitam siet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:1:2:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 1, 2, 90</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
quantisper: <entryFree id="n39998" type="main" key="quantisper"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quantisper</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> [quantum, how much), <sense id="n39998.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">how long</hi> (ante-class.). </sense><sense id="n39998.1" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Interrog.</hi>: velim paulisper opperiri te. Quantisper? Non plus triduum, Caecil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 511, 30</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n39998.2" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Rel.</hi>: possum exorare te, ut recedas a me paulisper modo? Quantisper sat habes, <hi rend="ital">as long as</hi>, Pompon. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 511, 33</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
quantitas: <entryFree id="n39999" type="main" key="quanti^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quantĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>quantus</etym>. <sense id="n39999.0" n="I" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">greatness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">extent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quantity</hi> (perh. only post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">quantitas est modulorum ex ipsius operis sumptione, singulisque membrorum partibus, universi operis conveniens effectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">umoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:219" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 24, 37, § 219</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">modi seu numeri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:4:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 4, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vocis,</quote> <trans><tr>strength</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 3, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quantitas et qualitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:2:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pretii,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 239, 11</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n39999.1" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n39999.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A sum</hi>, <hi rend="ital">amount</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">si non corpus sit legatum, sed quantitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:30:1:34:section=3" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 30, 1, 34, § 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:12:1:6" default="NO">12, 1, 6</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n39999.3" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A sum of money</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:16:2:11" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 16, 2, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:49:14:47" default="NO">49, 14, 47</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:45:1:65" default="NO">45, 1, 65</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n39999.4" n="B" level="2"> In logic: quantitas propositionis, <hi rend="ital">the quantity</hi> or <hi rend="ital">extent of a proposition</hi>, which is either universal or particular, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Dogm. Plat. 3, p. 29 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 4</bibl>, §§ 342, 371 sqq.</sense></entryFree>
quantitudo: <entryFree id="n40000" type="main" key="quanti^tu_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quantĭtūdo</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n40000.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">quantity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">degree</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Salat. Praec. 10" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Salat. Praec. 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
quanto: <entryFree id="n40001" type="main" key="quanto_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quantō</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. quantus <sense id="n40001.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> B.</sense></entryFree>
quantocius: <entryFree id="n40002" type="main" key="quanto_ci^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quant-ōcĭus</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>quanto-ocius</etym>, <sense id="n40002.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the sooner the better</hi>, <hi rend="ital">as quickly as possible</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">ut quantocius ad ea perveniat oratio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mamert.</author> Grat. Act. ad Julian. 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">discede quantocius, ne,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sulp.</author> Sev. Dial. 3, 4</bibl></cit>; Licin. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> Mort. Pers. 48, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:45:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 45, 19</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
quantopere: <entryFree id="n40003" type="main" key="quanto^pe^re_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quant-ŏpĕrē</orth> (contr. form, for which, in recent editions, the MS. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">quantō ŏpĕre</orth> is restored), <pos>adv.</pos>, <sense id="n40003.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">how greatly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">how much</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">dici non potest, quanto opere gaudeant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 14, 6, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:3:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 3, 3, 6</bibl>. —After <hi rend="ital">tanto opere</hi>, <hi rend="ital">as</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque enim tanto opere hanc a Crasso disputationem desiderabam, quanto opere, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:35:164" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 35, 164</bibl></cit>; v. quantus.</sense></entryFree>
quantulum: <entryFree id="n40004" type="main" key="quantu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quantŭlum</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. quantulus <sense id="n40004.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
quantulus: <entryFree id="n40005" type="main" key="quantu^lus1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quantŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n40005.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. dim.</hi> [quantus], <hi rend="ital">how little</hi>, <hi rend="ital">how small</hi>, <hi rend="ital">how trifling</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">nescio quantulum attulerit: verum haud permultum attulit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:2:3:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 2, 3, 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:378" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 378</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quantulum visum est,</quote> <trans><tr>as much as seems good to him</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:17:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Div. in Caecil. 17, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quantulus (sol) nobis videtur!</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 26, 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">id autem quantulum est?</quote> <trans><tr>how small?</tr></trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:19:47" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 2, 19, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quantula sint hominum corpuscula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:172" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 172</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 5, 4, § 12</bibl>: quantulum est mihi memoriae, <hi rend="ital">as much as I remember</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">as little as</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:10:9" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 10, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:124" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 124</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:8:4" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 8, 4</bibl>.—Quantulus quantulus, for quantuluscumque, <hi rend="ital">how little</hi>, <hi rend="ital">how small</hi>, <hi rend="ital">how trifling soever</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aderant tres illi fratres cladibus amici quantulumquantulum ferentes auxilii,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 9, p. 233, 35</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Neutr. adverb.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">quantŭlum</orth>, <hi rend="ital">how little</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quantulum judicare possemus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:1:section=3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 1, § 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n40007" type="main" key="quantu^lus2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quantŭlus-lĭbet</orth>, <itype>lălĭbet, lumlĭbet</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n40007.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">how little soever</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">febricula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:21:1:4" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 21, 1, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
quantuluscumque: <entryFree id="n40006" type="main" key="quantu^luscumque"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quantŭlus-cumque</orth> (or<orth extent="full" lang="la">-cunque</orth>), <itype>ăcumque, umcumque</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n40006.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">however small</hi>, <hi rend="ital">how little soever</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">de hac meā, quantulacumque est, facultate quaeritis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:30:135" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 30, 135</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adfectus quantulicumque sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 85:8" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 85, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">occasio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:13:183" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 13, 183</bibl></cit>: <cb n="QUAN" /> umor, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:11:7" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 11, 7</bibl>. — <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi> as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">quantŭlumcumque</orth>, <hi rend="ital">however small</hi>, <hi rend="ital">however insignificant a thing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quicumque eramus, et quantulumcumque dicebamus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:30:106" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 30, 106</bibl></cit>.— <cit><quote lang="la">Separated: quantulum id cumque est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:23:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 23, 97</bibl></cit>. — With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quantulumcunque aquae vel ciborum inest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:9" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 9</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">quantŭlumcun-quē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">in however small a degree</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">spem ejus, quae quantulumcunque restabat, comminuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:1:5:6" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 1, 5, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
quantulusquisque: <entryFree id="n40008" type="main" key="quantu^lusquisque"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quantŭlus-quisque</orth>, <itype>lăquaeque, lumquodque</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n40008.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">how small soever</hi> (post-class.), Gell. praef. § 24.</sense></entryFree>
quantum: <entryFree id="n40009" type="main" key="quantum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quantum</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. quantus <sense id="n40009.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
quantumcumque: <entryFree id="n40010" type="main" key="quantumcumque"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quantumcumque</orth>, v. quantuscumque.</entryFree>
quantumlibet: <entryFree id="n40011" type="main" key="quantumli^bet"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quantumlĭbet</orth>, v. quantuslibet.</entryFree>
quantumvis: <entryFree id="n40012" type="main" key="quantumvi_s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quantumvīs</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. quantusvis <sense id="n40012.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
quantus: <entryFree id="n40013" type="main" key="quantus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quantus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>quam</etym>, <sense id="n40013.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">how great.</hi> </sense><sense id="n40013.1" n="A" level="2"> Bellum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,014:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Dat. 5, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">calamitates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:35:86" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 35, 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo in dicendo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:12:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 12, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gravitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:129:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 129, 2</bibl></cit>.—Corresp. with <hi rend="ital">tantus</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">videre mihi videor tantam dimicationem, quanta numquam fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 7, 1, 2</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tanta est inter eos, quanta maxima esse potest, morum studiorumque distantia,</quote> <trans><tr>the greatest possible difference</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:20:74" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 20, 74</bibl></cit>.—Without <hi rend="ital">tantus</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quantus non unquam antea, exercitus venit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:37:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 37, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quanta maxime poterat vi perculit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:10:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 10, 10</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:9:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 7, 9, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:15:1" default="NO" valid="yes">42, 15, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:35:5" default="NO" valid="yes">24, 35, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:701" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 701</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 641</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quanta mea sapientia est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:1:2:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 1, 2, 62</bibl></cit>.—Quantus quantus, for quantuscumque, <hi rend="ital">how great</hi> or <hi rend="ital">much soever</hi> (ante-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">denegabit quantum quantum ad eum erit delatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:3:4:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 3, 4, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tu, quantus quantus, nihil nisi sapientia es,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:3:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 3, 3, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quanta quanta haec mea paupertas est, tamen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:7:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phorm. 5, 7, 10</bibl></cit>. — In quantum, <hi rend="ital">as far as</hi>, <hi rend="ital">according as</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in how far</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in so far as</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to whatever extent</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in quantum satis erat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">declamatio, in quantum maxime potest, imitetur eas actiones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:10:4" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 10, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 2:23:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 2, 23, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pedum digitos, in quantum quaeque secuta est, Traxit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in quantum potuerit,</quote> <trans><tr>as far as possible</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:10:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 10, 75</bibl></cit>. — With a preceding <hi rend="ital">in tantum</hi>, <hi rend="ital">as greatly ... as</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vir in tantum laudandus, in quantum intellegi virtus potest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:1:9" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 1, 9</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n40013.2" n="B" level="2"> Of number, value, etc., <hi rend="ital">how much</hi>, <hi rend="ital">how many</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quanta milia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:5:10" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 5, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:3:261" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 3, 261</bibl>. —And with or without <hi rend="ital">tantus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">as much as</hi>, <hi rend="ital">as many as</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 21</bibl>.— <cit><quote lang="la">As a designation of multitude, quantum = emphatic omnis: ut te quidem omnes di deaeque, quantum est, perduint,</quote> <trans><tr>as many as there are of them</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:4:6:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 4, 6, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quantum in terra degit, hominum perjurissime!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:3:117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 3, 117</bibl></cit>.— <orth extent="full" lang="la">quantum</orth>, <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>, with <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">as much</hi> of ... <hi rend="ital">as</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quantum est frumenti hornotini, exaraverunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:18:section=45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 18, § 45</bibl></cit>.— Quanti, as <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> pretii, <hi rend="ital">how high</hi>, <hi rend="ital">how dear</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">as dear as</hi>, <hi rend="ital">as high as</hi>: quanti emi potest minime, <hi rend="ital">how cheap? Ep.</hi> Ad quadraginta minas, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:2:2:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 110</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quanti emit?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 5, 6</bibl></cit>(5), 14: <cit><quote lang="la">quanti locaverint, tantam pecuniam redemptori solvendam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:9:7:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 9, 7, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vide, quanti apud me sis,</quote> <trans><tr>how highly I prize you</tr>, <tr>how dear you are to me</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 7, 19 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">noli spectare, quanti sit homo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(tu) qui scias quanti Tulliam faciam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:16:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 2, 16, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quanti est ista hominum gloria,</quote> <trans><tr>of how trifling worth</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:23:25" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 6, 23, 25</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:37:109" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 37, 109</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quanti est sapere!</quote> <trans><tr>what a fine thing it is!</tr></trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:7:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 4, 7, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quanti ejus intersit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:43:18:3" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 43, 18, 3</bibl></cit>.—Quanti quanti, <hi rend="ital">at whatever price</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed quanti quanti, bene emitur quod necesse est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:23:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 12, 23, 3</bibl></cit>.—Quanto opere, sometimes as one word, quantopere (q. v.), <hi rend="ital">with what care</hi>, <hi rend="ital">how greatly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">how much</hi> (answering to tanto opere or tantopere, <hi rend="ital">so greatly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">so much</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">quanto se opere custodiant bestiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:49:126" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 49, 126</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quantoque opere ejus municipii causā laborarem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 13, 7, 1</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n40013.3" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">quantum</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">as much as</hi>, <hi rend="ital">so much as</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">scribe, quantum potes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:7:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 7, 7</bibl></cit>.—Quantum possum or potest, <hi rend="ital">as soon as possible</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">domum me rursum, quantum potero, tantum recipiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:1:2:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 1, 2, 40</bibl></cit>: rescribas ad me, quantum <cb n="QUAN" /> potest, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:13:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 4, 13, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">erus, quantum audio, uxore excidit,</quote> <trans><tr>so far as I hear</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:2:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 2, 5, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quantum suspicor,</quote> <trans><tr>as far as I can conjecture</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:1:2:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eun. 1, 2, 62</bibl></cit>.—Quantum in or ad me, <hi rend="ital">so far as concerns me</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non igitur adhuc, quantum quidem in te est, intellego deos esse,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>for all you have shown to the contrary</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:7:15" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 7, 15</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 1, 2, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quantum ad Pirithoum, Phaedra pudica fuit,</quote> <trans><tr>as far as concerned</tr>, <tr>with respect to</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:744" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 744</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quantum ad jus attinet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 5:34:16" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 5, 34, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:3:16:1" default="NO">3, 16, 1</bibl>.—With <hi rend="ital">compp.</hi> for quanto, <hi rend="ital">the more</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the greater</hi>, etc. (cf. Zumpt, Gram. § 488, A, 2).—Followed by <hi rend="ital">eo</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quantum juniores patrum plebi se magis insinuabant, eo acrius contra tribuni tenebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:15:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 15, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:7:6" default="NO" valid="yes">44, 7, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:23" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 23 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl> —Followed by <hi rend="ital">tanto</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quantum augebatur militum numerus, tanto majore, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:10:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 10, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:38:5" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 38, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:47:11" default="NO" valid="yes">27, 47, 11</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 32, 5, 1</bibl>. — Also without a <hi rend="ital">correl.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quantum ... et minus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:36:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 36, 5</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n40013.4" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">quantō</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">by how much</hi>, <hi rend="ital">by as much as</hi>, <hi rend="ital">according as</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quanto diutius Abest, magis cupio tanto,</quote> <trans><tr>the longer he is away</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:3:1:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 3, 1, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quanto gravior oppugnatio, tanto crebriores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quanto magis philosophi delectabunt, si, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>how greatly</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 1, 3, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quanto praeclarior vita, tanto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 85:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 85, 22</bibl></cit> Kritz. — With <hi rend="ital">verbs</hi> which contain the idea of comparison: <cit><quote lang="la">Hannibalem tanto praestitisse ceteros imperatores prudentiā, quanto populus Romanus antecedebat fortitudine cunctas nationes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Hann. 1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Hann. 1, 1</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">posit.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tanto acceptius in vulgum, quanto modicus privatis aedificationibus,</quote> <trans><tr>inasmuch as</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quanto frequenter impellitur, tanto firmiter roboratur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 5, 7, 9</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">ante</hi>, <hi rend="ital">secus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">aliud</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo minus exponam, quam multa ad me detulerit, quanto ante providerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 3, 8</bibl></cit>: videtote, quanto secus ego fecerim, <hi rend="ital">how differently</hi>, Cato ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 192</bibl> P.: <cit><quote lang="la">ut manifesto appareat, quanto sit aliud proximum esse, aliud secundum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:53" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 53</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
quantuscumque: <entryFree id="n40014" type="main" key="quantuscumque"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quantus-cumque</orth>, <itype>tăcumque, tumcumque</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n40014.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">how great soever</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of whatever size</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">quantuscumque sum ad judicandum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:28:122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 28, 122</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bona, quantacumque erant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:5:8:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 5, 8, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adfectus, quantuscumque est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 85:8" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 85, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quantaecumquae de Romanis tamen, victoriae fama,</quote> <trans><tr>however small</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:31:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 31, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">unum quantumcunque ex insperato gaudium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:10:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 30, 10, 20</bibl></cit> Weissenb. ad loc.: <cit><quote lang="la">quanticumque,</quote> <trans><tr>at whatsoever price</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 80:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 80, 4</bibl></cit>.—To denote indefiniteness in number, <hi rend="ital">how many soever</hi>: naves eorum, quantaecumque fuerint, Cod. Th. 13, 5, 5.— <hi rend="ital">Neutr. adverb.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">quantum-cumque</orth>, <hi rend="ital">as much soever</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quantumcumque possum,</quote> <trans><tr>as much as ever I can</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:4:10" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 4, 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
quantuslibet: <entryFree id="n40015" type="main" key="quantusli^bet"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quantus-lĭbet</orth>, <itype>tălibet, tumlĭbet</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n40015.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">as great as you please</hi>, <hi rend="ital">how great soever</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ever so great</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post - Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">quantolibet ordine dignus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:669" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 669</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saevitia hiemis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:17:11" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 17, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facilitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quantālibet lassitudine recreari defessos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:127" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 12, 104, § 127</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Neutr. adverb.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">quantum-lĭbet</orth>, <hi rend="ital">how much soever</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ever so much</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quantumlibet intersit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:37:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 37, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:6:4" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 6, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">te quantumlibet oderint hostes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Eum.</author> Pan. Const. 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
quantusquantus: <entryFree id="n40016" type="main" key="quantusquantus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quantus-quantus</orth>, v. quantus.</entryFree>
quantusvis: <entryFree id="n40017" type="main" key="quantusvi_s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quantus-vīs</orth>, <itype>tăvis, tumvis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n40017.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">as much as you will</hi>, <hi rend="ital">as great as you please</hi>, <hi rend="ital">however great</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ever so great</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">et manus una regit quantovis impete euntem (navem),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:903" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 903</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1171" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 1171</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quantasvis magnas copias sustineri posse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">portum satis amplum quantaevis classi,</quote> <trans><tr>for any fleet</tr>, <tr>be it ever so large</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum faciem videas, videtur esse quantivis pretii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:5:2:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 5, 2, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingenium hominis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:4:1:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 4, 1, 2</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Neutr. subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">quantum-vīs</orth>, <hi rend="ital">however great an amount</hi>, <hi rend="ital">as much as you will</hi>, <hi rend="ital">how much soever</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ever so much</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">meretrici des quantumvis, nusquam apparet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:7:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 7, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quantumvis tolle,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 7, 16</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quantumvis fiduciae et spiritūs capias,</quote> <trans><tr>how much soever</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Nazar.</author> Pan.
