Const. 19</bibl></cit>. — Adverb., <hi rend="ital">very</hi>, <hi rend="ital">very indeed</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quantumvis facundus et promptus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:53" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 53</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n40017.1" n="2" level="3"> For quamvis, <hi rend="ital">although</hi>, <hi rend="ital">albeit</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ille catus, quantumvis rusticus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 39</bibl></cit> (ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:20:73" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 20, 73</bibl>, and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 85:12" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 85, 12</bibl>, the true read. is quamvis). <pb n="1507" /> <cb n="QUAR" /></sense></entryFree>
quapropter: <entryFree id="n40018" type="main" key="qua^propter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quă-propter</orth> (in tmesi: <sense id="n40018.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">qua me propter adduxi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:3:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 3, 3, 4</bibl></cit>), <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>qui-propter</etym>, <hi rend="ital">for what</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wherefore</hi>, <hi rend="ital">why.</hi> </sense><sense id="n40018.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Interrog.</hi> (ante- and post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">quapropter id vos factum suspicamini?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:2:2:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 2, 2, 52</bibl></cit>: <hi rend="ital">Tra.</hi> Quāpropter? <hi rend="ital">Theo.</hi> Quia, etc., <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 2, 140</bibl>: parumper opperire me hic: <hi rend="ital">My.</hi> Quapropter? <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:4:2:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 4, 2, 31</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n40018.2" n="B" level="2"> Indirect: <cit><quote lang="la">sed quid est quapropter nobis vos malum minitamini?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:5:4:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 5, 4, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">credo te non nihil mirari, Quid sit, quapropter te huc foras puerum evocare jussi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:5:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 5, 1, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">interrogatus quapropter vellet, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:8:13" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 8, 13</bibl></cit>, ext. 2. — </sense><sense id="n40018.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in passing to a new thought, <hi rend="ital">wherefore</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on which account</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">quapropter hoc dicam, numquam, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:27:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 27, 78</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:2:3:116" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 2, 3, 116</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:2:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ad. 3, 2, 44</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:6:4:4 al" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 6, 4, 4 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
quaqua: <entryFree id="n40019" type="main" key="qua_qua_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quāquā</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>prop. <case>abl.</case> of quisquis</etym>, <sense id="n40019.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">wheresoever</hi>, <hi rend="ital">whithersoever</hi> (ante- and postclass.): <cit><quote lang="la">quaqua incedit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:1:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 1, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tangit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:5:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 5, 2, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 2, p. 116, 2</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11</bibl>, p. 258, 30: <cit><quote lang="la">quaqua versus,</quote> <trans><tr>to all sides</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4</bibl></cit>, p. 145, 6.</sense></entryFree>
quaquam: <entryFree id="n40020" type="spur" key="qua_quam"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quāquam</orth>, a false read. for quoquam, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:428" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 428</bibl>.</entryFree>
quaque: <entryFree id="n40021" type="main" key="qua_que_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quāquē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>prop. <case>abl.</case> of quisque</etym>, <sense id="n40021.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">wheresoever</hi>, <hi rend="ital">whithersoever</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">quaque iverit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Manil.</author> 5, 313</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
quare: <entryFree id="n40022" type="main" key="qua_re_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quā-rē</orth> (or separately, <orth extent="full" lang="la">quā rē</orth>), <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>quae-res</etym>. <sense id="n40022.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Interrog.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">by what means? how?</hi> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:3:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 3, 78</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n40022.1" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Rel.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">by which means</hi>, <hi rend="ital">whereby</hi> (rare but class.): <cit><quote lang="la">multas res novas in edictum addidit, quare luxuria reprimeretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Cat. 2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Cat. 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">permulta sunt, quae dici possunt, quare intellegatur, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:33:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 33, 94</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n40022.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">From what cause</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on what account</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wherefore</hi>, <hi rend="ital">why.</hi> </sense><sense id="n40022.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Interrog.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quare ausus?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 5, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quare negasti illud te fuisse laturum?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:16:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 16, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quā re enim primum ille adesse noluit?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:18:section=44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 18, § 44</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 3, 30, § 71</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:11:15:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 11, 15, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:16:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 16, 71</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:2:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 2, 103</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 18, 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:1:36" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 7, 1, 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:16" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 1:1:10" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 1, 1, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 3:19:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ben. 3, 19, 1</bibl> et saep.— </sense><sense id="n40022.4" n="2" level="3"> Indirect: <cit><quote lang="la">quaeramus, quae tanta vitia fuerint in unico filio, quare is patri displiceret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:14:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 14, 41</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n40022.5" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, for joining on a consecutive clause, <hi rend="ital">for which reason</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wherefore</hi>, <hi rend="ital">therefore</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quare sic tibi eum commendo, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 13, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quare pro certo habetote,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 52:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 52, 17</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
quarta: <entryFree id="n40023" type="main" key="quarta^"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quartă-dĕcŭmāni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>quartus-decumanus</etym>, <sense id="n40023.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the fourteenth legion; subst.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the soldiers of the fourteenth legion</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
quartanarius: <entryFree id="n40024" type="main" key="quarta_na_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quartānārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>quartus</etym>. <sense id="n40024.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Amounting to</hi> or <hi rend="ital">containing a fourth</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">tabula,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 2, 11</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n40024.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">That has a quartan ague</hi>, Schol. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:9:16" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 9, 16</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
quartanus: <entryFree id="n40025" type="main" key="quarta_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quartānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n40025.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the fourth;</hi> esp., </sense><sense id="n40025.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">occurring on the fourth day</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quartan</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">febris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:10:24" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 10, 24</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:166" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 50, 51, § 166</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:77:3" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 77, 3</bibl>.— Hence, as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">quar-tāna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (sc. febris), <hi rend="ital">an ague occurring every fourth day</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a quartan ague</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">in quartanam conversa vis est morbi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:16:11:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 16, 11, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:1:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 1, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:150" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 25, 72, § 150</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">frigida,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:290" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 290</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n40025.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the fourth legion; plur.</hi> as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">quartāni</orth>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the soldiers of the fourth legion</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 37</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3118</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
quartarius: <entryFree id="n40026" type="main" key="quarta_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quartārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n40026.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A fourth part</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quarter</hi> of any measure, esp. of a sextarius, <hi rend="ital">a quartern</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gill</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sumito bituminis tertiarium, et sulphuris quartarium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 95, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mellis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:5:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 5, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">farris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 3, 3, § 9</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n40026.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A mule-driver</hi>, <hi rend="ital">muleteer</hi>, who received a fourth part of the profits, Lucil. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=258" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 258</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
quartato: <entryFree id="n40027" type="hapax" key="quarta_to_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quartātō</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n40027.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">for the fourth time</hi>: tertiato et quartato dicere, Cato ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 3, 314</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
quarte: <entryFree id="n40028" type="main" key="quarte"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quarte</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">quarti</orth>, v. quartus.</entryFree>
quarticeps: <entryFree id="n40029" type="gloss" key="quarti^ceps"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quartĭceps</orth>, <itype>cĭpĭtis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>,<sense id="n40029.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">four-peaked</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">collis, an old formula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=52" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 52</bibl></cit> Müll.; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:ib. 5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5</bibl>, § 50 and 47.</sense></entryFree>
quarto: <entryFree id="n40030" type="main" key="quarto_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quartō</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v quartus <sense id="n40030.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
quartocerius: <entryFree id="n40031" type="hapax" key="quarto_ce_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quartōcērĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>quartus-cera</etym>, <sense id="n40031.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that is of the fourth rank</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 12, 24, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
quartum: <entryFree id="n40032" type="main" key="quartum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quartum</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. quartus, A. <sense id="n40032.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> <cb n="QUAS" /></sense></entryFree>
quartus: <entryFree id="n40033" type="main" key="quartus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quartus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>num. adj.</pos> <etym>for quatertus from quattuor, kindr. with Gr. <foreign lang="greek">te/tvartos</foreign> and Sanscr. caturtha, the fourth</etym>, <sense id="n40033.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the fourth</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">perfidia, et peculatus ex urbe et avaritiā si exsulant, quarta invidia, quinta ambitio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:4:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 4, 4, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pars copiarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quartus ab Arcesilā,</quote> <trans><tr>the fourth from Arcesilas</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pater, i. e. abavus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:619" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 619</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quartus decimus,</quote> <trans><tr>the fourteenth</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 15</bibl></cit>: die quarto, <hi rend="ital">on the fourth day</hi>, <hi rend="ital">four days ago</hi>: nuper die quarto, ut recordor, Cn. Matius ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:24:10" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 24, 10</bibl>.—In the future, <hi rend="ital">four days hence</hi>, in the ante-class. form, die quarte (al. quarti): die quarte moriar fame, Pompon. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:24:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 24, 5</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n40033.1" n="B" level="2"> <pos>Subst.</pos> </sense><sense id="n40033.2" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">quarta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (sc. pars), <hi rend="ital">a fourth part</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a quarter</hi>, esp. of an estate, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:5:19" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 5, 19</bibl>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:5:2:8" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 5, 2, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:5:4:3" default="NO">5, 4, 3</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n40033.3" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">quartum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, in econom. lang., <hi rend="ital">the fourth grain</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nam frumenta majore parte Italiae quando cum quarto responderint vix meminisse possumus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>yielded a harvest of four for one</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:3:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 3, 4</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n40033.4" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Advv.</hi> </sense><sense id="n40033.5" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">quartum</orth>, <hi rend="ital">for the fourth time</hi> (class.): Quintus pater quartum fit consul, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:1:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 1, 6</bibl> (Ann. v. 293 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">eo quartum consule,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:4:10" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 4, 10</bibl></cit>; <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">infra</ref></xr>: <cit><quote lang="la">T. Quinctio quartum consule,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 67</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n40033.6" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">quartō</orth>, <hi rend="ital">for the fourth time</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the fourth time</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ter conata loqui, ter destitit, ausaque quarto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:823" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 823</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quarto Excudit amplexus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 9, 51</bibl></cit>: Caesar dictator tertio, designatus quarto, Auct. B. Hisp. 2 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi>; cf.: quarto vel quinto, <hi rend="ital">four</hi> or <hi rend="ital">five times</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Eutr.</author> 7, 18</bibl>: aliud est quarto praetorem fieri, et quartum, quod quarto locum assignificat ac tres ante factos, quartum tempus assignificat et ter ante factum. Igitur Ennius recte, qui scripsit: Quintus pater quartum fit consul, Varr. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:1:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 1, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
quartusdecimus: <entryFree id="n40034" type="main" key="quartusde^ci^mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quartus-dĕcĭmus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>num. adj.</pos>, <sense id="n40034.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the fourteenth</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pars,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 4, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 70</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">13, 15</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
quasi: <entryFree id="n40035" type="main" key="qua^si^"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quăsĭ</orth> (old form QVĂSEI, Tab. Bantin. lin. 10; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2488</bibl>), <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>quamsi</etym>. <sense id="n40035.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">as if</hi>, <hi rend="ital">just as</hi>, <hi rend="ital">as it were</hi> (cf.: veluti, sicuti, tamquam): modo introii. <hi rend="ital">Si.</hi> Quasi ego, quam dudum, rogem, <hi rend="ital">as if I asked</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:5:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 5, 2, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quasi vero venire debuerint,</quote> <trans><tr>just as though they ought to have come</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 3, 7, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quasi vero ille factum id esse defendat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:9:39" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 9, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">philosophia laudatarum artium omnium quasi parens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 3, 9</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quasi decursus temporis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 3, 2, 2</bibl></cit>.— After the comparative particles, <hi rend="ital">sic</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ita</hi>, <hi rend="ital">perinde</hi>, <hi rend="ital">proinde</hi>, <hi rend="ital">item</hi>, <hi rend="ital">itidem</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prorsus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quippe</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">Graecas litteras sic avide arripui, quasi diuturnam sitim explere cupiens,</quote> <trans><tr>as if</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:8:26" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 8, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui, quasi sua res aut honos agatur, ita diligenter, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 2, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">atque haec perinde loquor, quasi debueris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 26, 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proinde quasi nostram ipsam mentem videre et sentire possimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:31:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 31, 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">item quasi salsa muriatica esse autumantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:2:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 1, 2, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">itidem quasi occisam suem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:2:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 3, 2, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prorsus quasi silentium damnum pulchritudinis esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:7:16" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 1, 7, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quippe quasi minus perjurii contra haberent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:3:7:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 7, 15</bibl></cit>.— <cit><quote lang="la">For sic ... quasi, in late Lat., aeque ... quasi occurs,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:49:1:3:section=1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 49, 1, 3, § 1</bibl></cit>.—After assimulare, <hi rend="ital">to make</hi> or <hi rend="ital">act as if</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">assimulabo, quasi nunc exeam,</quote> <trans><tr>will pretend to be just going out</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 3, 2, 8</bibl></cit>.— Sometimes pleon. quasi si: QVASEI SEI, Tab. Bantin. lin. 10; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2488</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quasi si esset ex se nata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:prol. 45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. prol. 45</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n40035.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n40035.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">About</hi>, <hi rend="ital">nearly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">almost</hi> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">circiter, fere): quasi una aetas erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:prol. 20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. prol. 20</bibl></cit> Brix ad loc.: <cit><quote lang="la">quasi talenta ad quindecim Coëgi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:1:1:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 1, 1, 93</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quasi in extremā paginā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:13:41" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 13, 41</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:8:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 1, 8, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:58" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 58</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 50:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 50, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:48:3" default="NO" valid="yes">48, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. 3:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 3, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:4:41" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 41</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n40035.3" n="B" level="2"> Quasi ... quasi, <hi rend="ital">partly ... partly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui cum diceret quasi joco, quasi serio, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Spart.</author> Get. 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
quasillaria: <entryFree id="n40036" type="main" key="qua^silla_ri^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quăsillārĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>quasilla</etym>, <sense id="n40036.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a basketwench</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spinning-girl</hi> (post-Aug.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 132</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 648, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
quasillum: <entryFree id="n40037" type="main" key="qua^sillum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quăsillum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">quăsillus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>qualum</etym>, <sense id="n40037.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small basket</hi> for various purposes; esp., <hi rend="ital">a wool-basket</hi> (class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 133</bibl>.—Of <hi rend="ital">wool-baskets</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter quasilla pendebatur aurum,</quote> <trans><tr>in the spinning-room</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:3:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 3, 4, 10</bibl></cit>: pressumque quasillo Scortum, <hi rend="ital">who must spin</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">low</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mean</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:4:10:3" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 4, 10, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl> (5), 7, 37. <cb n="QUAT" /></sense></entryFree>
quassabilis: <entryFree id="n40038" type="main" key="quassa_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quassābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>quasso</etym>, <sense id="n40038.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that may be shaken</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">munimen quassabile ferro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:6:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 6, 22</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
quassabundus: <entryFree id="n40039" type="main" key="quassa_bundus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quassābundus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n40039.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">tottering</hi>, of a drunkard, <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 5, 21</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
quassatio: <entryFree id="n40040" type="main" key="quassa_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quassātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n40040.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a shaking</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">capitum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:17:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 17, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cymbalorum,</quote> <trans><tr>a striking together</tr>, <tr>beating</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 7, 237</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quassationes,</quote> <trans><tr>shakings of the body</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 7, 15, 9</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n40040.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A disturbance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">affliction</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cessavit quassatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:105:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Psa. 105, 30</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
quassati: <entryFree id="n40041" type="hapax" key="quassa_ti^"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quassātĭ-pennae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>quatio-penna</etym>, <sense id="n40041.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">feather-shaking</hi>, an epithet of geese: anates, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 460, 8</bibl> dub.</sense></entryFree>
quassatura: <entryFree id="n40042" type="main" key="quassa_tu_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quassātūra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>quasso</etym>, <sense id="n40042.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a shaking;</hi> hence, transf., </sense><sense id="n40042.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An injury occasioned by shaking</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quassaturas fovere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Plin. Val.</author> 4, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n40042.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A part injured by shaking</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Vet. 1, 28, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
quasso: <entryFree id="n40043" type="main" key="quasso"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quasso</orth> (old form <orth extent="full" lang="la">casso</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:2:3:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 2, 3, 71</bibl> Ritschl), <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. freq. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen> <etym>quatio</etym>. <sense id="n40043.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to shake</hi> or <hi rend="ital">toss violently</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n40043.1" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: ecus saepe jubam quassat, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 6, 3</bibl> (Ann. v. 506 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">caput,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:3:4:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 3, 4, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:292" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 292</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:526" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 526</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Etruscam pinum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:521" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 521</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hastam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 94</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:696" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 696</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">monumenta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:8:17:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 8, 17, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lampade, of the Furies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:2:611" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 2, 611</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">lampada,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:587" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 587</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>, in mid. force, <hi rend="ital">tremble</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quassantur membra metu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Phoen. 530" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Phoen. 530</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n40043.2" n="2" level="3"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n40043.3" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To shatter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shiver</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to break</hi> or <hi rend="ital">dash to pieces</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to batter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">make leaky</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quassatis vasis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:434" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 434</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quassata ventis classis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:551" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 551</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quassata domus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:2:83" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 2, 83</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">hordeum sub molā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. p. 194, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">harundinem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0972,001:134" default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> S. 134</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n40043.4" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To strike</hi> or <hi rend="ital">shake</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ramum Lethaeo rore madentem super utraque quassat Tempora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:854" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 854</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n40043.5" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to shake</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shatter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">impair</hi>, <hi rend="ital">weaken</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quassatā re publicā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:34:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 34, 73</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Marc. 8, 24</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quassatum corpus,</quote> <trans><tr>shattered</tr>, <tr>enfeebled</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:31" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingenia vitia quassant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:11:428" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 11, 428</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempora quassatus, of a drunkard,</quote> <trans><tr>fuddled</tr>, <tr>beclouded</tr>, <tr>disordered</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:7:202" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 202</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quassus, B. s. v. quatio: IVVENTAM FLETV,</quote> <trans><tr>to disfigure</tr>, <tr>impair</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 607, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">harundo quassata,</quote> <trans><tr>a bruised reed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:12:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Matt. 12, 20</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n40043.6" n="C" level="2"> Esp., of countries, communities, etc., <hi rend="ital">to disturb</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unsettle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">throw into confusion</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quassata Placentia bello,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:593" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 8, 593</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellis urbs,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:7:252" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 252</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n40043.7" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to shake itself</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to shake</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">cassanti capite incedit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:3:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 2, 3, 23</bibl></cit> (Ussing, quassanti): <cit><quote lang="la">quassanti capite,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 4, p. 156, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3</bibl>, p. 140, 28: <cit><quote lang="la">siliquā quassante,</quote> <trans><tr>rattling</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 74</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">capitibus quassantibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:2:3:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 2, 3, 71</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
quassus: <entryFree id="n40044" type="main" key="quassus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quassus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from quatio.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n40045" type="hapax" key="quassus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quassus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>quatio</etym>, <sense id="n40045.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a shaking</hi>, Pac. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:21:50" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 21, 50</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
quatefacio: <entryFree id="n40046" type="hapax" key="qua^te^fa^ci^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quătĕ-făcĭo</orth>, <itype>fēci, factum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>quatio-facio</etym>, <sense id="n40046.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to shake;</hi> trop., <hi rend="ital">to cause to waver</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to weaken</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quatefeci Antonium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ep. ad Brut. 1, 10, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
quatenus: <entryFree id="n40047" type="main" key="qua_te^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quā-tĕnus</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">quātĭnus</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">quātĕnos</orth>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=258" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 258 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl> Müll.), <pos>adv.</pos> <sense id="n40047.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (only in indirect questions; cf. quī), <hi rend="ital">until where</hi>, <hi rend="ital">how far</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in omnibus rebus videndum est, quatenus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:22:73" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 22, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quatenus progredi debeat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:11:36" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 11, 36</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n40047.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n40047.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">How far</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to what extent</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quatenus sint ridicula tractanda oratori, perquam diligenter videndum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:58:237" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 58, 237</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quatenus quaque fini dari venia amicitiae debeat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:3:16" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 3, 16</bibl></cit>.—Ellipt.: <cit><quote lang="la">nulla cognitio finium, ut ullā in re statuere possimus, quatenus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 29, 92</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:12:72" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 12, 72</bibl>: est enim quatenus amicitiae dari venia possit. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:17:61" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 17, 61</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n40047.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Where</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">petentibus Saguntinis, ut quatenus tuto possent, Italiam spectatum irent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quatenus videtur inhabitari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:8:11" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 9, 8, 11</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n40047.4" n="C" level="2"> Of time, <hi rend="ital">how long</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quibus auspiciis istos fasces acciperem? quatenus haberem? cui traderem?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:14:5:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 14, 5, 14</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n40047.5" n="D" level="2"> Causal, <hi rend="ital">seeing that</hi>, <hi rend="ital">since</hi>, <hi rend="ital">as</hi> (cf.: quoniam, quando): clarus postgenitis; <cit><quote lang="la">quatenus, heu nefas! Virtutem incolumem odimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:24:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 24, 30</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:5:21" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 5, 5, 21</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nobis denegatur diu vivere, relinquamus aliquid, quo nos vixisse testemur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:7:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 7, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quatenus innocentiae meae nusquam locus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 16</bibl></cit> Nipperd. ad loc. — </sense><sense id="n40047.6" n="E" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">How</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 4, 27 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 30, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n40047.7" n="F" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">So</hi> <pb n="1508" /> <cb n="QUAT" /> <hi rend="ital">that</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in order that</hi>, <hi rend="ital">that</hi> (post-class.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:4:2:14" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 4, 2, 14</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> H. Tr. 5, 17</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
quater: <entryFree id="n40048" type="main" key="qua^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quăter</orth>, <pos>adv. num.</pos> <etym>quattuor</etym>, <sense id="n40048.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">four times</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quater in anno pariunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:10" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:242" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 242</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 1</bibl>.—With other numerals: <cit><quote lang="la">quater quinis minis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:3:111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 3, 111</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quater deni,</quote> <trans><tr>forty</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:293" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 293</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quater decies,</quote> <trans><tr>fourteen times</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:39:section=100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 39, § 100</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quater centies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 14</bibl></cit>. —Freq. in phrase: ter et quater, ter aut quater, or terque quaterque, <hi rend="ital">three and</hi> (<hi rend="ital">or</hi>) <hi rend="ital">four times</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">over and over again</hi>, <hi rend="ital">often</hi>, <hi rend="ital">extremely</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ter et quater Anno revisens aequor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:31:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 31, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corvi presso ter gutture voces Aut quater ingeminant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:410" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 410</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terque quaterque solum scindendum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 399</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terque quaterque beati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 1, 94</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">o mihi felicem terque quaterque diem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:3:3:26" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 3, 3, 26</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
quaternarius: <entryFree id="n40049" type="main" key="qua^terna_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quăternārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>quaterni</etym>, <sense id="n40049.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">consisting of four each</hi>, <hi rend="ital">containing four</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quaternary</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">scrobes quaternarii, hoc est quoquoversus pedum quattuor,</quote> <trans><tr>four feet square</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:28" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 2, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">numerus,</quote> <trans><tr>the number four</tr>, <tr>the quaternary</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 6, 17, § 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">formae, of coins,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Alex. Sev. 38</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
quaterni: <entryFree id="n40050" type="main" key="qua^terni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quăterni</orth>, <itype>ae, a</itype> (<sense id="n40050.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen. plur.</hi> quaternūm, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:22:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 22, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:5:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 5, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 3, 2, § 4</bibl>), <hi rend="ital">adj. plur.</hi> [quattuor]. </sense><sense id="n40050.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Four each</hi>, <hi rend="ital">by fours</hi>, <hi rend="ital">four at a time</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaternos denarios in singulas vini amphoras exegisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,007:5:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Font. 5, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">primam aciem quaternae cohortes ex V. legionibus tenebant,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>four from each legion</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saepe tribus lectis videas cenare quaternos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:4:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 4, 86</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n40050.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Four together</hi>, <hi rend="ital">four at once</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">propter bis quaternas causas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:1:6" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, 1, 6</bibl></cit>; Aus. ldyll. 10, 60; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sedul.</author> 2, 175</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 6, 17, § 64</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
quaternio: <entryFree id="n40051" type="main" key="qua^terni^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quăternĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>quaterni</etym>, <sense id="n40051.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the number four</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a quaternion</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 7, § 767</bibl>.— Esp., </sense><sense id="n40051.1" n="B" level="2"> On dice, <hi rend="ital">a quatre</hi> (postclass.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> 18, 65</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n40051.2" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A body of four soldiers</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a quaternion</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,005:12:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Act. 12, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
quatinus: <entryFree id="n40052" type="main" key="qua_ti^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quātĭnus</orth>, v. quatenus.</entryFree>
quatio: <entryFree id="n40053" type="main" key="qua^ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quătĭo</orth>, no <sense id="n40053.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <itype>quassum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>Sanscr. root, cyu-, to move, set in motion; cf. Gr. <foreign lang="greek">skeu=os,</foreign> instrument; <foreign lang="greek">skeua/zw,</foreign> to prepare</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to shake</hi> (class.; syn.: concutio, convello). </sense><sense id="n40053.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n40053.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=261" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 261</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">cum equus magnā vi caput quateret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:226" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 226</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pennas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:676" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 676</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:29:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 29, 53</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquas,</quote> <trans><tr>to agitate</tr>, <tr>disturb</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:18:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 18, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cymbala,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">catenas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:7:27:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 7, 27, 5</bibl></cit>: caput. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:400" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 400</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">comas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:14:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 14, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quercum huc illuc,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:329" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 12, 329</bibl></cit>.— <cit><quote lang="la">Of earthquakes: quatitur terrae motibus Ide,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:521" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 521</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid quateret terras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:15:71" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quatiens terram fragor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:1:536" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 1, 536</bibl></cit>.— <cit><quote lang="la">Of the ground, by treading, marching, etc.: campum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:875" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 875</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">campos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 513</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:1:297" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 1, 297</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quatitur tellus pondere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:4:199" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 199</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sonitu quatit ungula campum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:596" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 596</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pede ter humum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:1:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 1, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pede terram,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 4, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quatitur certamine circus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:16:323" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 16, 323</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n40053.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n40053.4" n="1" level="3"> Of arms, weapons, reins, etc., <hi rend="ital">to wield</hi>, <hi rend="ital">brandish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ply</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hold</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">securim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:656" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 656</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ensem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:1:429" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 1, 429</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aegida,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:12:336" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 336</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scuta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hastam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 124</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:16:415" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 16, 415</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:16:440" default="NO">16, 440</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">largas habenas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:17:542" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 17, 542</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verbera (i. e. flagella),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> Cul. 218</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n40053.5" n="2" level="3"> Of the body, breast, limbs, etc., <hi rend="ital">to agitate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shake</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cause to tremble</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">horror Membra quatit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">anhelitus artus et ora quatit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 199</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tussis pulmonem quatit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:14:601" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 14, 601</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terror praecordia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:2:254" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 254</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pectora quatit gemitu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:5:310" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 5, 310</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n40053.6" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To beat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">strike</hi>, <hi rend="ital">drive</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo quatietur certe cum dono foras,</quote> <trans><tr>to beat out of doors</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:3:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 3, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Arctophylax prae se quatit Arctum, Cic. poët. N. I). 2, 42, 109: cursu quatere equum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:132" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 132</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:12:254" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 12, 254</bibl>.—Of things: <cit><quote lang="la">quatiunt fenestras juvenes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:25:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 25, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scutum hastà,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:26:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 26, 1</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n40053.7" n="4" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To shake</hi>, <hi rend="ital">beat</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">break in pieces</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to batter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shatter</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbis moenia ariete quatere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">muros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:610" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 610</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">muros arietibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">turres tremendā cuspide,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:6:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 6, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tecta quatiuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:51:1" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 51, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">externas arces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:2:300" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 2, 300</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pergama,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:13:36" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 13, 36</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">tonitru quatiuntur caerula caeli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 96</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n40053.8" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to agitate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">more</hi>, <hi rend="ital">touch</hi>, <hi rend="ital">affect</hi>, <hi rend="ital">excite</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">est in animis tenerum quiddam quod aegritudine quasi tempestate quatiatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:6:12" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 6, 12</bibl></cit>: mentem, Hor. <cb n="QUAX" /> C. 1, 16, 5: <cit><quote lang="la">nec vultus tyranni Mente quatit solidā (justum virum),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 3, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non ego te Invitum quatiam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 18, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quatiunt oracula Colchos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:743" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 743</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">famā oppida,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:2:122" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 122</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quatit castra clamor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:231" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 3, 231</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tumultus pectora quatit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Thyest. 260" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Thyest. 260</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingenium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:9:13:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 9, 13, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum altissima quaterentur, hic inconcussus stetit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:94:3" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 94, 3</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n40053.9" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to plague</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vex</hi>, <hi rend="ital">harass</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quatere oppida bello,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:608" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 608</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">extrema Galliarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 28</bibl></cit>. — Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">quassus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> </sense><sense id="n40053.10" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">shaken</hi>, <hi rend="ital">beaten</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">broken in pieces</hi>, <hi rend="ital">battered</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shattered</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aula quassa,</quote> <trans><tr>a broken pot</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:3:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 3, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">muri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">naves,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 25, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">faces,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>pieces of pine-wood split up for torches</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:508" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 508</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rates,</quote> <trans><tr>shattered</tr>, <tr>leaky</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:8:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 8, 32</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 1, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">murra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:399" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 399</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:11:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 11, 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">harundo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">turres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Thyest. 568" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Thyest. 568</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">multo tempora quassa mero,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> R. Am. 146</bibl></cit>; cf. quasso, I. B. — </sense><sense id="n40053.11" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">quassā voce,</quote> <trans><tr>in a broken voice</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:7:20" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 7, 7, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">littera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:29" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 10, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">anima quassa malis,</quote> <trans><tr>broken down</tr>, <tr>exhausted</tr>, <tr>worn out</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Fur. 1308" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Fur. 1308</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quasso imperio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:15:7" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 15, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
quatriduanus: <entryFree id="n40054" type="main" key="qua^tri^du^a_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quătrĭdŭānus</orth>, v. quadriduanus.</entryFree>
quatriduum: <entryFree id="n40055" type="main" key="qua^tri^du^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quătrĭdŭum</orth>, v. quadriduum.</entryFree>
quatrieris: <entryFree id="n40056" type="main" key="qua_^tri^e_ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quā^trĭēris</orth>, v. quadrieris.</entryFree>
quatringenarius: <entryFree id="n40057" type="main" key="qua_^tringe_na_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quā^tringēnārĭus</orth>, v. quadringenarius.</entryFree>
quatrini: <entryFree id="n40058" type="main" key="qua_^tri_ni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quā^trīni</orth>, v. quadrini.</entryFree>
quatrio: <entryFree id="n40059" type="gloss" key="qua_^tri^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quā^trĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>quattuor</etym>, <sense id="n40059.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the number four</hi>, esp. on dice, <hi rend="ital">a four</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a quatre</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">jactus quisque apud lusores veteres a numero vocabatur, ut unio, binio, trio, quatrio, quinio, senio. Postea appellatio singulorum mutata est, et unionem canem, trionem suppum, quatrionem planum vocabant,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 18, 65</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
quatriremis: <entryFree id="n40060" type="main" key="qua_^tri^re_mis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quā^trĭrēmis</orth>, v. quadriremis.</entryFree>
quatrisextium: <entryFree id="n40061" type="gloss" key="qua_^tri^sexti^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quā^trĭsextĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>quattuorsextus</etym>, <sense id="n40061.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">four times sixfold</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Not. Tir.</author> p. 147</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
quattuor: <entryFree id="n40062" type="main" key="quattu^or"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quattŭor</orth>, less correctly <orth extent="full" lang="la">quātŭor</orth> (also written <orth extent="full" lang="la">quattor</orth>), <pos>num. adj.</pos> <etym>kindr. with Sanscr. catur; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">te/ttares</foreign> from <foreign lang="greek">te/tvares</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n40062.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">four</hi>: ter quattuor corpora, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:48:108" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 48, 108</bibl> (Ann. v. 96 Vahl.); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:1:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 3, 1, 102</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:chapter=5" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Univ. 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex centum quattuor centuriis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:22:39" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 22, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tria aut quattuor paria amicorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:4:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 4, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 3, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:5:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 5, 65</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:5:47" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 5, 47</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
quattuordeciens: <entryFree id="n40063" type="main" key="quattu^orde^ci^ens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quattŭordĕcĭens</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">quat-</orth>), <sense id="n40063.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">num. adv.</hi> [quattuordecim], <hi rend="ital">fourteen times</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">quattuordeciens centena,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 7, 13, § 84</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
quattuordecim: <entryFree id="n40064" type="main" key="quattu^orde^cim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quattŭordĕcim</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">quat-</orth>), <pos>num. adj.</pos> <etym>quattuor-decem</etym>, <sense id="n40064.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fourteen</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">partes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 14, 11, § 58</bibl></cit>: sedere in quattuordecim (sc. ordinibus), <hi rend="ital">to sit on the fourteen equestrian seats in the theatre</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to be a knight</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:39" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 39</bibl>; Asin. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:32:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 32, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 44" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 44</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n40064.1" n="2" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">ordinibus</hi> expressed, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:18:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 18, 44</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 2, 8, § 32</bibl>. — <cit><quote lang="la">In reverse order: decem quattuor (only in connection with larger numbers), censa ducenta decem quattuor milia hominum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:37:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 37, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:38:5" default="NO" valid="yes">28, 38, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:10:4" default="NO" valid="yes">34, 10, 4</bibl>; 34, 52, 7; cf. tredecim.</sense></entryFree>
quattuorprimi: <entryFree id="n40065" type="gloss" key="quattu^orpri_mi"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quattŭor-prīmi</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">quat-</orth>), <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n40065.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the four first decurions</hi> in the municipal administration (cf. decurio and decemprimi), written ĪĪĪĪ PRIMI, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 506</bibl>; Inscr. Viscont. Op. Var. 1, p. 80.</sense></entryFree>
quattuorsignani: <entryFree id="n40066" type="main" key="Quattu^orsigna_ni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Quattŭorsignāni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n40066.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an appellation of a part of the Tarbelli</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a tribe of Gauls</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 19, 33, § 108</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
quattuorviralis: <entryFree id="n40067" type="gloss" key="quattu^orvi^ra_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quattŭorvĭrālis</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">quat-</orth>), <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>quattuorviri</etym>, <sense id="n40067.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the</hi> quattuorviri, <hi rend="ital">who has been one of the</hi> quattuorviri, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 426, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
quattuorviratus: <entryFree id="n40068" type="main" key="quattu^orvi^ra_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quattŭorvĭrātus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">quat-</orth>), <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n40068.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the office of the</hi> quattuorviri (class.), Asin. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:32:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 32, 2</bibl>.—Abbreviated: ĪĪĪĪ VIR., Inscr. Marin. Fratr. Arv. p. 402.</sense></entryFree>
quattuorviri: <entryFree id="n40069" type="main" key="quattu^orvi^ri"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quattŭor-vĭri</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">quat-</orth>), <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n40069.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the board of four</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">a body of four men associated in certain official functions;</hi> thus, in Rome, for the superintendence of the highways, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:2:2" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 1, 2, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 773</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 3669</bibl>.— <cit><quote lang="la">In the municipia or colonies,</quote> <trans><tr>the board of chief magistrates</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:8:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 8, 25</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
quaxare: <entryFree id="n40070" type="gloss" key="quaxa_re"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quaxāre</orth> <itype>ranae dicuntur, cum vocem mittunt</itype> (<sense id="n40070.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to croak</hi>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=258" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 258</bibl> Müll. (collat. form to coaxare). <cb n="QUAX" /></sense></entryFree>
que: <entryFree id="n40071" type="main" key="que^"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quĕ</orth> (lengthened in arsis by the poets, like the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">te</foreign>: <sense id="n40071.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">Faunique Satyrique,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:193" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 193</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 10</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 484</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:91 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 91 al.</bibl>), <hi rend="ital">conj.</hi> enclitic [kindr. with Gr. <foreign lang="greek">te, ke,</foreign> and Sanscr. ca, the same], a copulative particle affixed to the word it annexes. According to Dräger (Hist. Synt. Th. 3, p. 32), it is, in archaic and official language, preferred to et, from which it is distinguished by denoting a closer connection. It is used, </sense><sense id="n40071.1" n="I" level="1"> Singly, to effect, </sense><sense id="n40071.2" n="A" level="2"> Co-ordination of words, </sense><sense id="n40071.3" n="1" level="3"> Of cognate meaning: <cit><quote lang="la">fames sitisque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:11:37" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 11, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">augeri amplificarique,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 11, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">admirabilis incredibilisque,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 22, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fuga pavorque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cibus victusque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">concilium coetusque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:23:84" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 23, 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res rationesque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:prol. 4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. prol. 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">blandimenta voluptatis otiique,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:1:1" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">extremum summumque supplicium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:66:section=169" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 66, § 169</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imperio auspicioque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:1:1" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">carus acceptusque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 12:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 12, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jus fasque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 5</bibl></cit>. — <cit><quote lang="la">Esp. in phrases like longe longeque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:21:68" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 21, 68</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:6:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 6, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">longe multumque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:14:40" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 14, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saepe diuque,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 13, 1</bibl></cit>. — With <hi rend="ital">comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">plus plusque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:3:6:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 3, 6, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magis magisque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:7:116" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 4, 7, 116</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">minus minusque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:prol. 18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. prol. 18</bibl></cit>; with <hi rend="ital">personal</hi> and <hi rend="ital">possessive pronouns</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">me meosque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:8:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 8, 4, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipse meique,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:6:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 6, 65</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and in archaic formulae: potes pollesque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vivunt vigentque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 25, 38</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n40071.4" n="2" level="3"> Of contrasted meaning: <cit><quote lang="la">jus nefasque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:5:87" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 5, 87</bibl></cit>: longe lateque, Naev. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 503</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cominus eminusque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ultro citroque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:66:section=170" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 66, § 170</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terrā marique,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 16, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferro ignique,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:11:14:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 11, 14, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pace belloque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">belli domique,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 230</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">domi ferisque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 85:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 85, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempus locusque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">parvis magnisque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:771" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 771</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">floribus coronisque,</quote> <trans><tr>flowers loose and bound up</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:4:5" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 4, 5</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n40071.5" n="B" level="2"> Adding a detail or explanation (not in Cic.). </sense><sense id="n40071.6" n="1" level="3"> General: <cit><quote lang="la">fratres consanguineosque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">largitiones temeritatisque invitamenta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad tempus non venit, metusque rem impediebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 70:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 70, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a fallaci equitum specie agasonibusque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:15:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 15, 7</bibl></cit>: Graeco peregrinoque sermone, Just. praef. 1. — </sense><sense id="n40071.7" n="2" level="3"> Special to general: <cit><quote lang="la">arma tantum ferrumque in dextris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:42:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 42, 8</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n40071.8" n="3" level="3"> General to special: <cit><quote lang="la">nostra consilia quaeque in castris gerantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obsides daturos quaeque imperasset facturos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">regno fortunisque omnibus expulit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 14:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 14, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Baliares levemque armaturam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 55</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n40071.9" n="C" level="2"> Introducing an explanatory clause, <hi rend="ital">and so</hi> (Liv.): <cit><quote lang="la">fretusque his animis Aeneas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Sabinusque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 45</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n40071.10" n="D" level="2"> In an answer (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">Ain heri nos adventisse huc? Aio, adveniensque ilico me salutasti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:2:167" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 2, 2, 167</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n40071.11" n="E" level="2"> Equivalent to quoque only in hodieque (not before Velleius): <cit><quote lang="la">quae hodieque appellatur Ionia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:1:4:3" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 1, 4, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae hodieque celebres sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:8:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 8, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in Abydi gymnasio colitur hodieque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:150" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 58, 59, §
